name: Tanelia Matthews
text: Every single visit always results in me sitting for extended periods of time even with an established appointment time. I think that it’s highly inconsiderate to not respect the patients’ time. Patients are often told to reschedule if they are more than 15 minutes late. How about if you are not called back within 15 minutes of your scheduled appointment time, then patients reschedule for the office to receive their insurance/self-pay money??? There needs to be a better strategy to the scheduling of this facility, so that every patient receives the appropriate care while having their time respected, as well. Everyone does not have 3+ hours of time to sit and wait for a simple doctor’s appointment.

name: Lauren Grzegorczyk
text:
Currently sitting in the parking lot, waiting for a phone appointment with PA Tammie Smith so I can refill important medication. Over an hour and a half ago during my check in, I was told there were 2 people ahead of me. 45 minutes past my appointment time, I’m told there is still 1 person ahead of me. My appointment time was at 1:40, and it is now past 3pm with still no phone call. These phone conferences have never taken more than 5-10 minutes.

I’ve  been coming here for two years, and it’s been absolutely god awful. Never have I been to a Clinic that is this consistency unprofessional, doesn’t pick up the phone half the time, and can easily have you waiting to be seen for up to 2hours, sometimes more. Always severely understaffed as well, which makes me feel bad for the few employees there that are actually kind and decent. If it were not for sliding scale, I would never come back. If you have insurance, avoid this place at all costs. Seriously.

Update: Finally had my phone conference and PA Tammie Smith was rude per usual! Shouldn’t expect anything more from a doctor with multiple 1 star reviews on webmd though, right?

name: cesar ibarra
text: We love our pediatrician at Huntsville Family Health Center.  Dr. Xavier is very thorough and has gone the extra mile when caring for my child- time and time again.  I feel at ease putting the care of my child in Dr. Xavier's hands.  Dr. Xavier listens to me, addresses my concerns, and asks the right questions.  Overall, I'm very satisfied with him and will continue to see him for all of my pediatric needs.

resp.text: Hi Cesar, thank you for your review.  At Huntsville Family Health Center, we strive for excellence in caring for our patients.  We will relay the positive words you shared about Doctor Niraj Xavier with the team.  Thank you for continuing to make us your preferred choice!

name: Michelle Robison
text: Get to appt on time yet always have an hour or more wait before getting called to the back and then still sit in the room longer waiting for the Dr.

name: Chad Chaney
text: Very helpful everytime I go . My wifes diabetic meds costs almost $4000.00 everywhere and here it costs under 100.00

resp.text: Hello Mr. Chaney, thank you for your review about the helpfulness of our team at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will certainly pass your comments along.

name: Tara Caputo
text: I love Dr. Kurecki and his office staff. He is easy to talk to and really listens! He has a lot of great advice, and I am not waiting 2 weeks to see him. He also has a very diverse background and a lot of medical knowledge. 10/10 recommend if you are looking for a family doc!

resp.text: Hi, Ms. Caputo. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We'll be sure to pass your comments along to our Huntsville Family Health Center team.

name: Sharon Murph
text: The NP was unfriendly, rushing and didn’t listen to my complaints. I want Dr. Lisabeth Williams back!!!

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Murph. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Please consider calling us at (855) 724-7325 so that we can directly address this. Thank you.

name: Nina Thomas
text: Joel is awesome I wish the rest of the staff was like him. He assisted us in ten minutes we had the results we’ve been trying to receive for 21 days no one ever answered the phone so we had to drive to the health center

resp.text: Hi Nina.  Thank you for your feedback.  It will be shared with our leadership team.

name: Sadie Lynch
text: Always a warm welcome doctor Williams is the best

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us here at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will pass your comments along to our team!

name: Jeanette Torres
text: The dr don’t know what they doing. They don’t really pay attention to what you want to say. The place is not sanitized right.im very unhappy with everything.

resp.text: Hi Jeanette Torres.   It is disappointing to learn that your experience was not positive, and we would like to get more details.  Please reach out to Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Kelley Cornelius
text: This office was absolutely laughable. The worst experience I have ever had at a physician's office.  They scheduled an MRI I arrive at the appointment to be sent away due to the fact that this office did not have the correct orders written.  Reschedule for the following week and again incorrect orders.  Mind you the place where I was having the MRI done also called multiple times and even physically went to this office to try to get things done.  Finally have the MRI done and they had the results the next day and two weeks later still no phone call about the results after I have called multiple times, left messages for a return phone call multiple times.  Then today I get someone FINALLY live on the phone and this person could not even pronounce the medical terminology, I ask to speak with someone else and she transfers me to an extension where the mailbox is full and I can't leave a message.  Soooo frustrated and changing to a new TRICARE provider.

resp.text: Hi Kelley, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We are disappointed to hear of your negative experience with us.  Your review will be provided to our leadership team for addressing.  In the meantime, please call Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you.

name: Madison Lowry
text: dr love does not listen and will talk over you. he is very rude and also likes to joke on you at your own expense. his nurses were phenomenal though and they’re the only reason HFHC isn’t getting 1 star.

resp.text: Hi Madison.  We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience.  We will share your feedback with our leadership team.  In the meantime, please consider calling our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234.

name: Sherry Black
text:
I am pretty sure it depends on who your doctor is, but... I never have to wait long when I go to my doctor! Rather I have an appointment or they are working me in, it is NEVER a long wait!
Dr Kurecki is my doctor & I think highly of him! I am very confident putting my health in his hands!

name: Matt Nieves
text: If it wasn't for how nice the doctor was w me I would've said 0 staff is very not proffesional and rude, the lady in the laboratory thinks she can treat everybody however she wants which not very proffesional I would not recommend this place

resp.text: Hello Matt.  Thank you for bringing this matter up to our attention.   Although you had a positive interaction with the doctor, we are disappointed to learn of your entire experience.  Please call our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234 so that we can properly document your concern.  Thank you.

name: noella hall
text: My husband has been going to Dr Kurecki for some time now. He has always been at ease and all issues discussed, we absolutely love him.

name: Tea Raine
text: I went my first time and was happy to get help. Staff was nice and caring.

name: Cheria Moore
text: The staff on the first floor were amazing and very polite! On the second floor the nurse practitioner was rude, displayed unprofessional behavior and I will not be returning to this clinic!

name: Rebecca Louthan
text: The staff is very unprofessional and rude. I have never in my life been treated so poorly before.

name: Airi Ventura
text: My partner spent over $60 round trip to get help for his medical issues here, waited for over two hours, and then got told that there's nothing he could do about it. No referrals to any specialists, nothing. Don't go here unless you have no other choice.

text: I love Dr. Kurecki and his office staff. He is easy to talk to and really listens! He has a lot of great advice, and I am not waiting 2 weeks to see him. He also has a very diverse background and a lot of medical knowledge. 10/10 recommend if you are looking for a family doc!

resp.text: Hi, Ms. Caputo. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We'll be sure to pass your comments along to our Huntsville Family Health Center team.

name: Sharon Murph
text: The NP was unfriendly, rushing and didn’t listen to my complaints. I want Dr. Lisabeth Williams back!!!

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Murph. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Please consider calling us at (855) 724-7325 so that we can directly address this. Thank you.

name: Nina Thomas
text: Joel is awesome I wish the rest of the staff was like him. He assisted us in ten minutes we had the results we’ve been trying to receive for 21 days no one ever answered the phone so we had to drive to the health center

resp.text: Hi Nina.  Thank you for your feedback.  It will be shared with our leadership team.

text: Always a warm welcome doctor Williams is the best

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us here at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will pass your comments along to our team!

name: Jeanette Torres
text: The dr don’t know what they doing. They don’t really pay attention to what you want to say. The place is not sanitized right.im very unhappy with everything.

resp.text: Hi Jeanette Torres.   It is disappointing to learn that your experience was not positive, and we would like to get more details.  Please reach out to Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Kelley Cornelius
text: This office was absolutely laughable. The worst experience I have ever had at a physician's office.  They scheduled an MRI I arrive at the appointment to be sent away due to the fact that this office did not have the correct orders written.  Reschedule for the following week and again incorrect orders.  Mind you the place where I was having the MRI done also called multiple times and even physically went to this office to try to get things done.  Finally have the MRI done and they had the results the next day and two weeks later still no phone call about the results after I have called multiple times, left messages for a return phone call multiple times.  Then today I get someone FINALLY live on the phone and this person could not even pronounce the medical terminology, I ask to speak with someone else and she transfers me to an extension where the mailbox is full and I can't leave a message.  Soooo frustrated and changing to a new TRICARE provider.

resp.text: Hi Kelley, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We are disappointed to hear of your negative experience with us.  Your review will be provided to our leadership team for addressing.  In the meantime, please call Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you.

text: dr love does not listen and will talk over you. he is very rude and also likes to joke on you at your own expense. his nurses were phenomenal though and they’re the only reason HFHC isn’t getting 1 star.

resp.text: Hi Madison.  We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience.  We will share your feedback with our leadership team.  In the meantime, please consider calling our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234.

Please call our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234 so that we can properly document your concern.  Thank you.

text: we have called for 3 days to just check on meds, no one ever answered the phone. we go down to the place to see what is going on, they did not have our order ready to pick up, because we couldn't get thru on the phone. while sitting there only one other person there as a customer, and 5 people working in the pharmacy, and not one of them would pick up the ringing phone, it rang and rang, over and over, not one of the workers there answered the phone WOW, someone really needs to take charge of this. people need their meds, and this is a really good walmart, but this is ridiculous. i will check on going else where now:(

text: Literally the worst pharmacy I’ve ever used. Edith is the rudest tech to ever speak to those suffering from mental illness. I am unsure how these people are allowed to keep a job.

name: Catarina Phillips
text: I gave them my insurance info and they didn’t use it, and told me I had to go to the drop off counter for them to correct their mistakes. I chose to pay rather than wait any longer than I already had. I understand it was busy, but I’ve worked in customer service, and the medical field, and you always work with the patient and customers to fix YOUR mistake especially when they have been sitting in front of you for 30 minutes waiting on their medications for a tooth extraction. I chose to just pay rather than continue to argue with the cashier, whose fault it wasn’t. If you are at the drop off counter and someone gives you their insurance information you should probably be competent enough to enter it in. Unfortunately, this has happened before at other Walmart’s as well. I would recommend going anywhere else, because I’ve never had that happen at Publix, CVS, or Walgreens.

text: I've been using Professional Pharmacy for many years. I was looking for a Pharmacy that compounded medications locally and they were the only one in Walker County Alabama. They have a program for customers like me with multiple prescriptions to fill each month, where they will be scheduled to fill the same day  each month. Going to the  pharmacy once a month is great in my book. They are only open 5 days a week, which is okay with me. I remember working and looking forward to the weekend. If you need a pharmacy, for one day a month or many times a month.  I recommend the good people at Professional Pharmacy

name: Margaret Whisenant
text: I have to buy a certain kind of tape for my dog's ears that I got cropped. A week ago I called this Pharmacy and ordered the two different types of tape that I need. Went to go pick it up and candy and another lady were very helpful and told me anytime I needed the tape to just give them a call and they would order it for me again. There were issues that day with getting the tape to ring up in their system. But they worked it out. Came in a week later to get the same tape that I had called previously to get them to order for me and the owner Rita decided to charge me more for it. So apparently the owner thinks it's okay just to jack up the price whenever she wants to on a very simple item such as tape! She even told her worker that the previous amount that I was charged was too cheap.

It is out of my way to use them but I just can't switch because they have been so good to me and my family!

name: Yvonne Self
text:
I went there to get my third vial of insulin after Publix told CVS they only had two. CVS wouldn't sell me my usual three saying "the system had kicked me out." I believe that was the phrase the clerk used. The reason given was that it was too expensive! My copay was only $70--much less than I have paid when in the GAP. I was totally out of insulin.

CVS called Publix and was told they only had two vials. My daughter drove me there and I paid $70 with my debit card. I was told to come back for the third. I went there Friday, the 14th of June and was told they had no knowledge that I only received two vials. Then they refilled my prescription for three vials without my request. I wish now that I had refused and walked away. I am now using a privately-owned pharmacy. I am beginning to get used to being taken advantage of being old, but I do not appreciate it. The young men were laughing. Cute.

Yvonne Self

text: I take generic Mobic for my arthritis. Last month they were filled at Publix. For the entire month it was easy to tell it was not working. I went back to my normal pharmacy and instantly started feeling better. Turns out they use medication manufactured in the USA and Publix comes  from  a  overseas corporation  and is manufactured  elsewhere  as well. Upon researching  this some. They have a history of exactly  my issue with various drugs. And apparently  with cleanliness  as well. My family deserves better and Publix  pharmacy  is not it. Very dissatisfied  especially  after a month in pain due to substandard  pharmaceuticals. Wonder what The billboard guy is up too?

name: Tracy Lee
text: Two years ago, I had to swap pharmacies because the one I was going to stopped carrying my brand of birth control. While I was leery of trying a new pharmacy, I was even more leery of trying a new contraception. So, I called Sheltons to give them all of our information. Already, I was pleased to have wonderful customer service over the phone. A few times going in and Chase Shelton putting a name with a face, I can walk in now and him tell me, “Hey Mrs. Wolfe. We got that prescription ready for you now,” without saying a word. I have asked Chase and one of his awesome staff members, Josh, more questions than I do the doctor when I am sick or someone I love is sick. Chase is very knowledgeable, professional and at the same time very approachable. And, as awesome as all those qualities are, the reason I come back every single time and recommend him to family and friends, is because Chase is truly honest. Chase is not there to make a profit; Chase is there to make a difference. As some of my children get to an age where they can drive themselves around and one has a child of their own, they continue to go to Chase for their needs and their children’s needs. So long as Sheltons pharmacy is around, I will not do business anywhere else. Chase will have my business as long as he’s in the business. I couldn’t be happier about the first pharmacy no longer carrying my medicine. Thank you, Sheltons Pharmacy, for taking such great care of me and my family.

name: Richard Sorrell
text: The staff is, friendly, informative, efficient. They are always eager to answer questions. Prescriptions are filled promptly.

name: C Taylor
text: Love this small town pharmacy. Mr. Shelton who runs the pharmacy is all about his customers. Once he meets you,he won't forget your name. We moved to the area about 9 months ago. I thought I would get my prescription here temporarily but once I came in I understood why the residents love him. The one time he and his staff were closed due to a funeral, my son just happened to be sick. Our pediatrician had called in a prescription and once I went by to pick it up I realized they weren't open. I assumed I would have to wait until the following day but no, he came by our house with the prescription in hand!! I can't say it enough, Shelton Pharmacy is the exceptional. If he doesn't know how to answer a question, he will find out. You can't go wrong here. My family and I will always have our prescriptions filled here.

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. Taylor. We have enjoyed getting to know you and your family.

text: Dr. Miller is very cruel and uncaring. This is the most unprofessionally run doctor’s office I’ve ever been to. They treated me with disrespect and the nurse actually laughed at my concerns. I went in after moving from Soith Alabama in order for me to keep receiving a very vital prescription that I need to function on a daily basis. They e-scribed the meds to the Walmart pharmacy in Jasper. Well, the Walmart pharmacy was going to have to order it and it would take three days. Well, I needed the meds that day because I had started a new job and needed the meds to function properly and hold down my job. So, I called Dr. Miller to ask her to e-scribe it to the CVS. Well, it’s now three days later and Dr. Miller still hasn’t e-scribed the medicine. I’ve never in my life been treated so disrespectfully by a medical staff in my life. Luckily, my doctor’s office in my old town e-scribed the script in for me or else I would have eventually lost my job waiting on Dr. Miller. This clinic is a JOKE. The people who work there are a JOKE.

name: Brandy Reynolds
text: I went here nearly 5 months ago after a bad spat of bronchitis, upper respiratory infection and lung infection. I had a horrible cough during that and developed a hard pressure in the upper center part of my stomach which is pushing on my ribs and heart (possibly vagus nerve) I explained all of this to the doctor that I seen and told him I was having problems breathing since it started, much worse when I sat down. I also explained to this doctor that I had been taking meds for migraines but had ran out and needed a refill. Once this doctor found out I was a smoker, he seemed to not even care at all. He blamed everything on smoking. I had my 12 year old son in the room at the time and this doctor literally drew a graph of how long I was going to live on the bed paper. He terrified my son!!! I knew then I'd never see that man again! Instead of checking to see what the pressure was and instead of refilling a med I had been taking for 12 years he put me on Buspar. The first night I took that Buspar the pressure increased so bad I could hardly move! I'm also now having to take bp meds since all of this. I'm 34 years old, I should not have all of this going on and for it to hit like it did all at once. And instead of this doctor trying to help me he terrified my son! He also prescribed me Naproxen which luckily I didn't take because I went to St. Vincent where they done at egd and found I have chronic gastritis as well as reflux esophagitis so the Naproxen could have caused a stomach bleed... I've seen another doctor here who is better than the first but I am still having the same issues. I'm honestly believing a stuck hiatal hernia or something else has been missed. The new doc put me on zantac which didn't help either. I feel no better, in fact I feel worse than when I did when I went to try and get help here about 5 months ago. As far as the staff, nurses and other docs they are great. The first doc I saw I would not recommend to my worst enemy!

name: Marion Moore
text:
Rude kids working there that are not customer service oriented and need to be fired. I go to drop off and pick up a prescription. I'm standing behind a man in the drop off section where you drop off prescriptions. The man is here to pick up a bunch of supplies. The amateur pharmacist hands him a big plastic bin then goes back behind the counter. The man is standing there stuffing everything in a box to tape up. The pharmacist then happens to notice me and asks from behind the computer if I'm here to drop off and I said yes. She rudely said well I'll fill it when he's through. I'm trying to ask important questions but she's rudely not paying much attention.
I leave and come back. The same girl hands the prescription over to another girl mumbling this is for that girl over there. The pharmacist approaches me and seems to acknowledge mt existence so I begin to tell her that along with the dropoff we had a call in. But she rudely talked over my shoulder to someone behind me if she could help her and started waiting on her instead. I told her I was here first and would report them. The pharmacist handed my prescription back saying they wouldn't fill my prescription and tried to say I was just being hostile. In order to get waited on I had to speak to a manager. Fire these two girls and hire people who are customer oriented and will work.

name: Harold Tidwell
text:
My experience with this business organization, and that is what they are, has been nothing but excellent.
I owned my own business for 25 years, in which we went from  $32 from my 1st recorded sale, to over $10,000,000 in sales per year, so I know a little about customer service. Anyway, from the very first time I walked into the Kroger Pharmacy, on Old Madison Pike, Madison, AL, I received nothing but the very best customer experience a person could have. So, the lady who greeted me at the pharmacy counter asked me if she could help me. I told her I didn’t know if I should use an on line pharmaceutical discount group or my on medical insurance. She was very patient and thorough and even took the time to ask another person to look over what she had found. The answer was, there was only pennies difference.  In addition to that experience, my prescriptions have always been exactly what I ordered, available, as requested or refilled. I believe, because of my many years in business, that good service doesn’t just happen, but is rewarded out of excellent management. So , I would like to thank, just a few of the folks who are making that happen at has now become, “my pharmacy”. Trina, Bari and Katrina, thank you.

name: Victoria Ahrendsen
text: I’ve been going to this particular Kroger Pharmacy for 5-6 years, and have never had any issues.

name: Michelle Stiles
text: Very efficient and helpful.

name: Ryan Schick
text: Every time I come to get my prescription, I have to wait at the counter 5-10 mins before someone even serves me only to find out half the time that my auto fill hasn’t processed because “my prescription has changed”. My girlfriend also experiences the same thing and she never had a problem at the Kroger on Hwy 72. I don’t know why the service is so consistently bad at this one, but I am transferring to the Walgreens across the street.

name: Karlton S
text: I've been using this pharmacy for about 15 years. They do a very accurate job in filling prescriptions and ensuring the insurance and rebates are filed correctly. The staff is friendly and handle the crowds well. (If they aren't fast enough, then it's because they are careful: a good thing!)

name: Cortney Smith
text: The vast majority of my visits here are pretty quick, and the staff is always friendly. I've been using them since this Kroger opened and they're just as good as other chain grocery store pharmacies in the area. They get backed up or slow every once in a while but it hasn't been a consistent thing and never been an issue for me! I was surprised to see a low rating on here -- I don't think they deserve it!

name: JM McK
text: The drive-thru pharmacy is consistently bad; this last time, I waited 12 minutes at the window before anyone acknowledged me - and three different techs looked right at me. My prescriptions are always filled accurately, but the customer service is sub-par. I would go elsewhere in a heartbeat if it wasn’t for the Kroger fuel point rewards.

name: Amanda K
text: The drive through has almost always been a bad experience-long waits and poor customer service. If you go inside, it’s better service and much faster.

name: Lana
text:
This pharmacy is terrible! On two separate occasions I have received prescriptions in which the labels on the box were previously filled for another person and then ripped off (after sitting in the pick-up bin for weeks) and then my child’s prescription label is placed on top. Both occasions the boxes were torn/damaged and I was expected to buy this prescription for my child because the Pharmacist promised, “It has never been returned, the box is damaged but the medicine had never been used.”

This place has horrible practices and I immediately called my child’s doctor and had them transfer all his prescriptions to Walgreens down the street. So far I have received exceptional service from Walgreens and the Pharmacy Technician calls to confirm, prior to filling/labeling my child’s prescriptions. Kroger Management needs to look into how the pharmacy is being managed because it’s being managed poorly, in my opinion.

name: Jason Cavanaugh
text: I had Oral surgery on my wisdom tooth and they told me my script would be ready in a hour and a half and it's been 2 hours I am in Soo much pain and they don't have my mads ready. If you looking for good service this ain't the place

name: Tony Franks
text:
They are understaffed or just don't care. I'm leaning toward the latter. I was 4th in line at the drive through. It took me 39 mins to get to the window. Then I witnessed the staff Waite in 5 customers. Finally 53 minutes later. The prices are confusing. Only using them since CVS no longer takes blue Cross, I will find a new pharmacy asap. Even if I have to drive to Huntsville.
.

name: Lana Atkinson
text: Extremely slow! Fixing to change.

name: Amy Balentine
text: Very poor customer service. The whole staff is very rude. Especially during the weekends. The pharmacist actually hung up on me during a phone call.

name: Barbara Prewett
text:
Westside pharmacy, Is wonderful !! Been going here since they opened their doors... They care and know their customers..
Dawn  is a great owner & everyone is extremely pleasant..  Very fast in filling your Percreptions and will fit your needs..

name: Jessica Farmer
text: My first visit to this pharmacy & I was very pleased. I was greeted very politely, almost immediately after opening the door. The isles were neatly organized with just the perfect items that one should come to a pharmacy for. Other pharmacies here in town pack the shelves, counters, walls, & etc. With all types of unnecessary items that are pushed to sale & the items are most definitely not "drug store" or "pharmacy" appropriate! This can be very overwhelming to some. Westside pharmacy was free of clutter & stocked with the appropriate items that bring people to make a visit to a pharmacy in the first place. Anyhow, I handed my prescription to the pharmacist & provided very little but needed personal info for my first time visit. I was told my prescription would be ready in just a few minutes. They immediately started working it and in less than 5 mins, my prescription was completed, handed over, then totaled out (extremely reasonable cost for what I had filled) & on my way out the door. Definitely, a pleasing atmosphere, smiling friendly faces, & affordable prescriptions. I actually saved money here compared to elsewhere. I have filled same exact prescription in the past with other pharmacies in town & paid almost more than double of what these guys charged me.

name: Danette Dixon
text: I 've been using this pharmacy for about seven or eight years.Never had a bad experience. Great customer service , nice clean store.if you have questions an want a family environment visit this pharmacy.

name: Teri Ormes
text: Miss Dawn and her crew are THE BEST!!!  Fast and and always friendly!!!!  Love them.

name: kimberly arnold
text: Great hometown pharmacy!  Reasonably priced and easy to work with!  Definitely recommend!

name: Debra Strickland
text: Love going to see Dawn West at Westside pharmacy. They are always fast and no long lines like wal*****

name: Misty Loffer
text: Great customer service!

name: Frodo Bags
text: these folks are the bomb!!!!!!!!

name: Curtis Jenkins
text: Home away from home.

name: Ronnie Adams
text: Great place to live

name: American Transmission
text: Well apparently it has been closed down 30 years and a friend of mine we will call him Shanen kilagorn said to just bring it down there (he was suppose to be my friend for past ten years and has got me out of some bad situations so I trusted him)&worst come worst he had a transmission out of a wrecked car that was his (he DONT own the shop but is the right hand man) well my boyfriend drove the car down there from empire(even got lost once and it still made it) I asked them to put on sensors (when I could get ahold of him, he never would give me real owners number said he didn't have one (LIE!) well after 2 months of "Shanen" telling me my 2002 accord ex was junk and a transmission had been put in it three times (but wouldn't send me the proof) well we went to get it the battery had been switched the gas had been suffiled out and oil and had been poured all over motor. We had to get it towed out of there

text: They gave me my Klobuchar. They hurt me mommy they hurt me 😢

name: Joshua Hullender
text: Fast,  kind and helpful.

name: Carla Thrift
text: Walmart gets a lot of saving. Make sure you ask to see the 4 dollar list for minor drugs. Awesome staff, friendly and helpful. Even if you have questions for cold meds, lotions, vitamins, etc, they will still help

name: Nick Jones
text: Walmart pharmacy should have a policy that they should check if the prescripton is in stock before transferring an out of state prescription to their store!!! If you cared about your customers you would!! They didnt have it in stock so they told me at the end of the business day, when i had brought it in before lunch! They told me to go to emerging home care. Went there and they told me i couldnt get it transferred again within 90 days and that transfer or i needed a new prescription from a vet.i have just moved her from florida and havnt had a chance to get him seen here . My vet is florida and cannot transfer it without an alabama license. Threfore i think it is ridiculous that they dont check if it is stock before they transfer. I would have taken it somewhere else. My dog is suffering from seizures every hour and no other remedy will work..... Thanks alot

name: Jason Brown
text: Slow slow slow, poor customerservice when it comes to taking care of the next in line.... Will not be back more recommend this group of people that would rather gossip to one any other than work on filling customers prescriptions...

text: Store is in shambles, the pharmacy is closing. Management is useless as well as the employees. Not even worth going in to as there is barely anything left on the shelves and they claim everything is on sale...nothing is, it's still regular price. Don't waste your time.

name: Evans Murphy
text: Useless, lazy and rude staff. Dirty and unorganized store. Absolutely unacceptable service. Welcome to Wilcox county packaged into a dollar store.

name: Louise Ramsey
text: The manager Travis Jackson is very rude and he don't like black people and Bobbie See she very rude also and they both don't do any work it's only two Great Workers in there They names are Terry Thompson and Elecia Combs the rest of the workers are Very very lazy

text: Don't have to many clothing items but lots of furniture and other items

text: Unorganized, cramped and dirty.

name: Bonnie Forshee
text: Have been using Jones pharmacy since 1995. They treat me like family. Always eager to get you the help you need.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Dean Mashburn
text: I went by there the other day to get a prescription filledit's been years since I did business with Joneses back when Gerald was therewill I have stage 4 kidney cancer and I have a prescription of pain medications that I've had for 5 years with Medicaid and Medicare paying the billI had problems at my old pharmacy because they mixed pain medication on me one was oxycodone 10 and the other was methadone 10 and people know that that can't happen but it did and it could have turned out badJones's did not fill my prescription and told me that my insurance would not pay for it after I've been on it for for 5 yearsstage 4 kidney cancer and wouldn't feel my pain med Gerald would have a fit if he knew that maybe he will read this comment why tell a lie because it's easy to tell shame on you Jones's pharmacy

resp.text: We're awefuly sorry that you had to go through this. Please contact your doctor and let him know that you would like to change pharmacies, and at that time, we would get your prescriptions, and would be happy to fill them from now on. I know that it's a set back but we have to abide by the laws that are in place now.

name: Jason Plunkett
text: Love the family, and the staff that works there. However, they have the option to refill prescriptions online. The last 4 out of 5 times I have tried it hasn't worked. Was there yesterday AFTER requesting refills, now have to go back today. Fix the issue, or lose the option.

resp.text:
We apologize for this, but we had already let everyone know that the website was being worked on and updated and would be down for at least a week. Again I'm so sorry you had this issue.
Our website has been upgraded to handle any load and we are proud to continue to serve the Arab area. Thank you for staying loyal!

name: Ginny Caspar
text: Phone rings six times then goes to a busy signal.

resp.text: We are sorry that you had that issue. We were having problems with the phone system that day. This has been rectified. We are always looking to better our services, thank you for your review.

name: Teresa Anthony
text: Local/Family owned pharmacy, great customer service with caring Tech's & Pharmacist. They also have a great selection of baby & bridal gifts!

name: Celeste Hall
text: Friendly, personable, they always go out of there way to meet our needs.

name: Michael Wood
text: Their pharm techs are all very nice and polite. Their for some meds are somewhat less than most chain pharmacies, but for the most part, are somewhat comparable to most chain pharmacies. What I love most about them is that they *actually* stock a lot of the older and more obscure medications that pretty much every other pharmacy I've been to has had to order every time I'd fill it, and *if*, by chance, they don't have a medication, they will order it *immediately* and usually have it in the next day, unlike the bigger chain pharmacies, which usually place all their orders for medications on a certain day of the weak, leaving you to wait several days and up to a week before getting your medication. They were always on top of ordering one of my  meds they didn't stock regularly, and having it for me by the next day, even if the next day was Saturday, whereas at CVS, I had to wait until a certain day of the week, usually Tuesday I think, to get it. One disadvantage is that they don't store coupons on file, so if you have a coupon, e.g., for a brand-name medication, you need to bring it with you every time you fill it. But I don't even consider this an inconvenience because of how convenient they make filling my prescriptions.

name: Mark Green
text: Friendly, attentive and knowledgeable staff. This is what a local business should be!

name: Milinda Giddy
text: Hometown friendly

name: nancy thomason
text: Friendly people

name: Shannon Ball
text:
Notice all good reviews are from employees?!  Hmmm

Recruiter reached out and kept having to reschedule the call. Then after stating I’d be a great fit for this database administrator and mentioning other roles, even discussing salary - he went radio silent, for weeks now.

Leading people on is very cruel and extremely unprofessional.  Says a lot about the company as a whole. You’re dealing with people’s lives here! I’m glad I didn’t get the job after seeing how they treat candidates.

name: Caitlin B
text:
Notice all of the 5 star reviews are from company employees...

I have been on the same medication for 10+ years with no issues from my prior insurance company. After calling numerous times, spending hours on the phone, and getting a different answer from each rep, I was informed that my request was denied. Not because I didn’t have the correct diagnosis but because they are demanding I try a list of generic medications first. AKA they are too cheap to pay for my prescription. They do not care about withholding medication from you, they are just looking to save $$ wherever possible. STAY AWAY FROM RXBENEFITS.

name: Nathaniel Shaw
text: Most complicated benefits/insurance company I have ever dealt with. I've dealth with 3 insurance companies through 3 different employers over the last 10 years. Favorite line for anyone in customer service is "We are not set up for that." Gives me the feeling that RxBenefits is not set up to effectively conduct business the way the rest of their industry is. If you have any say so in the situation, avoid RxBenefits. Our company insurance is by far the best insurance I've ever had, their achilles heel is RxBenefits.

name: Sydney Stein
text:
I just hit my one year with RxBenefits as my employer and I cannot express the gratitude I have for working at such an amazing company. They truly care about their employees because they take action to prove they care.

I am fortunate enough to work remotely, which allows me the flexibility to maintain a busy lifestyle. RxBenefits has never made me feel separate being remote because the community within our company really comes together to make everyone feel welcome. When I visit the corporate office, I feel right at home with my peers and management, it's as if I never left from my previous visit.

If taking care of their employees wasn't enough, they also take tremendous care of their clients and members, making sure customer service is top notch, as well as making sure that everything they need is provided.

name: Kelly Franklin
text:
Two years ago I quite my at a fortune 100 company so that I could come work at RxBenefits.  It was the best decision I could have made.  They care deeply about their employees and show that through many different ways.  Whether it is through amazing health insurance benefits, fun competitions or giving us off on Black Friday every year so we can go shopping and spend time with our families!

RxBenefits not only cares about their employees, they care about their clients and members as well.  They do whatever they can to please the clients and members.  They strive to be the best and it shows!

name: Bill Weir
text: RxBenefits has been an amazing place to work.  I have the opportunity to work remotely which allows extreme flexibility with family life especially with young kids in day care and school.  I have all the resources at my fingertips and the support is tremendous from my managers, HR and to IT.  I was nervous about leaving my previous job to come to a new company 8 months ago but now I am so glad I made the switch.  The company really values their employees and its growing at an incredible rate for good reason!

name: Suzanne Stone
text:
I was told that RxBenefits was a wonderful company to work for, so I left a company that I had been employed with for 10 years to join the RxB team. It was the BEST professional/career decision I have ever made!

This company truly cares about their employees and their clients. I have never been fortunate enough to work for a company that supports and encourages their employees the way they do....until now. Being employed with RxBenefits has been a blessing for me and my family. Happy, happy, happy to be a part of this wonderful company!

name: John (Jack) Meineke
text:
RxBenefits was my first job out of college and I am extremely grateful that they took a chance on me!  I was nervous to join the “real world” but after the first couple months I felt right at home!
My manager is extremely supportive, kind and genuinely cares about me as an individual. I have the most amazing work-life balance, even though my role is demanding. All the Senior team, including the CEO are approachable, helpful, caring and WORK HARD. Unlike many Senior teams they are all happy to help in anyway they can! I am lucky to be involved in such a forward thinking, ambitious company.

name: Adrianne Moultrie
text: This is an awesome company with exceptional leaders.  RxBenefits is a family oriented company, and they take great care of their employees. From holiday parties, weddings/birthdays/baby showers, and even in tragic moments, RxBenefits make sure to embrace us and let us know that they are here for us just as we are for our clients. I feel great about how we serve our clients, and how we serve each other.

name: Monica Gindhart
text: RxBenefits is a wonderful place to work. They truly understand the value of their employees and show it every day. Not only do they value their employees but they value their clients unlike any other company in the industry. Their unique approach to provide benefits to their clients sets them apart in the industry. I would highly recommend working for or working with RxBenefits.

name: Kelcei Chamberlain
text: I am grateful and proud to be a part of RxBenefits.  Our company's leadership truly values each employee.  This appreciation motivates me to work harder and take pride in my work.  We are a family.  A family that cares about our customers, each other and our community.  You would be hard pressed to find a better group of people.

name: Jodi Jones
text: I have worked at RxBenefits for almost three years and have personally experienced the culture that RxBenefits takes so much pride in. They offer competitive wages, flexible schedules and a positive work environment.  With the companies rapid growth, there is great opportunity for personal growth and development and I am proof of that. RxBenefits has provided me the opportunity to grow and expand my knowledge in four different areas since I started working for the company. I am very grateful for the opportunity to be part of the RxBenefits team!

name: Madison Music
text: RxBenefits is an amazing place to work. We have so much room for growth and opportunity. They are a family oriented company and they value every employee. I have been with RxBenefits for the past 10 years and I love it! Best place to work!!

name: Wendy Bruce
text: RxBenefits is not just a company - it is a family.  The training and support you receive from both management and your co-workers is amazing. Everyone here truly wants you to succeed - just like family! But the best part is that since I have joined RxBenefits, I now enjoy real work-life balance.

name: Deepan vishnu
text:
Company is on track of consistent growth on business, latest technology improvements.
Best management team.
Good health insurance plans.
Overall great place to work and learn.
Along with other employees and I am one of the happy employee to work here.

name: Sarah Petty
text: I joined the RxBenefits team in June 2019 it is the best professional decision I have made.  This is a great company to be apart of, from the top down everyone cares about each other and that is evident in the day to day interactions as well as decisions that are made which impact the work force.  The company is seeing tremendous growth and I am proud to tell others that I work at RxBenefits.

name: Cortney Newman
text: I tell people all the time RxBenefits is the most genuine company to work for.  I have been here for 3 years.  I can truly say they care about each employee.  The encourage you to grow and help you achieve whatever goal you have within your career.  I LOVE this company!

name: Megan C
text: I have been working for the company since September and it has been the best move in my professional career. RxBenefits truly cares for their employees and wants the best for everyone, professionally and personally. Everyone that I have encountered within the company has been wonderful and they push you to the be the best version of yourself! I highly recommend this company to anyone who is looking for a new career path!

name: matt ford
text: RxBenefits is a wonderful place to work -- welcomed and included from day one into a team-oriented, collaborative group. In fact, I just told my wife and family how much "I love my job". It is also very exciting to experience the growth our company and value we bring to our customers.

name: Nina Fuller
text: RxBenefits is a great place to work. Only been here for 6 Fabulous months and the people are Awesome. On the first day they make you feel part of the family. Working in Client Service we are team oriented. Happy to come to work everyday to see what adventure we're having for the day.

name: Jeremy Kizzire
text: RxBenefits has been my favorite place to work since I started my full-time career over 25 years ago. The teamwork and camaraderie are second-to-none. I could tell on my first day of work that this is a company that emphasizes training their employees and making sure they are fully-equipped to succeed. I enjoy coming to work every day and learning more from my teammates and managers.

name: Kipzya Zlotkus
text: Around 6 months ago I decided to leave my previous company that I had been at for almost 10 years.  It was a tough decision since I had so much history there. However, I found a new home right away at RxBenefits. My favorite thing about RxBenefits are the people, they have the best company culture I have ever experienced in my career.  My colleagues are team players and will always go the extra mile to ensure that we are providing excellent service to the groups we are onboarding. Additionally, the company is growing exponentially so there is a lot of room for career growth and advancement. Lastly, the company really cares about their employees and show us they value us by providing great benefits amongst other ways.

name: Jason Robinson
text: RxBenefits is a fantastic place to work.  When I walked in the door the first day, everything was on-boarded including my laptop and access immediately.  The company provides "swag" to include RxBenefits backpack, free beverages, etc.  The type of work is challenging.  We are using the right tools to make a difference in the marketplace.  Best of all is that they employees are friendly which makes this a great place to work!

name: Debra Fowler
text:
As one of the newer teammates to join RxBenefits, I am struck by a couple of key points - valuing the client, the broker and our teams,  going the extra mile to ensure the experience for clients and members are smooth and result in solutions that make their lives healthier, easier and their pharmacy benefits a better value while providing the right benefits at the right time at the right cost for members.

As far as taking care of it's teammates, I am struck by the acts of teamwork and recognition of the work it takes to serve our business.

name: Laura Leigh Etheridge
text: I have been fortunate to work at RxBenefits for the past nine years.  Everyone in our organization contributes to the success of our company.  We are committed to doing what is best for our clients and work hard to ensure that they are taken care of.  Our leadership team is the absolute best and genuinely care about their employees.  Thank you RxB family!

name: Deidre Jenkins
text: RxBenefits has the best work environment I have experienced. Our casual environment makes it easy to come in and perform your job well. Let me not forget that we offer some of the best savings out there for our clients.

name: Mike Moody
text: I joined RxBenefits in June 2019 and can't believe that I found this company.  My recruiter worked on me for several months before we finally got things moving.  RxBenefits is everything the recruiter presented and then some.  The training is second to none and everyone in our company is fantastic.  No matter your position within the organization everyone you meet is willing to help you.  I can't say enough good times about the company and I'm blessed to be part of such a wonderful organization.

name: Shannon McAnulty
text: One of my favorite things about working at RxBenefits is the brilliant (and fun!) people I get to collaborate with to bring effective and cost-saving solutions to our clients. We do things the right way, with value and integrity, and I think our clients and broker partners would agree. Leadership listens to feedback from employees to make our working environment one of the best in the business. Working remote can sometimes make you feel like you're on an island. RxB makes sure to keep everyone connected through technology and communication. We have fun and work hard. Easily the best opportunity I've had in my career thus far.

name: Laura Kayvonfar
text: A little less than two years ago I took a chance and left my position at another company. It was the best decision I have ever made. RxBenefits has not only given me a love for my job but an excellent career path for my future. Since starting at RxBenefits I have grown tremendously and moved up within the company. I was looking for a place to grow and stay and that is what I found! RxBenefits is a pharmacy consulting firm that specializes in customer and client care. Our white glove services focuses on not only the client but their employees to give all around service that you won't find anywhere else in the pharmacy benefit industry. RxBenefits cares for their employees as much as they do their clients which makes for a wonderful work environment. Happy employees make happy clients and RxBenefits has just that. Check it out and see what RxBenefits may be able to do for your team as well!

name: Melissa Dienhart
text: This company cares about its clients, members and employees.  They prove it everyday. From the top leadership on down they continue to demonstrate service and doing the right thing is a priority. The teamwork and supportive management have truly impressed me. I left a Fortune 50 company to come work at RxBenefits 6 months ago and could not be happier.

name: Nicole Jenkins
text: RxBenefits truly goes above and beyond for their employees and their customers!  I have been with the company for 3 years and have never worked anywhere that could even hold a candle to RxB.  The benefits, flexibility, support from management, awesome co-workers and just the overall professional growth I have experienced are beyond comparison.  There is no doubt that I enjoy coming to work everyday and, as a bonus, we have a lot of fun too!

name: Lisa Shockley
text: I have worked for 20 years in the pharmacy benefit management industry and I can truly say RxBenefits is THE best company I have worked with.  This company truly cares about making a positive difference and providing the utmost in service and industry knowledge to its' clients.  Additionally, they make it a point to take incredible care of their employees and always make us feel special and appreciated.  I am truly blessed to be a part of this organization!

name: Karleen Dietrich
text: More than three years ago, I had the extreme pleasure of making the move to work at RxBenefits and I couldn't be happier. Great work environment, great colleagues, great values, and great leadership.  By far the best place to work -- and we've proven that by earning the Best Places to Work award multiple times.

name: mandi biershenk
text: Having been an employee with RxBenefits for a short time, I cannot be more thankful for the team I have joined.  Upper management strives to make everyone feel important and like our jobs matter.  I truly enjoy working for such a giving company. They strive to do great things for the community as well as their employees!  I'm happy to be a part of the RxB Team!

name: Craig Cooper
text: Family oriented company that provides all of the training and tools needed to succeed.  Employees are treated extremely well while hard work is recognized and appreciated.  This environment has helped build an awesome team of people that works hard to help RxBenefits deliver best-in-class service while also helping employers to control Rx spend.

name: Adam S b s SAE ax ex xsdedx
text: RxBenefits is a fantastic place to work! I believe we provide a superior pharmacy solution that helps both our clients and our clients’ members. I have never been with a company with such a positive and supportive culture.

name: Austyn Martin
text: I just started RxBenefits 3 months ago and it was the best decision I've ever made! The team was so helpful and welcoming. The atmosphere is so positive that I enjoy coming into work every day. I love the work our company does and the people involved!

name: Luke Lombardo
text: RxBenefits is a wonderful place to work. The environment is professional, and teamwork is encouraged. The company genuinely cares about their clients and their employees. RxBenefits offers superior service as a full-service pharmacy solutions firm. I’m proud to say I work for RxBenefits!

name: Rich Grote

name: Grant Farr
text:
Our company recently switched to RxBenefits as the company that "dispenses" our pharmacy benefits. Like others, notice how all the 5 star reviews are from employees, which is great, I cannot say that anytime calling customer service they were not "kind". However, I can say for sure that I have experienced what a LOT of others have, which is that I was taking a medication for 20 years, that is GENERIC, and they would not cover once the benefits implementation was switched to these folks. The first prior authorization was DENIED incredibly despite my doctor saying it "doesn't seem wise or prudent" to have to rapidly stop the medication.

I am really blessed, so I could afford to pay out of pocket to fight with the company for 6 months, using coupons etc. while I got "approval" on a second prior auth. Again, I am blessed to have some medical knowledge, reasonable time, and afford to find other resources to pay. However, I KNOW FOR SURE that a lot of folks don't, and that this could have been catastrophic (I.e. couldn't get right meds - more PCP or heaven forbid ED visits which then just waste time at PCP/etc offices). This company advertises how "great a workplace" they are and they are "saving money" for companies, but all of these review are pretty clear HOW they are doing that. Putting up arbitrary guidelines that just waste your doctors time, your companies HR time, and frankly, the patient's time as well. Please, this company is TERRIBLE. I will be preaching against them to ANY HR meeting I'm in and will NEVER use this company again.

name: Ronald Bryant
text:
Very poor selection for the location. Frequently out of an amazing range of products. Usually after 7pm they are stocking products. Shouldn't that be done overnight. The cashier's for the most part are lazy and unknowlegable about placing products in the bags. For example: eggs and heavy can food in the same bags. Bread and heavy products in the same bag. Cookies in the bag with heavy products. Two two liter drinks in the same single bag.
Bags are very poor quality to start with. Will not even willing to place the bags in the cart. Least they could do for 50, 100, 150, is to make the effort to place the products in the basket. The checkout is made to make the customer do all the work. Again a lot of people are spending thousands of dollars a year and getting very poor treatment. The area where where the carts are placed are often empty. Carts are all over the parking lot. And not gathered up by employees on a frequent basis. There are some very good employees, but they frequently on the cell phones. Isn't that something people in general are fired for? The carts are frequently loaded with the trash from the previous customer.
Come on Wal-Mart, you make billions a year, you can do a much better job. And it would be nice to show your appreciation to your Customers. We are important, show it.

text: Highly recommend  this pharmacy.  I started using them not long after they opened,  close to my job. From day one, the staff was friendly  , very helpful with any questions. They treat you the way a business is supposed to treat a customer. The trip to the pharmacy every month used to be a dreadful day, dreading dropping of the prescription's because you knew the person was going to be rude,  and lord forbid if you asked what time they was gonna be ready, can't tell you how many pharmacy's I've tried over the last couple of years, usually it was cvs, walgreens, rite aid,  just a different location here in Tuscaloosa with the same results. Now, like today, I drop the prescription's off, the staff has a smile and ask me if I'm waiting , unfortunately today couldn't wait and I gave them a time I would return (  unlike the others who tell me when to come pick up, and 99% of the time rude when they speak ) , 15st Pharmacy staff tells me it will be ready , gotta love it. A business who appreciates their customers.

name: Henny Claus
text: Friendly and very helpful!!!

name: Ryan Lawrence
text: The employees go above and beyond for your safety and satisfaction! The fill time is extremely quick with lower prices too. This pharmacy is top notch!!

name: Corn Pop wuz a Bad Dude!

Always receive amazing friendly service!
Would not go anywhere else!

name: Bryan McElroy
text: Great little pharmacy with quick service.

name: Aprille Smalley
text: My personal pharmacy

name: Aprille Smalley
text: Fast service

name: Cat Taps
text:
Moved to East Limestone from Indy. Joe's was recommended by a trusted friend.

We no longer use the big pharmacy chains. Too many issues to review here. So we liked checking Joe's out.

A dozen of prescriptions later...

Joe's pharmacy has efficient staff. All business. They are very good.

The persons in the merchandise area are always eager to help and friendly.

My only disappointment is in the merchandise area. The stock at Joe's is organized and clean. Love this.

I know those big pharmacy chains spoiled me in my comparison of them to Joe's here, so I am not letting this take away stars: The merchandise is necessary items (school supplies, medical), greeting cards, more blah (at least to me) items. Just no interesting things to look at if I walk in a script & need to wait. Limited, small...🤔 Actually? This pharmacy reminds me of the pharmacies I grew up knowing...😊.

I respect the merch is not a focus. I very much like the associates working out there are eager to help with a smile, too. This is a small town pharmacy. I am getting used to the difference in merch offerings being the same ev visit.

So...keep on doing a wonderful job in our community, Joe's! I know what all you offer: Good pharmacy, expected merchandise (got it all memorized!), quick scripts. I will continue do my merchandise browsing at your store, still. I just am that kind of gotta-shop person! 😄

name: Sandra Hall Dempsey
text: We love. Mr. Joe and all the staff, they're not just our pharmacy they're our family to. We love you all, keep up the great jobs and just being there if I just need to talk. From your friends and family members Sandra, Freddie Dempsey, David b I'd Foster, George and Brandon young.

name: Mary Beth Toone
text: Joe is amazing! We’ve been customers for years. I can’t say enough good things!

name: Edie Kennedy
text: Awesome, friendly staff.  Very clean atmosphere.  Great for our community

name: Stacie Shonkwiler
text: Knowledgeable pharmacists, always cheerfully ready to stop what they're doing to help you address any health issues, even those that don't require a prescription. Staff is very nice and helpful. There have only been a few times when I have encountered a cranky employee in the 13 years I have lived here. That's saying a lot. I will say that it is a small pharmacy, it has that small town homey feel. The only downsides to that are the limited stock of over-the- counter products are limited and the prices here seem to be a bit higher than other pharmacies. I like that they are close to home and they have drive- thru pickup for prescriptions. That comes in handy when you just need to pick your prescriptions and don't want to bother with going inside. That's fantastic if you just want to drive over in your nightgown and flip flops. No need to worry about No Shirt, No Shoes, No Service...well, you ladies need to wear a sports bra or something to cover your ta-tas, but you get the gist. Great place!

name: Judy Rew
text: He has given such me su h one on one service. I have really appreciated it. Been there when I have needed it.

name: Donna Bruce
text: Love the service and all the Sweeties who work there.  They really take care to not let you take a med that will interfere with another.   They're almost always on the ball and if not they will correct a problem quickly.   I just can't say enough about them.

name: LuLaLu Jerrils
text: I love this pharmacy!! I have been using this pharmacy for a couple of years now. I just had my first child and I had to go fill a prescription and pick up some personal hygiene items. When I got there a young gentleman (didn’t get his name) immediately took my prescription and asked if I needed help finding anything. I didn’t know what all i would need and I wasn’t too comfortable asking a young man to help me but I told him I just had my first child and gave him my list. He very eagerly took my list and gave me comfort by saying his wife had just had a baby too and he helped me find everything I needed while giving me a few pointers. I could not have been more pleased to have him help me. Once I was done shopping my prescription was ready. I was in and out in a matter of 10 minutes. This pharmacy has always been extremely fast when filling prescriptions but this experience took my love for this place to a whole new level. I want to thank everyone that works there for their hard work and especially the young gentleman that helped me that day! He was a life saver.

name: Cindy Sue
text: When i first starting to go to buy rite, i felt judged. However, as time went by, i realized that we all get a first impression.  I am poor and because i only have medicaid judgement is inevitable.  I have been sick a long time and always assumed pharmacist didnt like me because of the meds i get. I want to apologize. I have found everyone there tries to speak to me like a human. I am dying but it doesn't mean that everone looks at me that way. Thank you Tommy for treating me kind. It is a breath of fresh air. 10 years of college then i find out i cant use it. Anyway, i wanted your whole staff to know i appreciate you. The reason i had the oxycodone prescription transfered to Jacks was because the 15s from your store gave me a headache.  It was was nothing nafrerios. In addition, i got my xanax at jacks was because they are right up the street from the Doctor and it was 4:30. I will now get .eveeything for you. Thanks again for trating me with kindnessm

name: Marina Topic
text: Very disappointed. My prescription was filled out without me picking up medications. I just hope that if someone is dependable on a life supporting medication, doesn not go through what I did. Day 2 - no medication. Just sad.

name: DeLana Villarreal
text: Everyone is nice, friendly, and helpful! I highly recommend them.

name: Robbie Flowers
text: The entire staff from the pharmacist on down are so rude everytime you call or pick up meds.

name: Cindy Bug
text: Had to go back, prescription wasn't ready.

name: Elizbeth “LizBeth” Hammond
text:
My triazolam which was picked up yesterday has changed color and shape. But my problem is it’s effectiveness seems to be quite different. I was taken back by how I had to take two pills to even fall asleep. I’m satisfied with customer service for the most part at BuyRite. They are number 1 in filling or refilling your prescription whether by phone, drive through or online. Nobody beats Buy-Rite on expediting your medication especially if you have just been discharged from hospital or a disability that prevents you from standing in long lines from IBD in its many uncomfortable and uncontrollable symptoms.

12-26-2019-I have already called and spoken with the pharmacist and this pill is all they have. I thought it necessary to bring attention to it ineffectiveness in case there are other complaints about this medication.. Thank you.

12-28-2019-This is my second night on the new medication that replace the original blue pill Triazolam. This pill very peculiar. I usually have an indicator that the medicine is working, so be still, lay down and remain laying down. It's after 2:00 am. I am already woke. I don’t know how I’m going to get through the next 28 days. From my understanding the pills I have cannot be returned and get the remaining pills from another pharmacy.(sigh) Blue pill is the original pill for Triazolam. The new Triazolam medication is white spear shaped on both ends.

text: I have been getting prescriptions filled at Jacks for some time for my husband. Today was really awful! I went in and was originally greeted by a cashier and was told I could browse their “boutique” section while I waited it wanted to. I did just that and found an item I wanted to purchase. I realized that I left my purse in my truck and left the item on the table with the cashier. When I returned into the store I was being watched and talked about from an old red head lady and two others. I asked if something was wrong and they ignored me! I then was in the process of paying for the medication and item I left at the register, then was advised that my check would have to be a proved by the same red head that was treating me differently than all the other customers. This was a horrible experience and I will never ever shop at Jacks Drugs again! I will also tell everyone I know to never shop there either!

text: I get my meds there everyday, and it would be 5 stars but this one time I went in and their computer system was down and I had to go two days without my medicine which isn’t a type of medicine that you can miss doses. They didn’t seem to care that I was going to be sick because of their system malfunctioning. The staff is usually very nice and they know me by name.

text: Don't have a problem with the drug store. I never go in but through the drive through. They tell me it will be 20-30 minutes sometimes so i pull away and go park and play on my computer and go back and all is good. I think not enough satisfied customers come on and rate places so I'm going to rate the good, the bad, and the ugly.

text: I have always loved jacks drugs they are amazing.  Until recently when this new girl answered the phone and was not particularly nice,  all the other girls there I cut up with but this one went and lied to the pharmacist who then had the nerve to confront me about it with lies about things I said. My fiancé may still use them but I refuse to.  Not after the way I was talked to all over a girl looking for drama.  I believe if I was so bad they would have multiple complaints BUT THEY DONT so that girl who whined and lied and the pharmacist that told me they don't treat client ugly (while she was treating me ugly)  can kiss it.  I won't be back and I've got about 6 people I told who won't be back either because they have had similar experiences.  Just so you know.  Watch out for the blonde pharmacist and the new meek one.  😎 later guys

text: I know this will come as no surprise, but this is the worst pharmacy I have ever dealt with. A couple of the ladies are helpful, but the majority, including the pharmacist, are rude & not remotely helpful.  The last time I was here the lady at the counter looked past me to ask another person if she’d been helped....like I wasn’t even there.  I hate that these people are dealing with people who already don’t feel well....they certainly don’t make it any better.  One bright note....the lady at the drop off counter went out of her way to call other pharmacies to see if they had my prescription when she realized they were out.  She probably won’t be there long....I hope she finds something somewhere better.

You would think someone there would have called to tell me or at least tell my husband.

So treat youreslf with something nice & affordable at Priceville Pharmacy I promise you're going to want to come back to see what's just came in.

text:
Having been diabetic for nearly 30 years, the price of medication is always a challenge (even with insurance). The staff at Publix Pharmacy discovered that my insurance (Blue Cross) has specific requirements for filling the meds, and it appears that I have been overpaying for YEARS at other locations.

Thank you very much to the pharmacy staff, as your attention to detail made a pretty solid difference in my day (and my life).

Conwells Pharmacy

name: Christy Deason
text:
Some very nice people work here. I have little complaints from time to time and all I have to do is address them and Fred's is pretty good about resolving any issues in a timely manner. No One is perfect and that goes for Stores, Restaurants, any public place.  Most places will work with you to RESOLVE any issues simply because it is not worth having bad reviews posted online for the world to see. WORD OF MOUTH can make or break a business.
There are alot of people who just love drama and will go straight to the internet to completely bash a business without even giving management the chance to rectify a wrong. Half the time they never even knew there was an issue until they were affected by a bad review.
Any issue I have ever had with this store was always resolved once I spoke with management and for that I give this Fred's in Evergreen a 5-star review.

text: The pharmacists here are absolutely the best. They are so well informed and extremely helpful.

name: Jerrell White
text: As a former employee at this location, I highly doubt you will like working here, management, some new some old (while not all are completely self centered and condescending, there are some who go as untainted as possible) is on a serious power/ego trip and never likes to be questioned and if you do prepare to be fired, they will find a way to get under your skin and ultimately you out the door and on the no hire list even without probably cause or evidence which I hope they know is illegal, I am currently about to engage in a legal battle with them for a deformation of character suit, so just a lil heads up for the wise, while jobs in the city are scarce unless you know people, this is not one I recommend

name: Vince Wyatt
text: Customer service very good

name: Love Abrams
text: beer

name: Sheila Love
text: I love going to Jackson Drugs because they have helped me out with questions. They also helped me out with my prescriptions when I called them in and they faxed them to the doctors office and the doctors office would fax them back over or call them over. Then I would go pick them up and pay for them. I've been with Jackson Drugs for 30 years now. Ever since I found out I was pregnant with my daughter in 1991 and I had to use prenatal vitamins and iron and went to Jackson Drugs to get them.  That's why I like Jackson Drugs because they are also friendly as well. They explained a certain drug to you if you don't understand it.

name: Jeff R
text: Jackson's does a fantastic job taking care of the community.

name: Clara McCarry
text: Awesome service!  Understanding people and I like to shop there.

name: Dani Browning
text: Its ok. Smells nice. They are pricey, though.

name: Mrs. Tonya M Adam
text: Love the care and commitment to everyone, they truly care!

name: Joyce Danner
text: This pharmacy has the best team of employees I have ever seen. They all know me by my name. There phone demeanor is A1 professional. Not to mention there speedy 😉

name: Audrey Muzingo
text: I have never been to a pharmacy that is so consistently fast and efficient.  Maybe they have less volume to deal with because they don't have a drive-through, not sure.  But my medication is on the list that doesn't allow auto-refill, meaning I must come in with the prescription to begin the filling process.  At most places that could mean a very long wait in a chair, or have to make a second trip.  But this location typically has me in and out in 20 minutes max, usually more like 5-10.  They have also never been out of stock of my meds, and are very courteous and friendly, unlike so many staff members at other pharmacies whose tone and facial expressions appear like they think you're some kind of addict just because your medication is on the controlled substance list (I've even caught a couple of them lying about being out of stock).  Here I feel like a valued patient and customer.

name: Tammie Walter
text:
Absolutely pathetic and UNEXCUSABLE behavior on the part of the pharmacist, Kyle. I specifically asked to make sure my meds were in stock and only told upon checking out, after an hour of waiting, that the two MAIN ones were on back order. One of which I needed severely bc my blood pressure was almost at stroke level upon entering the store, the other that makes me SICK to miss even ONE DOSE.
And then had the nerve to say well this other one "should help a little bit anyway". Unbelievably unprofessional, basically playing God with my healthcare. And then after I've called my Dr in front of them and explained exactly what had happened, he pops up and says "well we do have it in stock but it's the name brand which is $8.. really??!! I've ONLY ever bought the name brand, and that sir, is in your computer. Last chance Walgreens. Every single one of your locations/pharmacy I've ever dealt with has been beyond inept & profoundly incompetent.

name: Brenetta Goodwin
text: Hard working employee's.

name: Rich OC
text: Their great helping you if just ask. Pharmacist are friendly will help u find self remedy if you aren't one who just goes to the doctor for a rash or sneeze.

name: Jeff Alfred
text: After dealing with the poorly staffed Rite Aid/Walgreens Pharmacy at Loyd’s Ln and Cottage Hill I have finally been able to get my important medications. Don’t go to Loyd’s Ln and Cottage Hill Rite Aid they will leave you without help and tell you to break you meds and mix them etc against doctors orders.

name: Robert Jackson
text: Always quickly in and out for baby supplies like milk and diapers. They have what you need without the frills you don’t!

name: Wes Allday
text: Very friendly staff, pharmacist is amazing.

name: Drew Whiteley
text: Friendly, helpful employees and pharmacists

name: Mandy Hartley
text: Angela is always so helpful and friendly!

name: Aaron Dettling

name: Cindy Roberts
text: This pharmacy was the only one in town that had my medicine in stock, so I HAD to use them for first time. I believe I am a customer for life. As a New patient, I was in and out in minutes, everyone was so incredibly nice.  I got an automated call on Sunday when they were closed thanking me for using them and hoping I come back. Wait? What? Customer service is alive and well at PC Pharmacy!

name: Kasey K.
text: I HAVE been using this PHARMACY for about ALMOST 6..MABY 7 OR 8YRS.NOW,THEY'RE GREAT!!!👍💖😘🥰😉NOW...I HATE IT; BUT...I'M NOT GONNA BE ABLE TO USE'EM TIL' THE END OF AUG.OR SEPTEMBER, 😣😥😪ALL B'CUZ I'M STAYIN' WITH MY COUSIN-!(in Irondale 4 the next 2/3mo.😥😪)BUT AFTER SEPTEMBER OR MAYBE AUGUST..I'LL BE BACK-THAT'S 4 DA**D SURE, LOL!!!😉🥰😆😆😆👍👍❤❤😀😆

name: C. Meadows
text: I've used many pharmacies, but Pell City Pharmacy is absolutely the very best.  They are efficient, friendly and know who I am.  Love Tucker and his staff.

name: Patricia Treadwell
text: The people there are so nice and friendly. I think they know everyone by name.

name: David Bucklin
text: Tucker and company are simply top notch. Very friendly and welcome me by name when I walk in. I prefer an independent pharmacy for that very reason. That and to keep my money local. The drive thru is also very convenient.

name: Karin Liddle
text: Great hometown people!!!

name: Wendy Davis
text: Love this pharmacy!  Always efficient, friendly and goes over and beyond for their customers!

name: gordon “K2” porter

name: Darlene Willis
