text:
I  use this pharmacy because there prices are great and the people
Are always so nice and helpful
Thanks for the awesome service

name: Jo Ann Campbell
text: Quick to fill your medicine & get you on your way

name: Jeremy Gossett
text: Loved these guys.  Hate I moved out of the area.

name: Susan Hodgin
text: Love Carroll's in Trussville! The staff is very compassionate and attentive. They consistently go the extra mile in making sure I understand everything about my medications. Their reminder service is fantastic! I'm never out of my medications.

name: Heather Leith
text: Best pharmacy hands down! They are always so helpful and friendly! The drive-thru is super convenient as well!

name: PINSON “Pinson Patriot” PATRIOT
text: The nicest people. Great hometown feel with personal service. My wife and I will go nowhere else....

name: Aquarius X2
text: I was with Tyner's for many years. They have one very rude pharmacist, but everyone else was nice. I have a particular medicine and my body can only handle a particular brand. Otherwise I get sick. Tyner's use to keep them in stock for me. One day I was basically told to go elsewhere. In a bind, I went to Carroll's. I was so amazed at the customer service. They only had 25 of what I needed. They gave me those and wrote out a red card for me to come back the next morning for the rest! They ordered what I needed right then and was able to have the rest the next day! I've never been able to do that anywhere!! I will never go back. Tyner's said they didn't have them and didn't know when they would have them again!

name: Natalie Sanders
text: Filled my prescriptions quick and everyone was very nice I will continue to use this pharmacy

name: Karen Tisdale
text: Super quick filling prescriptions  and very friendly staff. Location also is extremely convenient in Trussville and I love that they have a drive thru.

name: Melissa Kirkpatrick
text: I love Carroll Pharmacy! After using big chain stores, I will never go anywhere but Carroll's. The staff is super attentive, quick, and they care about you. They have a drive thru you can use for prescription pick up. It is definitely worth going in the store though. They have an amazing selection of jewelry, boutique clothing, gifts, candles, and much more. They also have a whole football section with local school merchandise. Just a great place!

name: Lynda
text: They are very nice and friendly. I moved my prescriptions from another pharmacy, because they attempted to over charge me on several things, not so with Carroll's

name: Mary LaGuardia
text: Best pharmacy I have ever used. They are friendly and attentive and they fill faster than anywhere else.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!  The girls work very hard, it's nice to see them receive the recognition they deserve.😁

name: Lauren Hughes
text: Just started using them and so far great service! Love the small town feel❣️

resp.text: Thank you very much for the great review.  We really appreciate your feedback it lets us know were on the right track!

name: Jessica Joyner
text: Great place! They have moved to the new clinic by Lowes. Just be aware upon entering the clinic, you will need to take your tempature or the lady at the front desk will start barking at you. 😒 Class II medication was available and ready pick up within 10 minutes!!!

name: Aleisha Brown
text: I absolutely adore this pharmacy ❤️. Their so incredibly sweet and are so caring. I’ve never had problems with them. They go over and beyond. Kim Moses is absolutely amazing!!

name: Ashley Wilson
text: As a new resident in Wetumpka I wanted to give back to local businesses and use this pharmacy for all of my prescription needs. I went in to drop of my prescription and instead of just being told when it would be ready I was asked all of my medical history and was told they would need to be verified with the doctor, even though I had just turned in my prescription written by my doctor. I felt like I was being judged for the types of medications I am taking. The owner should worry more about being a friendly and helpful pharmacist, rather than a judging pharmacist trying to act like he is my doctor. I will never go back and will take my business to a different local pharmacy.

name: Abby Traylor
text: Love this pharmacy & the staff is always super nice. Always good to have a hometown feel when you’re at a place of business!

name: Carter Taunton
text: My favorite hometown pharmacy ! They Are more like a family than a business and I can appreciate that !

name: Michelle Swaney
text: Been at Wetumpka Pharmacy ever since it opened love the hospitality. Kim and Johnny go over and beyond to make sure everyone is taken care

name: Aaron Moses
text: Very friendly staff and i was in and out of there in no time.

name: Terry Willcutt
text: Great Place

name: Mindy Hulsey
text:
They're great 😊 they've always been very kind and helpful! They always help even if I've got my hands full or they're busy. They've even called me to check if a medicine was OK with me when the doctor called it in. ❤
I even bumped into the pharmacist at the vet and he talked me through some questions I had about my son with asthma and meds and inhalers. He didn't mind at all! He loved to help and he and all the others there are always like that! Thank you all for always being so kind

name: James Jones
text: Typical Wal-Mart pharmacy. Have what you need at a good price and the service is good. Always better to call ahead of course so you don't have to wait.

Had my child’s prescription called in after his Dr visit. Took my sick child home and waited over an hour before stopping by for his prescription just to give them time to fill it so I wouldn’t have to make him wait there while feeling so bad. Was told it still wasn’t ready that it would be another half hour...
I’m in desperate need of changing pharmacies. This one is terrible

text:
This pharmacy has some very rude employees.  I actually moved to another one because I got tired of all the bs.

Update: My regular pharmacy was out of my insulin so I called it in here.  Was told it was in stock.  Drove there to find out that they were out of stock.  Total rubish.

name: Gerald Henson
text: I suggest you call your prescription in unless you want to wait and unreasonable amount of time to get it if you care the prescription to them. Checking out can be an experience to where there were a line of eight of us with two registers only one was open and I believe the female didn't know what she was doing.I'm also glad that I checked in the bag for I walked out of the store because they give me the wrong prescription to a totally different person whose name was nowhere close to mine.

name: Luke Sullivan
text: Super nice staff

name: Tiffany LaShea
text: Great prices true but having to wait for 24 hours after they said would be ready in 1 hour the day before  is horrible. Hopefully next month will be better.

name: rachel mims
text: Absolutely worst pharmacy. The employees here are about as good as the rest of the store if that tells you anything.

name: elizabeth pruitt
text:
waited at the “drop off” window for 10 minutes before i finally left to find another pharmacy.
the one worker i did speak to was rude and rash about the information i was requesting.
workers behind the counter kept walking past me.
honestly, this place is so swamped and disorganized i will not be back. ever.

name: Ashley Bianchetti
text: The ONLY thing that they have going is the young lady (Megan) that works the counter. Everyone else is rude and snippy and they don’t have time for you BS. They don’t want to do anything to help you get your prescriptions filled. So sad, I really wanted to like these people. Going back to Walgreens

name: Blakely Warfield
text: Mike's staff is helpful and understanding. The prices are the cheapest I've been able to find and they have a stellar reputation. And yes, they DO deliver. How awesome is that?! (Rhetorical) VERY CONVENIENT. I would suggest them to anyone who has a pharmaceutical need.

text: Took a neighbor here. We we went through the drive through. So for what it is worth what I saw was efficient and clean and the clerk was friendly.

text: WOW. I was looking at changing pharmacies so I came here to check on some prescriptions of mine. They are incredibly RUDE! Especially the older woman in the front. I'm literally shocked at how horribly I was treated. I will NEVER get a prescription filled or purchase anything from this place!

name: Donna Light
text: Picked up my son-in-laws med, they put someone else’s med in there because their names were almost the same. That could be dangerous. Then saw that they had put two different brands of the same pill in his bottle with no explanation of it told to us or on bottle. (Looked them up to make sure they were both the same thing...)

name: Patricia Wichman

text: Absolutely the best staff of pharmacist in town. Not once in. decade have I had a bad experience doing business there.

name: Cadence Kupfner
text: I’ve been using CVS forever because it’s so convenient, but recently, Dean’s had a medication I needed, and the local CVS did not.  Since I have been to Dean’s once, I’m not going back to CVS.  The customer service is unmatched.  The pharmacist made sure to give me very detailed instructions on my medications, and he advised me certain things I had never been advised before, though I’d used this medicine before.  I did research, and he was right.  Seriously, Dean’s Drugs changed the way I view pharmacies.

name: Rachel Patterson
text: When I called to put a order in. One of the lady's was very rude and hug up on me. Never told me if she could put the order in or not. Normally I have no issues. Not very happy with the service I received!

name: Sheri Palmer
text: Best pharmacy I've ever used. The staff is super friendly, they know your name, they treat you like friends, and they are always quick to take care of your health needs. You will never get service this fast or friendly from a chain pharmacy!

I now drive to Gadsden, an hour roundtrip out of my way, rather than here (6 minutes away) to deal with this poorly maintained attempt of a pharmacy.

text: These ppl that work in this store are to povide service to the consumer. They do nothing but judge ppl as THEY see fit. Your not GOD..... do your job like your surpost todo. Yes... these means you ....

name: John Patton
text: I've been coming here for a year, including the transition to Medicare. Few problems, all resolved efficiently. Good staff, even when busy.

name: Zays Way
text: I went to this pharmacy on the night of january 28 of this year picking up hair products like I usually do from this location and a lady at the cash register called security on me for allegedly stealing. It was racial profiling at its best and ive never felt more disrespected in my life. There was no reason to accuse me of stealing other then the color of my skin in this womans mentality I suppose. This event  could have turned into another tragedy in America were an innocent minority is persecuted or even killed if it were to escalate. I will never go here again and advise others not too as well.

name: Terry May
text: Its a well trusted place. Been around a long time. So they must be doing something right

text: Every pharmacist and associate at Store #1057 5 stars all around!

name: Pat Mason
text: Good place. I signed up for text alerts,,super simple

text: First! The pharmacists here stop and take time to listen to any concerns. Very knowledgeable and kind.

name: Foster White
text: Service is great .You can count on them.

name: Wendy Madison
text: Quick service. Great staff and friendly.

name: Vicki Jones
text: Very friendly and helpful. More than the ladies had to be, that 's for sure... No insurance at the time but went way above and beyond to find discounts for my RX's ...

name: Erin Allen
text: Great staff! Never a line.

name: Nu won
text: ALWAYS, ALWAYS treats me like I'm important to them and they ALWAYS do whatever they can to make sure that my prescriptions are filled on time. If there are ever any problems,  they have it worked out before I ever arrive. Most places slowed down and had issues since the covid crisis. However, walmart pharmacy, in Gadsden specifically,  somehow improved on their service and I just know that I won't have to worry about anything when it comes to my prescriptions. It is every employee ranging from the pharmacist to the tech and cashier. Thank you! God bless you and your family!

name: jack nipper
text: Walmart pharmacy are dedicated workers pay should be more

name: Melody Green
text: Very pleased with their service. Have been polite and helpful. Email us when meds are due for refill and pickup. Thank you!

name: kimberlina68
text:
There is no management or guidance of the employees.  They are out of control with rudeness and absolutely zero customer service skills.  With just a little effort, this pharmacy could be great.  Honestly, they think if they are rude, then people will stop coming to the pharmacy and then they could just stand around doing nothing.

10/30/2020
If I could lower it below 1 star, I would.  My medications were ordered and paid for, on the website. This happen 10/23/2020.  Pharmacy was supposed to Fed Ex my 5 prescriptions to my home less than 10 minutes away because I have medical problems driving.  Anyway, I called Tues and was told by Sarah, the meds should be there by Wed 28th. I then called on 29th and was told there was another problem with Fed Ex and they would be there the next day (today).  Well today it is 3 pm and there is no Fed Ex package of my medicines that I need.  I tried to explain this to the Pharmacist, Michelle.  I thought she might be educated and actually have feelings about other people that are going through problems due to their lack of CUSTOMER SERVICE. At the least, they should have called me to explain.  She got very angry and before hanging up, starting yelling “oh my God, I can’t believe...   I just hung up, but I felt like I needed to let her know know she should say stuff like that without hanging up.  I have copies of my medicines being ordered on 10/23/2020 and Fed Ex tracking number being created on 10/26th.  It is 10/30th, and I still don’t have the medicine I need.  I pray no one there ever has to go through what I go through with them.

name: Angel (Angel)
text: I call in a medication at 12:47pm told to pick it up in 1.5 hours.  Go to pick it up and they have no record of me calling to fill it.  Phones are hard to get through.  Total rubish.

name: kram c.m
text: Have had no issues, they remind me of need for refills, always ready for pick up or drive through

name: Brenda Stallo
text: multiple times didn't fill the prescription and blamed the Doctors.  Multiple times did not refill the needles with the prescription for Insulin sq. Changed to the Wal Mart Pharmacy in Attalla. Its a 32 miles around trip from my home but I feel safer using them, they are friendly and not rude.  If I questioned a prescription at the East Gadsden Wal Mart Pharmacy I was treated as if I was bothering them even if they filled the prescription wrong.  I need to add that most of the prescriptions were for other family members and now I've been on hold at the East Gadsden WalMart for 16 minutes waiting to verify a prescription for a terminally ill relative.

name: Evelise Martinez-Elrod
text: Was supposed to have my prescription filled before July 1st. They just filled it on July 3rd....

name: Sharon Francis
text: This place is on unbelievable you order you medicine they don't fill it, Then you come pick it up and I tell you you didn't order it you come-back to pick it up couple days later,  Then I tell you they're out and I have to order it I came back 2 days later and say I need a  authorization then I come to pick it up after talking to my doctor to get the authorization, But guess what thats not what they needed! They needed  a new perscription because we were out of refills ? And each person wants to blame it on another person and I ask why don't you just call us and tell us that you didn't have it s or you need an authorization ?

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: It's okay.... Sometimes you get friendly service....

name: Chara Kelley (Sweet-Tea)
text: They are The Worst Pharmacy ! They play with people's prescriptions & they think everything is so funny ! People are sick and need their medicine, they should be ashamed of themselves & treat people with respect & dignity. All they care about is their self and collecting a paycheck!

name: Diane Sexton
text: Rude customer service

name: marcus johnson
text: Worst service ever.

text: Close early. Open late. Very unprofessional and rude.

text: On multiple times they said my script had not been called in .I work for the doctor and was right there when it was called in .They are also very rude .Not to mention excessively long wait times

name: Carol Dillard
text: Never had my prescriptions correct.

name: virginia miller
text: It's. Alright

name: Lance Whestine
text: Rude and laugh and carry on 24/7

name: Patricia Parrett
text: Rude pharmacist, medications refilled incorrectly, fortunately I am extremely knowledgeable with insurance so I knew there was a mistake, upon calling the pharmacy I was again treated by another rude individual, no apology for the mistake, just told, “ I fixed it, so what does it matter, you have not been impacted.  Seriously? Very rude

name: Step East
text: Great store, the prices are higher than at some grocery stores but it's like that at every Publix. And like all other Publix stores, they have a huge selection of produce. It's so fresh and pretty. Customer service is really nice at this location.

name: Callie James
text: This pharmacy used to be wonderful. Customer service has gone downhill, and their attitude even worse. They now don't notify you if your doctor denies a refill and requests you contact them to discuss. Apparently, you're supposed to just get annoyed and after a few days miraculously KNOW to call the pharmacy to find this out. Wasted time waiting. Then I told the person I would be moving to a new pharmacy because of this shoddy experience (one of many, but the last straw). She said, "That's fine!" This is where I used to get all of my groceries. Clearly Publix doesn't care. I'm not only moving pharmacies, I will now shop elsewhere for everything. Bye Publix.

name: Kelly Davis
text: Go to pick up a prescription and they are never ready. Always an excuse- sorry, we had to order it, sorry, it didn't come in, sorry, the insurance says it won't refill until tomorrow (after the pharmacy tech TOLD me the refill date). Never a phone call telling me there is a problem. This happens at least twice a month. Sorry, I'll tell my manager. Yeah, right. How about learning to use a phone? Looks like it's time to find a new pharmacy for next year.

name: Shawn Argo
text: My granddaughter needed some medication filled. The pharmacy not only didn’t have it in stock, but didn’t bother to order the medicine since she’s on Medicaid and they said it wasn’t covered, come to find out it IS COVERED and assumed we wouldn’t buy it at cost. In addition they didn’t call to inform us of their decision. My granddaughter has had to suffer because of their incompetence. Never going back to this pharmacy or STORE again! I honestly believe this pharmacy does not have the customers’ best interests at heart and are in it for their own gain. Doctors take an oath to do no harm, guess pharmacists at Publix don’t take an oath!

name: Michael 69
text: Always prompt and very friendly thank you

name: Brittani Miesner
text: Never have I ever had been handled in a timely manner here. The lines are forever long! There are clearly plenty of pharmacy techs around filling prescriptions out. But the drive-thru line is always so long & I normally wait 30-40 mins. I get that it’s a 4-6 o’clock rush, but that’s ridiculous! I don’t bother wasting my time going inside when there have been numerous occasions where they haven’t filled my prescription when they said they would. Or that they have been out of stock & didn’t bother to tell me. If there was a Walgreens nearby my house, I’d switch in a heartbeat!

name: Cheyanne Childress
text: Said my medicine would be ready in 20 minutes came back and said it would be another 30 minutes i swear they are so slow i wouldnt recommend them i would go to target pharmacy or the piggly wiggly pharmacy so much faster and they are nicer these people are rude.

name: Heather Dumdey
text: Worst pharmacy ever. Staff especially the main pharmacist are rude. You go in and they'll ignore you as they carry on their own personal conversations. They mess up on medication. State they cant fill certain prescriptions for whatever reason but I can take them to other places and they fill them just fine. Tonight was my final straw they did not give my daughter all of her medicine and i had to go all the way back up there just to get it fixed. They didnt bother to apologize or anything it was almost as if I inconvenienced them. Go over to mills pharmacy down the street they are way better and always friendly.

name: Seth Alexander
text: Took in my prescription. The lady was a total weirdo about it like I was trying buy something I wasn't prescribed. Refused GoodRX. It was like she kept coming up with excuses not to fill it.

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
So... I was talking to the lady, asking about Vitamin D, whether or not they received the prescription from my doctor, and she flat out hung up on me. I wasn't even arguing, so I have no idea why.

So I mentioned it when I was there in person picking up Synjardy. She just said "oh well, you're here now," and never cared to deal with the prescription Vitamin D...

Seriously, treat some folks with dignity. You can swing a cat and find pharmacies at every corner. I was trying to give Publix another chance after problems back in 2012 (Publix's fault) that landed me in the ER while I waited for them to run a prescription properly. Never received an apology.

name: Justin Hays
text:
I've been going to many different pharmacies in Decatur for years, always having issues at each one. Beginning of this year, 2018, I went to The Medicine Shoppe. I was greeted the first moment I walked in like I was appreciated as a customer.
My daughter takes ADHD medication, and I give part at home and send part to be given at school. I needed the medication in two different bottles and half of them cut. I haven't had to tell them again. It's done correctly, every time.
I go there now, exclusively, for all my medications. The second time I walked in, the Pharmacist addressed me by my name. I was shocked. I was bringing in a new prescription, and I talked to him for a minute and told them I would be back to pick it up, when I was told it was ready (literally 3 minutes).
The Medicine Shoppe is a pharmacy that takes pride in their work and service, and far succeedes any other I've ever been to. I even recently received a letter in the mail from them thanking me for being a customer. It was typed, but was addressed to me, and hand signed by every employee and the owner, John McGuire.
Very few businesses, operate with this kind of customer appreciation. My friends and family are now, or already had been, using this pharmacy. Truly Amazing Business!!

Oh my gosh I haven’t even gotten to the best part about filling w this place...they deliver! Yes, even xanex. right to your door!
This place truly is a gem. They offer creatively overpriced (to some) children’s toys, scarfs, sodas, cigarettes and highly controlled substances at ease! Maybe use the parking spots across from the window as a waiting spot until theirs is ready then call or text them and they can then pull to window. Or use those vibrating things like restaurants do

resp.text: Thanks for your input. These are good ideas. We are trying hard to help people as safely and quickly as we can. We will ask people to pull to parking spots like you mentioned if their medicine isn't ready. We have been doing this a pretty good bit, but we can improve. Remember anytime the line is long, we offer curbside service and our front door is open if you would like to come inside to see us. If you want curbside, call us and tell us where you are parked, and we will bring your medicine out to you quickly. Have a great night!

text:
I'm switching pharmacies because the new staff are rude and slightly incompetent. I went into publix during this outbreak ONLY to get my medicines which i had filled over the phone. When I got there, one of my prescriptions didn't have any more refills on it and the pharmacist was very unprofessional and raised her voice at me about not having a doctor and 'it's not her fault' that the refills weren't in. They seem to be unstable individuals and I don't have any faith in whatever Publix is calling this pharmacy. Go somewhere else for quality, local service that you deserve. I am.

Only giving 2 stars bc Publix can fill your prescription at other locations in town. That was useful only ONCE and it was during this outbreak.

name: Mary Harvell
text: I absolutely love this store! It's clean and everyone is so helpful and very kind. Keep up the great work!!

name: J B
text:
Will never go to this pharmacy again after the way I was just treated by the pharmacist on duty. Dark haired caucasian women. From the second I stepped to the window with my prescription paper she gave me attitude. First she started with "we close in 20 minutes." Questioned if my scripts came from the hospital or where they came from. I had just been seen at urgent care on hughes road, as it says on my prescription paper, diagnosed with pneumonia. Then asking me if ive had medications filled there before which i have but its been awhile.  she couldnt find me in the system so that was more attitude like its my fault. How about you do your job and enter me in the system then. The last straw was her getting an attitude with me because I dont have insurance and I use the GoodRX app. I grabbed my prescription paper and left.
Total lack of customer service and manners.

name: Diana Holland Faust
text: They seem to be very efficient and professional at this pharmacy.  And it is nice that they know their customers by sight and by name, even new ones -- not something you see very often.

name: Elizabeth Ludwig
text:
I will never use this location again. I have never taken the time to leave a formal complaint before, but I took the time to bring my experience to the manager’s attention. I have to say I have never felt so belittled or offended by someone in a place where patience and a sense of comfort should be paramount.

I called in a refill of my prescription of simple generic birth control around 2:40pm. I was informed it would be at least an hour. So, when I came by to pick it up at 5:15pm I was surprised to find my prescription was somehow at the downtown location. I was informed by the staff that it would be a 30 minute wait. This was in a clipped exchange where there was no apology or assurance. Unfortunately, my husband had to go back to work so, I told them I would pick it up tomorrow.

Unfortunately, that is not the end of this story. I had time later that evening to go try again around 6pm or so. When I walked back in I actually heard them whisper and groan, “It’s her”. One pharmacist, a tall, thin woman with glasses, exasperatedly began to tell me just how many prescriptions they had to fill that night and how when I said tomorrow mine had been pushed back. This was my prepackaged birth control that they had in stock. I could be wrong but I am fairly certain that it only requires a print out to give it, or at least that's all I have ever seen. I was informed that they could manage it in 15 minutes, and so I waited and inquired about how to move my prescriptions.

So, I waited feeling belittled and absolutely uncomfortable. I decided if I had 15 minutes I would make a complaint to customer service. Once that was done I went on my way, but as soon as I got home and spoke to a friend she too had a series of stories about the tall pharmacist with glasses. What's worse are the reviews I have now read about others experiences. Clearly, this is not a good location in customer service or in quality.

name: Jennifer Day
text: I had foot surgery today and it has been one of the most painful experiences of my life. My husband dropped my pain med script by this pharmacy today and my mother went to pick it up a couple hours later. When she got the medicine home I counted them (because I've always heard you should do this with pain meds). There were supposed to 15 in the bottle and, sure enough, there were only 14. Now I'm super frustrated because I know there is nothing I can do about since my mother didn't count them in front of them. The only thing I thought to do was write a review. Hopefully this help someone else in the future. Do not use this pharmacy! Someone there is likely acting unlawfully and I know I don't want to give them the opportunity to possibly do it again.

text: Good staff just like Pinnacle of Providence.

text: The best customer service around. When you've been at ER with sick grandchild till 10 or 11 p.m. you can count on them for prescriptions and  helping you understand the dosage and side effects if any.. C&H Drugs are there for you and I'm truly thankful.

text: Needs to carry more PC related items along with more clothes for men and boys.

name: Harlie Rhodes
text: The people they are awesome!!!!

name: Lora Burdine
text: always shop here

name: Anna Price
text: My dog has been on 5 medications twice a day for 2 years for her heart and it has been a struggle not only to quarter small pills and sort her meds every day, but I also feel mean having to give her all these pills twice a day.  My vet said Jim's Pharmacy could offer her most expensive medication at a lower cost and when I went to talk to them, I found out that they make treats out of the medicine.  I asked if they could combine her other 4 medications with it and they said no problem!  They were so helpful and patient working with my two vets to get all of the prescriptions together and have combined everything into one small treat that she eats twice a day.  What a life saver for both me and my sweet baby!  I actually have another dog on 2 meds once a day and Jim's has also combined those into a treat.  I can't say enough about the wonderful service Jim's provides and the great communication during the start up of this effort.  If all of that isn't wonderful enough, I'm also saving a lot of money every month!  I highly recommend Jim's for both people and pets, they are great!

name: Gina E
text: We have a little one that has been recently diagnosed with an auto immune disease. It has been scary, overwhelming but everyone at Jim’s Pharmacy has been wonderful! They are always our advocates, they make extra efforts to ensure that they have all the supplies she needs, even the specialty ordered items. They have delivered her life saving medicine to our door when we could not get there. They have advocated for our munchkin with her physician’s office and her insurance company. They are caring beyond belief and we count them as blessing, allies in our fight against this disease. I can’t say enough good things about this pharmacy and every single employee there. They care and that is a rare thing these days.

name: Becky Pepper Hopkins
text: Knowledgeable and friendly staff. Jim's makes you feel like family. Great gift items too!

name: Renorien
text: Fantastic staff and very quick at filling prescriptions. Thanks for the great service

name: Not My Life Anymore
text: My fur baby is on medication for his heart. And Jim's Pharmacy is the only place  local (that i know of) that makes a compound of the meds into a "doggy treat "

name: Marcia Washburn
text: This pharmacy is staffed by friendly loving and caring people. You receive small town service with high tech amenities. Just like the "big chain" pharmacies, Jim's Pharmacy notifies by text, email, or phone when prescriptions are ready or it is time for a refill. On the retail side of the store, the staff assists you in making correct choices, and if they don't have what you need, they will get it. What a great experience it is to be greeted by name as you walk through the front door! To sum it up, Jim's Pharmacy treats you like family!!!

name: Anne Hall
text: Very friendly staff and dedicated pharmacist.  Fast, friendly service conveniently located minutes from Lake Martin.  Come see Jim and let him take care of all your pharmacy needs!

name: John Allen

name: Shelley Jones
text: DO NOT USE THIS PHARMACY. They majorly screwed my prescriptions up (IE giving me the wrong number of pills ) and then tried to cover up a mistake that was made when the prescription was first getting filled. The new pharmacist then claimed that even though I was completely out of my non controlled prescription that I could not get an emergency fill even though they were the reason why I was in that position to begin with.

name: Edward Clayton
text: Out at a  softball game stop by Publix to get Refreshments snacks just enjoy the game

text: They never have your most needed medicine in stock.  They claim they'll have your seizure meds but don't.  Days go by and they won't get them in from another store.  They let patients suffer instead of getting the meds they need in stock. Ridiculous. Just sad and ridiculous.  God bless them.

name: Courtney Jackson
text: I ordered medicine 5 weeks ago and the head pharmacist said it would be here in a week and so I called every single week to check on it and I was lied to me multiple times by each of the pharmacist there. Then when I went in store they said it was never ordered and I never got a prescription. So the head pharmacist called the doctors office and said it was only referral to get the medicine. (Which would make no sense) and he said he would call me back that day to get the medicine because it was in stock. My doctors office called me and said they sent it to the only pharmacy that had in stock. Not only did they lie to me but my mom also. Plus I'm leaving out of the country and that kind of medicine is nothing to mess with 2 weeks before I leave!! I will not be getting anything else filled here.

name: Jeffery Boak
text: They were very professional and actually went above and beyond to try and get me what I needed at the lowest price. There's nothing worse then poor customer service, so it nice to get excellent service especially when your under the weather.

text: Fast, informative and wonderful peoples ofplecto help you ou.

name: Debbie Milam
text: The pharmacist  Suzanne Cooley stated, without checking, that their cost and Target's cost would be the same.  This is incorrect as they are a PREFERRED pharmacy and Target is not.  I will not use them again.  She had no knowledge of insurance and the parameters of PREFERRED vs. NON Preferred pharmacies.  Do yourself a favor and use a PREFERRED mom and pop Pharmacy and support your local community.

name: Richard Horton
text:
🙏💖😇👍FOR ME:  IN EVERY WAY PERFECT!
THANK YOU FOR ALL YOU DO!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Kesha!!

text: You won't find a pharmacy who cares more or goes out of their way farther to help you and take care of you than Hinkle Pharmacy! I can't say enough how many times they have gone above and beyond what is required and what, unfortunately, we have come to expect from most pharmacies. I highly recommend this pharmacy to everyone I know!!!!

name: Mandy McDonald
text: Very quick and efficient... and they are one of the only pharmacies in Birmingham area that has Tamiflu, they are compounding it in house.  Good looking out Hinkle and thanks for your service to the community.

name: Jacqi Robinson
text: I am so thankful for the nice lady who helped me today at Hinkle pharmacy. I work nearly every day and got by my grandparents today on one of my 2 days off this month to help him since he had just had surgery and he tells me he needs his inhaler re-fill. I go straight to hinkle and the gate is down and I notice they close at 1pm (its 1:20pm) so I drive to the window to look at their hours and a nice lady opens the gate and window and ask how she can help. I proceed to tell her I was looking to see when I needed to get someone to come back for his prescription and she says she can help me and she proceeded to fill my granddad's prescription for me..I cannot tell you how much this meant to me, I care for my grandparents as much as I am able to and for her to go out of her way she has no idea how much she helped me today! I honestly would not have been able to make it back for weeks to get his prescription. I was in tears and am so grateful! Thank you hinkle pharmacy!

name: Danna Marsh
text: I've only used Hinkle's once and I had a wondeful experience. I'd recommend this pharmacy to anyone in the local area. Very fast and nice employees.

The icing on the cake was when my wife reached out her hand to receive her change it was put on the counter instead. Will not fill any prescriptions there ever again!!!!!!

text: I tried to order a cake for my boss and was hung up on 7 times within 15 minutes. And when I asked to speak to the manager on duty they decided to hang up on me again. I’ve worked with Publix for 8 years. I know how the system works. I’ve always talked about how amazing Publix is and how wonderful staffed they are. But I WILL NEVER GO BACK THERE AGAIN!! If I could give them ZERO stars I would. They don’t deserve 1 star

name: Curtis Armstrong
text:
My experience the last few visits has been to be generally ignored at the counter for a few minutes before being acknowledged, and then a few more minutes before someone helps.
This last time I went to pick up 2 prescriptions.  I had received a text message about an hour and a half before that a prescription was ready, so I assumed they would both be ready.  After I was finally waited on, she only had 1 prescription so I asked about the other one, to which she replied "It hasn't come through".   I thought that was strange as they should have both been ordered from the Dr's office at the same time, but I said I'd go home and call the doctor.  When I arrived home 15 minutes later I received a text stating that I had another prescription ready at the Publix pharmacy, so the order apparently had come through and she either didn't know how to check or didn't bother.
I'm going to look for a better pharmacy.

name: Heather Lawson
text: Everytime I go to this publix I am greeted with the kindest smiles and the customer service is outstanding!! My kids love going with me because the checkout people never fail to say hello and offer them a balloon!! Oh and the SUSHI is phenomenal... Blows all the other actual sushi restaurants away!!! Thanks again for making my experience completely and 100% enjoyable!!

name: Beatrix Thornbriar
text: Updating this now. This is the fourth time I’ve seen associates in the pharmacy using masks incorrectly/not wearing them period. Hold your associates accountable, Publix. I’m tired of asking medical professionals to be medically safe with people’s meds.

text: They lack customer service, 5 people behind the counter and not a one knows what they are doing. They couldn't find my medicine and said they were not filling any of my other medicines that day. I will be taking my business to the family owned pharmacy.  I use to get my scripts at the pharmacy in Florida and was always welcomed and only had to wait 10 minutes max for a script. Publix is suppose to be friendly but not this one.  The right hand does not know what the left hand is doing. To treat people so rudely is not acceptable.  I will never walk into your store again and neither will my family, you just lost a total of four people from my family alone as you messed up their meds to and treated them rudely.

text: This is the worst pharmacy I have ever experienced. The pharmacist and techs at this location failed to fill my Rx for the correct qty, gave me a few different reasons for why, and caused me to have to contact my physician and insurance company several different times over the span of 2 weeks. The main issue; however, is the pharmacist hung up on me twice. He was unprofessional and so rude that I had to report him.

text: They always ignore me when I go. I have to wait such a long time for someone to acknowledge me. Never coming back!

text: The worst pharmacy ever. Such a long wait to actually fill your prescription. Then another long wait to actually pay for it. Learned my lesson and I'll never ever get my prescription filled here. Rude pharmacy workers. The rest of the store employees and managers make up for their sorry excuse for a pharmacy.

name: Stephanie Chandler
text: Always a horrible wait.  First called in prescription then not ready an hour and half later.   Second come to pick it up that afternoon after work, only to wait 25 mins for it.  All with 5 people working in the pharmacy.   Time to find a new pharmacy.

name: savannah,s life of friends and fun
text: I have been using this pharmacy since they opened to get my meds my daughters meds and also my mother's and each time they continue to get worse. They never have it ready when they say they will then after you have already sat in their drive thru for 30 minutes they will ask you to go to the end of the line again as yours isnt ready yet. I went to pick up one for my daughter on Dec 12th  and was suppose to be 2 bottles. When the girl working gave it to me I said there is suppose to be 2. Well she acted totally dumb and stood and looked at the computer for a few minutes then said her insurance would only pay for one. This is not the first time we have got this medicine and they have to get a prior authority  from insurance to get it. ShI told her what she needed to do and she said oh ok I will put in for it. Today I called and guess the girl just stood in my face and lied because it wasn't done. Will  be so happy when they open the new pharmacy on the Southside as they will definitely  have all our business. I'm done with PubliX and their rude employees.

name: Janet Snellgrove
text: Courteous, went out of their way to help. Five stars.

name: Penny Farmer
text: im not giving this any stars it made me check one to post  the dr called in my meds to publix at cottonwood corners about 2 pm today i got to publix about 2.30 and was told it would be about 40 minutes so i said ill be back in a little while to get it i get back at 5.30 pm 3 hours later wait behind 3 other cars for my turn in the drive thur i  was waited on by  Erin H.who ask for my name then walked away and was gone for quite a few mintues when she returned it was to ask me to drive around the building and get back in line as another car was now behind me and i  ask is my meds not ready she we are finishing yours up now so if you will just drive around and come back so i said i left here 3 hours ago being told my meds would be ready in fourty minutes what happened to that she shugged her shoulders and said we got busy and i said ok so if i was was waiting in the parking lot all this time i would still be waiting she said i dont know and i said well im not moving she said well we are working on yours now i said i have a problem with them not being ready after 3 hours she laughed turned off her speaker and walked away so to publix i know losing my business will not make one difference in your pay check you will make the same without my help but it does make a difference to me that i  have a choice to go else where and i plan on doing so tomorrow morning to the people i made wait behind me im sorry it wasnt my choice i would rather my meds been ready after 3 hours  to the young lady who waited on me  you need to practice ypur customer skills or continue to lose publix one  more customer here and there  till it does make a difference and your jobless you may find then  who pays you is the customers and before you laugh and walk away you remember that so with all that being said  i will not take a spot in your drive thur again and i hope publix begins to act like more than a fast food drive thur for the customers they keep

text: There is NO reason anyone should leave a bad review. Been coming here for years. They are the nicest people, very fast and cheap. The other day I dropped my daughters medicine off and it was not covered by her insurance. He called on my behalf to change it to one they would cover. There is no other place that would ever do this. So that proves money is not the point. Friendly service is. And that's all I've ever gotten over years. I work at the hospital we have are own pharmacy but will not change over. Cant thank them enough for all they do!

They need to work on their customer service skills.

Great for business.

name: Kimberly Owens
text: Medicap Pharmacy is exceptional on every level. Owner Karen Kight is not only a wonderful, knowledgeable, pharmacist but she is the kindest, caring, helpful, and dedicated person that I have ever met. She and her staff always greet You by name with a smile and a how may I help you today attitude. They are very knowledgeable, friendly, team players in a business that I depend on for life-saving medications. She has instilled such a level of trust in Me by her mannerisms and character that I know I am in good hands with Karen. Please support Medicap Pharmacy in Spanish Fort. We will love the service you get from Miss Karen and all the employees there.

name: Annette Sebastian
text: Pharmacist Karen Kight goes out of her way to help make things right.  I stopped by the pharmacy to talk with her before calling our doctor.  She was able to talk with the doctor’s office to let them know how to submit prescription so I could take a medication out of the country.  Thank you so much Karen!   Another time I needed a refill for an EpiPen.  The medication I got had the longest shelf life I’ve ever gotten from any pharmacy.  To spam a whole school year and more is invaluable.    I highly recommend Medicap Pharmacy.

name: Scott Keevan
text: Always helpful and works well with insurance and doesn't seem to have many issues that some pharmacies have. They even deliver in the Spanish Fort area, and are close enough to Daphne that I suggest it to the Daphne area citizens as well! Thanks medicap!

name: Janet English
text: Best pharmacy I've ever used! Need to know about drug interactions? Need help getting a refill -- when there's an insurance and/or doctor issue? Too sick to even pick up your meds? This is the place to go. Karen Kight and crew are always willing to lend a hand.

name: Mark Jackson
text: Great local pharmacy with friendly, helpful folks! Thank you!

name: Taylor
text:
Pharmacist extremely rude- I know they have a policy for 24-48 hours of notice before refill for compounding but I couldn’t give my daughter her reflux medicine because of my son microwaving it (toddler problems). When I asked the pharmacist when it would be ready since my daughter was already miserable and couldn’t eat because her reflux was so severe the pharmacist said that my daughter was not “priority” and refused to give me an estimated time or even day it would be ready. I get that my kid isn’t your kid but you NEVER tell a parent that their child is not your priority. Moving my compounding prescriptions somewhere else.

The other staff members are very friendly and helpful- just the pharmacist is the reason I’m leaving.

text: I agree with other reviewers that this pharmacy deserves more than 5 stars. I worked virtually with Clint at Midtown to help get a group of people vaccinated. They went above and beyond to get the job done!! Friendly, thoughtful, creative, accommodating, gracious and an absolute pleasure!!

name: Jacob Smith
text: Absolutely incredible! I walked in to get some over the counter items and was miraculously impressed with the head pharmacist. He was extremely helpful, polite, courteous, and he clearly valued my business. I will always choose Midtown Pharmacy over any big box chain.

name: Mark Minnaert
text: Great service. You won't go back to the box stores. And the prices are great. I can not say enough positive things.  Clearly the best pharmacy in the Mobile area.

name: Mrs. O
text: I drive 30 mins to get here because they treat you with such kindness and respect.  You dont feel like a number! The pharmacist is always there for you and the staff are very friendly.

name: Ashley Scott
text:
Omg...The service is excellent
ive never had a problem with getting my medicine. The staff including pharmacist are outstanding!!! I would hate to have to go to another pharmcy thats how simple amd easy this pharmacy makesy visits for me

name: Rozell Pritchard
text: The  prescriptions are ready within minutes most of the time upon drop off. The issue is the head Pharmacist, he's rude and speaks only to certain group of people. He greets that set of customers and ignores the rest. When you ask him a question directly he replies answers to the other staff members to relay as I am standing there 6 ft away, just to avoid speaking to me.  To top it off he has never once asked me how your doing but quick to accuse you of abusing drugs. I honestly would not recomend this Pharmacy to anyone as long as he is running it.

name: Hannah S
text: Great friendly staff and really fast service.

name: Jerry Persons
text:
Best pharmacy in mobile,Al. Hands down!!!
You can literally walk in , give them your perscription and within 10 mins. , It's filled and your out the door...non of that drop off and come back hours later like the big box stores.....

name: J Char
text: Best pharmacy I've ever been to! I used to hate going to the pharmacy until I started going here. Usually I'm on and out within 10 minutes, 20 at the most and everyone knows me by name and is very friendly. If you want a pharmacist that cares about you as a person not just a customer and truly tries to help you out with any questions, problems or recommendations then Midtown Pharmacy is the place to go.

name: Marilyn A
text: I love this place! They're all so kind and considerate and willing to help no matter what.

text: Best burgers ever! My mom and I have been going since I was little and she's been going since she was in high school. It's a family tradition that we always look forward to!

name: Beverly Cole-Luchansky
text: Terrible service at the restaurant today. My husband ordered a BLT sandwich and it only had a few crumbled, super crispy pieces of bacon on it. The sandwich was basically lettuce tomatoes and a few bacon bits on untrusted bread. When we brought it to their attention, they were very rude and condescending. We will not be back!

name: John Gray
text: The old fashioned soda fountain inside the drug store is great. Milkshakes burgers and fries you can't go wrong love to this place.

name: josh wright
text: Best hamburger steak I've ever had! Service was great as well. Haven't been here in 25 years and they are just as good as I remember. Prices are cheaper than most fast food. So worth the visit!

name: Joseph
text: I really enjoyed my visit to the Green Valley Drug soda fountain.  Their burgers are for adults who desire that old-fashioned taste of quality and substance.  I recommend their milkshakes as well.  If you're in a hurry, you won't have time to fully experience what makes this little restaurant unique.  Go when you have time to talk to the women who work behind the counter and observe the other patrons come and go...you'll discover why they have so many regulars who've been coming back for years.  The restaurant isn't open on the weekend and it closes at 3 pm during the week.

name: gerry daniel
text: Locally owned business. Friendly staff and environment. In addition to typical pharmacy products and services, there is a lunch counter. The service, food, and staff are excellent.. The items on the menu are reasonably priced.It has been there for many years.  I highly recommend it.

name: Andrea Richardson
text: It’s hard to beat the soda fountain!  Such a good burger and fries.

name: Bert Stephens
text:
This is the most awesome place in Birmingham!! I have been trading
with them for many, many years. They have the friendliest staff you have EVER dealt with. One day while picking up my prescriptions, i did not have
enough cash. I asked the young Lady to hold onto one, as I had been thru
a "Tough" Month and low on money. She,(a college student) Sneaked and took her own money and paid for my medicine. I am a 52 year old 325LB.
man, I have to admit, I broke down and cried. The crazy thing is, I believe all of Bills employees would have done it! And, there is no way I can write this review, and not mention the incredible FOOD! Yes, BEST Hamburgers and Home made Shakes in Birmingham. Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!!!

name: Lance Moore
text:
The grilled pimento cheese sandwich with bacon, lettuce and tomato was delicious but pricey. $7 with tax.

They are known for their old time feel serving burgers and old fashioned shakes.

name: Chris A
text:
So my wife is on a specific brand of medication (the other generics cause an allergic reaction), and I tried to contact this pharmacy to see if we could switch her prescription to that pharmacy.

I was directed to the pharmacist who immediately accused us of "med-seeking" in the snarkiest and most rude tone I have ever heard a professional use in my entire life.

Nothing was said on my part that could be considered "a trigger," nor was anything rude said that could've put this pharmacist in a mood.

Sad considering that places like Green Valley are a dying breed in modern America, but I would have to say avoid this place like the plague.

name: Allison Burns
text: I've been coming here for lunch since I was a kid and now I bring mine.  It's an awesome place with great food and old fashioned shakes.

name: Susan Lange
text: Great Cheese Burger!

text: ALWAYS out of stock! We are repeat monthly customers and they still never have the medication in stock. I recommend choosing another pharmacy!!

name: Steve Hackett
text:
Best Walgreens store around.
Very nice employees especially.
Thank you

name: amber mounce
text: My daughters doctor sent over a prescription at 1030 in the morning. I called at 8pm to check on why i had not been notified it was ready. And I was told we were waiting to see tomorrow if it would come in on Friday. If I had not called I would have never known that it would be 3 days for her medicine to be in. It concerns me that this pharmacy does not notify a patient that they dont have a medication available. The Doctor could have sent it somewhere else.

name: Patrcia Clayton
text: On numerous occasions the store in Opp has greatly been a disappointment.  At least every other prescription they have to order. And twice they have entered my insurance  information incorrect causing me to have to contact my insurance to find out why it was being declined only to find out it was employees not entering my information correctly causing me a delay in getting my medicine. I will no longer do any business with their pharmacy.  Plus all the prices on any other product in their store cost almost double what I would pay elsewhere. Goodbye Rite Aid,  this customer will not be back.

name: Janet Watson
text: Store is clean and nicely organized.  Friendly cashier's.

text: Customer service in pharmacy is very unprofessional and slow, i was sent to wait at consultation and waited for 15 min. Pharmacist never came to consult with me so i left.

text:
They are the best of the best. So kind, and helpful. A lot of knowledge.fair prices. They still make Rx to order .

It's like their world stopped in 1957 as to manners and courtesy. Respect and honestly.

My favorite Rx in America....

God bless them.

Chief

name: Samantha K. McDaniel
text: This review is pointedly for the gift shopping availability - in a small town it means a lot to know there are places to go to find someone for most everyone -  and a wide variety of home goods including accent rugs, flags, candles, wax melts/warmers, seasonal dishes and decorating items, clothing, shoes, hats, jewelry, quality toys - and guns, LOL.  And let us not forget guns and supplies.  Thanks for providing options in our small town!

name: Dovie mott
text: The staff at this pharmacy were some of the nicest, most helpful employees. Tom the pharmacist, went out of his way to explain the medication, how to use it and was just easy to understand. It was a compound prescription and this was the closest place to purchase it. I wasn’t real pleased I had to drive to Florala to get it, but it was well worth the drive, because of the assistance and genuine nice people that work there.

name: Ali Matthews
text: We were traveling through this town on our way home from a Florida vacation. Suddenly our son got sick so we ventured into this pharmacy. The staff and pharmacist genuinely cared and despite the vomit my 4 year old son left on their front sidewalk they loaded us with Powerade and nausea relief medication. We left with smiling faces and staff sending us well wishes for our journey home. Truly great people and left us wishing we had one of these pharmacies in our hometown!

Thank you Jeff and your staff for going above and beyond to help your community. You are all noticed and appreciated

text: Service service service service! Woo service.  Boo prices.  But woooooooooo service.  They'll bend over backwards for people that just imagine up a problem, and even just give in to a-hole cons and jerks. . . But with legit issues, they're the absolute best.

text: It's been twice lately they haven't had my medication had to order it the last time again about to go somewhere else

name: Heather Rector
text: The older man working there is very sweet and kind.  Will help you with anything,  takes nice care of you.  I suggest that if you want to find a pharmacy this isnt the one to go to.  The women in there are very very rude.  They talk bad about there customers behind thier backs  in front of people and call them drug heads and laugh when they leave the store.  One girl who works there waited untill my elder husband was walking out and said to another worker,  I cannot stand him.  He heard her and turned around and said thats fine.  I can hear you BTW.  They make Alteast 500$ from him a month on prescriptions.  Their clothes and other things are way way over prices for what they are.  Also..  Please do not waste your money on their tanning beds.  They are not,  I repeat are not worth the money you will be spending!  Find somewhere else to tan.  Like I said there is a few sweet people who work there. If they know you well they will get your scripts to you quickly but with in the last 6 months it takes them anywhere between 45 mins to an hour.  Its definantly not a little sweet hometown vibe!  I REPEAT  THEY DO TALK ABOUT THEIR COSTUMERS WHEN THEY WALK OUT THE DOORS!  I would look for a different pharmacy!

name: Tee Woods
text: Mark and co. I just love your heart and soul. Your business is a testament to the caring heart you guys have. Going into your business sincerely feels like home. All employees are helpful and honestly care about the customer. Wishing you and yours a very Merry Christmas and a Happy New yearPeace Love and Guiding Light my beautiful friends💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜

resp.text: Kristen we appreciate you so much!  You have the kindest heart! ❤️

They have the best staff in the world you feel welcomed the minute you walk in, you don't find that much anymore.  I'm so glad I changed pharmacies cause I'm not staying upset with the issues I had before I changed.  I feel blessed that I found them and highly recommend them.  The best people you'd ever want to know. Thanks Mark and all of his staff.😌🙏

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. McMurrey!  We appreciate you so much!  We love what we do and enjoy serving this community!😊

resp.text: Thanks Brandy!  We really appreciate you!

text: Great family owned establishment! The entire staff is friendly and treats you like part of their family. The pharmacist is helpful and genuinely compassionate. resp.text: Thanks so much Jessica!  So glad to help!  See you again soon!😊

There is a drive-thru window. The store is very well stocked with home healthcare items. They also can make "compound" prescriptions.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We were closed Monday and Tuesday due to the inclement weather. However, our locations are open today from 10am to 3pm. We anticipate opening again tomorrow at 10am. Please call your local store to set up your refill. In the future, you can visit us on Facebook for any updates regarding weather.

Ugh, it took 40 mins to get a prescription that was supposedly “ready”!!!! I can say that the pharmist Keith was super quick and nice. He’s the only reason for the 3 stars.

text: wonderful pharmacy! personal service at all times. we have used The Drug Store for all of our needs for many years now. we are so fortunate to have a privately owned business that cares so much about every single customer. Thank you for such great service for so long!

name: Anna Jones
text: I was sick with COVID 19 in early July. I went to this drugstore 5 days after symptoms started to get a blood antibodies test, which I paid $60 for and it came out negative. The nasal tests in Auburn were backed up at the time and this was the only test available. The staff told me to come back in a week and that if I truly did had COVID19 it would be positive In a week, at least for antibodies. I went back a week later, paid another $60 and my second test was also negative. At this point my taste and smell were gone, I had a fever, body aches, etc. The next week I went to my hometown and got another blood antibodies test at a different pharmacy (Not rapid, 3-5 days for results) and they called 4 days later saying I am positive for antibodies. Long story short, don’t go here for your antibodies test if you don’t want to pay a chunk of money and receive a inaccurate test.

name: Lynn Huggins
text: The Drug Store is a special kind of place that is hard to find these days. The pharmacists love what they do and care about their customers. And it shows. My whole family has been going to them since we moved to town over 16 yrs ago. They treat you like family and never make you feel like you are a bother when you ask questions. I can't say enough good things about them.

name: Lura New
text: Outstanding service and pharmacists who are very knowledgeable and always happy to answer questions.

name: M Stevens
text: Fast, friendly hometown service. This pharmacy is the best pharmacy in Auburn in my opinion. Courteous expert service that the big box pharmacies cannot offer.

name: Stacy Hudmon
text: Great customer service. You're not just treated as a number, you're treated like a friend.

name: Cindi Johnson (CJ)
text:
Hands down the BEST place in Auburn for all your pharmacy needs!
Being disabled, their delivery service is great, but whenever they have had issues with their drivers the actual pharmacist (whom I've spoken with over the phone several times) actually delivered my medications to me HIMSELF -
That's called customer service!!!
If I need a specific or special medicine, they are more than happy to order it as well as keeping the next order for me "on hand", So I'm not having to wait.
There's NO reason to go to a "Big Name" pharmacy - when you have the exceptional, professional, and above and beyond level of care that "The Drug Store" provides. 👍🏻

name: John B. Newton
text: Super in every way!! They are unbelievably kind, always helpful, and couldn't be any faster!!  I am not basing this review after a single experience.  My wife and I have been patrons there for many, many years.   It has always been a great experience!!!

My money will be spent here.

name: Fun it up Funning it up!
text: My husband and I moved to the area 1 year ago and decided to try the pharmacy for the convenience. I stopped in and filled out my paperwork and told the pharmacist(the pharmacist) that my husband was almost out of his thyroid medicine and would need it by the next day. He assures me he can take care of it and they would call me when everything got taken care of. I wait and wait and hours later no call. I call back and they tell me they lost my paper work( social security numbers on it and our personal information) and that it was more than likely shredded. The next day I received a call and they apologized so I decided to try again. Disappointed would be an understatement. Several prescriptions messed up and always tend to blame it on the system. I wish them well and hopefully they will get better. We have moved all our prescriptions back to our old pharmacy. It’s just worth the drive.

text: I called the pharmacy because I was shorted on my cream for pain. I do not think it was intentional but the response I got from them was full of excuses and basically telling me I was dishonest. The compound worked great but I put a great deal of customer service at the top. I felt humiliated and that was enough for me. I won't use them again.

name: carol lowe
text: I have been going to this pharmacy for many years and find the knowledge and service impeccable.  Never have I had any feeling that anyone there didn't have knowledge of what they are doing.  The kindness and acknowledgement they extend to all of their Customers whether a one time Customer or dedicated Customer can't be beat or reached by any other pharmacy.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Carol. We have enjoyed getting to know and serving you!

name: Connie Sparman
text: They will go out of the way to help you get everything you need.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review! We appreciate you and your business.

text: We would like to recognize Kayla for all her help on Friday!! She is amazing and truly exceptional and went above and beyond!

name: Heidi Mueller
text: Thanks for Compounding, gives So Many choices for treatment/prevention. Special blends in Vitamins (for kids also), topical ointments, even essential oils!!! And the staff is so great, they are all so knowledgeable to help you find Exactly what you need. Just wished I would have found them earlier, they will always have my business!!!

name: rickey irvin
text: The best pharmacy I've ever used. Ive been using them for over 5 years I'm on social security and they work with me on the bad time of the month.

name: vanessa brown
text: My first time using this pharmacy. I was a new customer, out of town plus out of state. They treated me as though I had always used their services.  When I ran into difficulties with my insurance, they stayed open to see if the problem could be resolved. I dare you to find a chain pharmacy that will do that for someone they don't know. Absolutely wonderful pharmacist to clerk. Thank you.

name: Chris Kelso
text: The pharmicist is very rude. Constantly messing up on my grandmothers prescriptions. Filling scripts that dont need to be filled and have no clue whats going on. This is a ongoing problem and they still cannot get it right. Try to give benefit of doubt but you can only screw up so many times.was told i should find another pharmacy due to them making mistakes.

name: John Converse
text: Purchased mineral supplements.  The young lady that waited on me was very helpful and friendly.

name: Ray Hunt
text: They act like they just can't stand it when u ask about a insurance issue cry cry cry. Lol!!!

text: The best pharmacy with the best staff 😊
