text: Wonderful pharmacy.

name: Connie Ballard
text: Nice friendly staff

name: Danielle Hays
text: Worst experience we have had with a drug company. Never received our supplies on time and constantly had to hassle them to send out our supplies. I voiced my concerns to the lead coordinator Jennifer many times and she never apologized or empathized with us. DO NOT USE!  We are now with Southeast Diabetes and so far have been pleased.

name: Charlotte Cook
text: Such a good place to buy MED supplies!!  Convenient, nice people, and offer such a variety of Everything!!!  Too much to list!!  My brother in law had knee replacement & needed a Walker before.discharge...It was ready &  loaded in just a few minutes ...and by a smiling pretty staff member.  THANKS Y'ALL

name: Corey Mahaffey
text: Very great customer service sweet people. Been in business for along time. Glover's are a great family honest loyal people

name: Holly Stiles
text: Had a great experience at first but slowly the customer service dwindled. Julie was always helpful and kind. Jennifer, not so much. Our last interaction she told me that I might need to find another pharmacy to fill my DME needs, after I questioned the length of time it took to file claims with BCBS. She thought I wouldn’t be able to find a supplier who could file in a timely manner. Guess what? I found one who files in less than a week and doesn’t create a backlog of claims for me to monitor. Thanks for pushing me in that direction, Jennifer. I’ve taken over $9,000 in business elsewhere.

name: Beth Tidwell
text: Long wait times. Don't fill meds when they are called in. "Lost" meds that were called in. And they're more expensive than other pharmacies.

name: david uptain
text: I have always been treated with respect and they're always ready to help with any problems that I have  I've been using Ken Glover drugs since they first opened I am well satisfied with their business

name: Elizabeth Patton
text: Contacted this pharmacy about a breast pump provided by BCBS.  Was promised that they would deliver it a month before the due date but it never arrived.  I have called numerous times with no one picking up, been on hold over ten minutes each time, and left several messages with no return call. Awful service, awful customer service.  I was hoping to work with a local small business but this isn't how you do business.  I'll have to call St. Vincent's in Birmingham now.

name: Caren Brown
text:
I would give 0 stars if that was an option but it's not. They will not return calls. I called to order my daughter's CGM supplies, they said would ship out the next day, a week later still haven't gotten them. Left 2 messages today and no return call. This has happened in the past too. Hoping to find another supplier.
Poor customer service.

name: jill billions
text: Have gotten Durable Medical Equipment for my daughter with CP here for years. They used to be very good. I don't know what has changed but they must be very busy. No longer return phone calls, can't answer questions about bills,..have been trying to reach them over two weeks for a billing question. Needed a replacement tube for my daughter who is fed through a g-tube into her stomach and it took a month. Too bad. down hill.

name: Samantha
text: Very difficult to get in contact with. Tried for days to get a hold of someone to fill my Dexcom transmitter order with no response during their office hours, emergency line was also sent to an unanswered voicemail. I consider my CGM a lifeline for me. My blood sugars are very difficult to manage without it, and I've been "flying blind" for days now. Will be switching to a different company. Not pleased with the lack of customer service from the Ken Glover employees.

name: Tracy Thrasher
text: I love love love it here they have great stuff and are so kind you can’t ask for more

name: Mys D
text: Fast  and  friendly  service .

name: Erica S
text: Amazing Pharmacy, employees!!

name: Tyler Vann
text: Pure Life Pharmacy is an amazing family oriented business. The Pharmacist are very knowledgeable and are always willingly available to answer any questions we may have about our medicine. I highly recommend the  mail program; it is very fast. Re filling our medication is just as simple as a reply to a text message. Everyone should use Pure Life Pharmacy.

resp.text: Tyler, thank you for posting a great point. We are focused on the family. Our three amazing pharmacists are also all amazing mothers. They understand family and children and what it means if someone is sick in the house. Taking the time to talk to a patient about their medication may help the whole family. Thank you for also pointing out our mailing program. We specialize in mailing out medications, vitamins and supplements and over-the-counter products. Thank you for using Pure Life Pharmacy.

name: Kelly Jackson
text: Pure Life is so very helpful, always taking the time to answer my questions and provide guidance when I’m not sure what I need. It’s a personalized pharmacy and I’ve never experienced anything like it. The staff is wonderful!

resp.text: Thank you Kelly, Personalized is medicine is what we do. We get to know every patient that spends time with us. Thank you for taking the time to leave a kind review.

name: Brittany Luckie
text: This place is amazing! The pharmacists really care in helping you! They are attentive and knowledgeable and truly care. They have a very fast turn around and will go the extra mile in helping you get what you need.

resp.text: We do truly care. Thank you Brittany. Our three amazing pharmacists Alyna, Joanna and Hayley love talking to anyone who has a question and will talk for as long as that patient needs. Thank you again for leaving this wonderful review.

name: Jamie Rottger
text: This is the most AMAZING Pharmacy! The pharmacists are very knowledgeable and always take time to answer all of my questions. The staff is friendly and I NEVER have to wait!

resp.text: Jamie, thank you for taking the time to give us a rating. Our amazing pharmacists Alyna, Joanna, and Hayley love talking to patients and will spend as long as you need discussing your medication. They love what they do and are here to help. Thank you again for taking the time to rate our pharmacy.

name: Janet Baker
text: The best pharmacy ever!  So proud to have them in our area.  Pharmacists are very knowledgeable.  The entire staff are so kind and helpful

resp.text: Thank you Janet, our pharmacists love what they do and it shows. They make sure to take their time with any patient willing to listen. We are fortunate to have our 3 amazing and brilliant pharmacists. Thank you again for taking the time to leave a review and comment.

name: Rose Strotman
text: The Pharmacist's are so knowledgeable. They never act rushed. They are so help

resp.text: Thank you Rose! Our pharmacists would never rush a conversation. It seems like everything in the medical community is rushed. We do things differently. Our pharmacists slow the conversation down so nothing is missed. They very much enjoy talking with and helping patients. Thank you again for taking the time to leave a review.

name: Becky Taylor
text: I really appreciate Pure Life Pharmacy's unique approach by providing medicine and supplements at a reasonable price. They provide a valuable service to our community. Innovative and professional staff!

resp.text: And we appreciate you Becky! We are doing everything we can to lower the cost of medicine. Thank you for mentioning our supplements. If you want to know what to should take to stay healthy, there is no other practitioner as easy to get in touch with than a pharmacist. Our 3 amazing pharmacists love talking vitamins and supplements. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.

name: Bubba Mchan
text: Best pharmacy I have ever been too. Customer service is the best, and the best part is they deliver!!!!! During these crazy times that’s a definite plus!

resp.text: Bubba, Thank you for spreading the word about our deliveries and our service. People shouldn't dread going to a pharmacy or feel like a pharmacy is a hassle. We are working hard to make our patient's experience with us enjoyable. Thank you again for taking the time to give us feedback on our efforts.

name: Amy Travis
text: The pharmacists here are top of the line and truly care about the concerns of their customers. They go above and beyond to meet the health needs of each individual and are kind and professional in the process!!

resp.text: Thank you Amy! Our pharmacists love what they do and it shows when you talk to them. We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.

name: Angela Kelly
text: I am completely satisfied with the knowledge and customer care being provided to me by PureLife Pharmacy!!! Not only are they fast, accurate, accommodating, but have become family to me! Highest of recommendation for them.

resp.text: Thank you Angela, you are family! We focus on our patients and will get to know you pretty well if you talk to us a bit. Thank you for taking the time to write such a kind review.

name: Katie Riggins
text: Great professionalism! Ready to serve customers with compassion. Thanks for being diligent and helpful.

resp.text: Katie, thank you for recognizing our compassion. Going to the pharmacy shouldn't be dreaded. You shouldn't feel rushed when discussing your medication. We love talking with patients and look forward to answering any questions. Thank you again for using us.

name: Mandy Parker
text: The Staff at Pure Life is very knowledgeable and helpful with meeting whatever needs you have! There is a quick turnaround when filling prescriptions. They always go the extra mile to help with whatever I need.

resp.text: Mandy, thank you for using our pharmacy. We do our best to take the time for each patient and answer any questions you may have. Our pharmacists strive to be the most accessible practitioners in our area. No appointments necessary. Thank you again for your kind post.

name: Jennifer Polk
text: Wonderful pharmacy that can fill all of your needs but specializes in compounding.  Prices are great too!

resp.text: Thank you Jennifer. The foundation of our pharmacy is the compounding. We have a state of the art compounding lab that we hope everyone checks out through the window in lobby or online. Our prices are great! We hope you save a lot of money with us. Thank you again for using Pure Life Pharmacy.

name: Mindy Smith
text: Love Pure Life Pharmacy! The pharmacists and staff are professional, prompt, and thorough with explanation on medication, refills, etc.  I highly recommend.

resp.text: And we love you! Thank you Mindy for the kind words. We are striving to do our best and we appreciate when our patients notice. Thank you.

name: Stephanie Evans
text: Great products and a super knowledgeable, friendly staff! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Stephanie. Our pharmacists (Alyna, Joanna & Hayley) have over 33 years combined experience and a passion to share that knowledge with any patient with a question. Thank you for taking time our of your day to write a great review for us.

name: Wes Smith
text: Very good pharmacy. They are so friendly when I visit and the staff is always on top of it.

resp.text: Thank you Wes, our pharmacy works hard to separate ourselves from other big chain pharmacies with our service. Thank you for sending us your great review.

name: LeLe Fraser
text: Pure Life is a gift to the community of Foley and surrounding areas. They go the extra mile and do so much to educate, inform, and care for their customers.

resp.text: LeLe, thank you for your kind words. We are trying to be the pharmacy that the community wants, not simply a pill dispensing warehouse. Our pharmacists and technicians love answering questions and helping patients any way they can. Thank you again for using our pharmacy.

name: TANA S BRITT
text:
So thankful for the friendly, professional staff at Pure Life Pharmacy! They transferred my RX from another Pharmacy, and actually costs less with quality ingredients.

Pharmacist Hayley Thompson works closely with my physician to ensure the RX’s are compounded especially for my best health needs.

If you are looking for a local pharmacy that fills your prescriptions AND your life with caring, personal service? Great news...Pure Life Pharmacy will take care of you too.

resp.text: Tana, thank you for such wonderful review. Haley (and the other pharmacists Alyna & Joanna) love working with and helping patients. They are focused on health, wellness and lowering cost of medicine. They will spend as much time needed with any patient to achieve those goals. We appreciate you taking the time to write your kind review.

name: Cheryl Hitt
text:
We love the Services provided and the staff.
The Pharmacist is very polite and gives great advice.
I recently learned that the owner provides regular prescriptions $4 above his cost.
I don’t know of anybody who does this.

resp.text: Cheryl, thank you for your review. To my knowledge, there are no other pharmacies like us in the entire state. We cancelled all our insurance contracts and sell prescription medications directly at as low a cost as we can afford. We consider pricing medication a moral decision. We want to do the right thing and help lower the cost of medicine. Thank you again for taking the time to post a kind review.

name: Steve Dalby
text: Took them four (4) days to fill my prescription

resp.text: Hello Steve, Thank you for reaching out to us. 4 days is far too long if this is a regular manufactured prescription. However, you may have gotten a compounded medication from us. May I ask if this prescription was a compound? If this was a compounded medication, we should have let you know that compounds will take at least 2 working days to make. This 2 day delay is because of the time it takes to hand make a compounded medication. Also, we are not open on the weekends, so these 2 working days may be stretched to be 4 actual days before you can pick up your compounded medication. Compounding is a very labor intensive and precise task that cannot be rushed if we are going to produce a quality medication to the exact specifications of your prescribing physician. I apologize if we failed to mention this delay when you came to fill with us. I would like to make things right by offering a $50 store credit to apply to any future purchase with us. Please call the pharmacy and ask for me. I would love to speak with you about resolving this issue. ~ Jeffrey (Owner, Pure Life Pharmacy)

name: Tonya Fredriksen
text: This is one of the Best Pharmacy I have ever used!

resp.text: Thank you Tonya, that's a big statement and we love it! We will work hard to stay the best. Thank you again for great review.

name: Avery Thompson
text: Great Service with Extremely Professional and Friendly Care!!!! Highly Recommend!!!!

resp.text: Avery thank you for your exited remarks. It makes us feel really good that our patients see that we care and we try to provide the best service. Thank you again for taking the time to share how you feel about Pure Life Pharmacy.

name: Lourraine Wentworth
text: The Pharmacist at Pure Life are more than happy to speak with you about the medicine prescribed with details of what to expect from medicine and cost. Pure Life Pharmacy is a compounding pharmacy where you can get medicine that not all pharmacy's offer. Most are less expensive than other pharmacy's Pure Life Pharmacy also has vitamins and Medical Grade CBD oral and topical. We are happy to have found such a awesome group here in Foley Alabama.

resp.text: Thank you Lourraine, we love to talking to our patients. The pharmacists talk lot about what vitamins and supplements to take with our patients. The world of supplements is huge and the pharmacist will cut it down for you down with their vast knowledge. We are also happy you found us! Thank you again for a kind review.

name: Leslie Smith
text:
Wonderful pharmacy with very helpful staff!

I love the convenience of delivery and mail options .

resp.text: Leslie, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We have been mailing out for a long time and we are good at it. Delivery and mail options are an important part of a pharmacies services. Thank you again for taking the time to write a review.

name: Ray Reynolds
text: Great products. Friendly staff

resp.text: Thank you Ray. Being friendly is an important part of our pharmacy. Thank you for taking the time to write a review for us.

name: Fred Peace II
text: My mother suffers from rheumatoid arthritis. Due to her pain gradually increasing she has been unable to completely close her hands for the last several years and dropping small objects the last several months. The Pharmacist asked us several questions and suggested a topical product they sell in the store over the counter. Shortly after applying the product mom started bending her fingers and she clenched her fist and started crying because it did not hurt. I realized the Pharmacist teared up when she saw this happen. I cannot express my gratitude and appreciation for the Pharmacist’s insight and the effort they they gave in making this new medication possible. I can only give them my sincerest thank you. Thank you for making this possible and thank you for helping us.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing that story Fred. We hope your mother had continued success with our over the counter cream. Listening to patients is the key to being able to help. It's wonderful that it all worked out. Thank you again for taking the time to write your review.

name: Desiree Smith
text: I was sent here to pick up a prescription by my physician. I called about my prescription since I heard nothing from them about it. The person I spoke to you as not knowledgeable at all about my medication and when I asked for someone who could tell me more about it the lady was not much help either. Most pharmacists or technicians will answer any questions you may have in great detail. I just did not feel good about my experience here.

resp.text: Hello Desiree, thank you for taking the time and letting us know about this issue. We apologize you had a unsatisfactory experience with us and we took your comment to heart. We had an internal meeting to discuss how this could have happened. We have some ideas of how this could have happened and we would like to talk to you directly about your experience. We have always prided ourself on our knowledge and experience, so this comment hit home. We have 3 very special pharmacists at Pure Life Pharmacy; Alyna, Joanna, and Hayley have over 45 years of combined pharmacy experience. These three are dedicated to answering patient questions correctly. If you check these messages we would love to discuss your experience off-line. Please call us. We would be happy to discuss the issue when ever you have a moment.

name: Linsey Lees
text: Their staff has amazing knowledge and customer service. It is refreshing to know without insurance I can obtain a prescription at a more affordable cost than with insurance. Great place. They are the best!

resp.text: You're the best Linsey! Thank you for taking the time to leave a wonderful review.

name: Gail Forster

resp.text: Thank you Gail, we smile because we love helping others!

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Pure Life Pharmacy. Dont let the fact that they dont accept insurance scare you away. The medication here is exactly the same as prescribed and much, much cheaper even without insurance.

resp.text: And we love you too Kathryn! Thank you for mentioning that we skip insurance and its nothing to be afraid of. Skipping insurance allows us to set our own prices and save you money. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review.

text: I felt badly for the woman who waited on me at the pharmacy. She was obviously new and had no support. First she couldn't find my prescription because it wasn't in the bin where it belonged. After looking absolutely everywhere, she found it was still sitting next to the pharmacist who seemed to be deliberately ignoring everyone. She wasn't able to run my insurance and had to ask for assistance. The other attendant wasn't very friendly or helpful and gave me the highest possible cost for a medication that is covered under my insurance. The pharmacist sat 5 feet away at his computer terminal and ignored the whole fiasco. I was told normally they would call my insurance carrier to see what the issue is but the pharmacist "had a lot going on". The store wasn't busy at all. They're sending me reminders that my prescription is ready but still want the full price as if I have no insurance. I guess the pharmacist still "has a lot going on".  Never mind what's going on with the people who need their medications. We'll be fine.

I asked to speak to a manager and they refused to allow me to speak to a manager. Apparently they don't like it if you return things even if they are defective.

I do not recommend CVS.

They remember everyone's names. Other staff is so sweet I just can't remember all their names. Life is hard enough and them helping is a blessing. The only thing missing is a drive thru.

The bottom line is, I have found these people try very hard and they don't seem to tolerate the prevailing mind set of the major chains that is, "Don't you realize that we are doing you a favor by selling you your medications." The best overall that I have found.

There's never a line out of the door to get service, like some Walgreens, I won't mention. I recommend, even though they are only open M-F and have no drive-thru.

Go to Northport Pharmacy instead!! It’s cheaper!

I don’t know how a Big Pharmacy Giant like Walgreens can charge $70 for 1 pill, but Northport Pharmacy can charge $10 for that same pill.

I’m so glad I shopped around town for prices!

Walgreens had me sick about the cost of this medicine.

I’ve used this pharmacy for years and have formed relationships with everyone who works there because they’re dedicated to their jobs AND customers.
FYI- you can use the pharmacy without a Sam’s membership (but the membership does give you extra discounts!)
They’re always very efficient, very professional, and very friendly!

text: If I have not written a review for the Publix Pharmacy on Winchester, then I have been remiss. I have been getting my prescriptions and flu shots here for at least 10 yrs. AND, I get text messages to remind me if it is time to refill my prescriptions! AND, I can go online to refill them! The employees there are empathetic, caring and knowledgeable! I hope they realize how appreciated they are, not just by me, but by other people! Keep up the great work! I highly recommend this pharmacy! Thank you!

name: Corey Steele
text: I have gone here to fill my prescription the last few months and have always paid roughly $40 for my medication. I go here today and was told that it would be $160. Only reason being is that "the manager chooses not to accept any coupons." No GoodRx or even the coupon from the website that my doctor used to send the prescription electronically. I ran out today, have to work a 10 hour shift in the morning, and I can't work without my medication. So I was basically forced to pay an extra $120. I am fuming. Who does this person think they are to not let someone use something to help them get what they need? This is one of the worst "because I said so" scenarios I've ever encountered. I want a refund of my $120 that was unnecessarily spent and I'm calling in a complaint to corporate. The employees I dealt with were nice and I understand their position, but whoever this manager is needs to reevaluate themselves.

name: Mathew Sikes
text:
Said they do not accept coupons on "controlled" meds. This is the first time I've run into this issue... Below is an excerpt from goodrx website on the matter.
Pharmacies listed on GoodRx are contractually obligated to honor most coupons we display. However, discounts for controlled substances are honored at the discretion of the individual pharmacy or pharmacist. We are unable to require a pharmacy to fill the prescription or accept the coupon for a controlled medication, but the vast majority of pharmacies will honor coupons for controlled substances, and all pharmacies listed on GoodRx continue to honor GoodRx coupons and discount cards for controlled substances on an individual basis.

So they just choose to take unnecessary money from me and my family. For what reason?

Also,  my diabetes medicine, Metformin, is free at Publix, they also have a few antibiotics that a patient can get for free, just have to check the list, or the Dr can do it since, of course, you have to have a prescription. While waiting on my prescription, I said to myself that theses ladies deserve an online review... So here it is!

text: This is BY FAR the BEST wellness provider in Madison County.  Sooo much more than medicine --  They can help you with any medical issue under the sun.  Simply AMAZING staff -- they all have a heart for your best health.

name: Jessica Tollefson
text: Absolutely WONDERFUL service. I would HIGHLY recommend this compounding pharmacy to anyone and everyone in the Huntsville/Madison area who needs compounding services. I recently received a prescription from my dermatologist and it was called in to Madison Drugs to be compounded. The inside of this pharmacy is immaculate! It's extremely clean and it's nicely decorated. The pharmacist that explained my prescription to me was such a doll. I wish I could remember her name (thank you if you're reading this!). About two weeks after I picked up my prescription, I received a very nice courtesy call to ask about my experience and the service I was provided. I had nothing but positive things to say! And if that wasn't enough, I received a 'thank you' postcard in the mail with a coupon should I need a refill on my RX. In my opinion, customer service with that level of professionalism is a rarity these days. I genuinely appreciate the kindness and the extra mile that the pharmacy staff goes through to ensure exceptional service. Thanks so much!!

name: Nicole Suddath
text: They were very helpful!  Great place for natural living advice, gifts, wholistic healing products.

name: Denise White
text: I really like this place...in addition to the pharmacy, they have a great selection of supplements and services.

name: E G
text: After suffering from reflux and shoulder joint pain for months, taking medicines that just made me feel worse, not sleeping well, and having surgery posed as an option for my shoulder, I was at my wits' end.  A friend had told me about Terry and how he had helped her for years.  Well, I am a believer!  No more stomach, throat, or shoulder pain and feel great.  My family has seen the change and are in awe.   Thank you!

text: Ricky and other phamacists and staff have always been helpful and courteous.I dont know how they do it but even when theyre busy they have my prescription ready within 30 minutes maximum.Believe its because they staff the store to where they have enough people to fill all the orders that come in.Have used this pharmacy since year 2000 or so.and I turned 40 this year.I will be there tomorrow.

name: Paul Wimberley
text:
My parents have been using Pill Box Pharmacy and now I know why. After a day of dealing with doctors, hospitals, and a sick father, it was off to the pharmacy. As we pulled up there was a line of cars at the drive-thru and many people inside. I thought this would be just another step of an arduous day. It turned out to be one of the best customer service experiences I have ever had.

The ladies behind the counter were working as fast as they could and all were doing it with smiles, professionalism, and compassion. They looked like a well-oiled machine as they went from preparing the prescriptions to checking out customers. The Pharmacist had a laser-like focus on a complex set of instructions from our doctors. She presented different options to help us save money and make it easier on us to administer the necessary medicine.

Another lady sat down with my Mom to explain the devices we would be using and patiently showed her how to use them multiple times. She advised us on ways to save money in the future since we will now have a new expense to incur every month.

I can't say enough good things about everyone who helped us at the Pill Box last night. I only wish there was one in my town so I could move all of my prescriptions to them.

text: I have been using this pharmacy for about 5 years. They always get my meds filled quickly and correctly. However, the person I spoke to on the phone today was extremely rude. Her name was Hannah. She kept cutting me off while I was trying to talk and she had a condescending tone to her voice. She acted as if I was bothering her by asking a simple question about my prescription. Which is unacceptable as it is HER job to answer these questions. If I hadn't already dropped my prescription off, I would be taking it somewhere else. Everyone else is very kind but her .You are in the business of treating and providing a service to people who are most likely sick or have an on going condition that makes life hard enough without you having a nasty attitude. If you cant do that it may be time to find a new profession. Next time, it would be wise to LISTEN ans WAIT to answer the question until it has been fully asked.

name: Jeremiah Cannon
text:
Well, it’s at least better than the Calera CVS. Most of them there are friendly!
More often than not they don’t have prescriptions ready for hours after they’re called in. It’s not like they’re manufacturing it, they are literally just COUNTING to 20 or 30, etc. Half the time when it is ready, they can’t find it.
Example: Doctor sent in 2 prescriptions at once, I received a text that it was ready. Went to pick it up 3 HOURS after they text only to find out that they had only filled 1, not the other. Why would you not fill both at the same time, or at least within 3 HOURS when they come across at the same time?! Why send a notification when you’ve only done half your job, for me to have to drive out there twice (whilst having to load up a toddler and an infant both times)? Like I said, just the latest example. But at least they are nice for the most part.

text: A good deal here financially on their promotional generic drugs. You can even get some rx's like Amoxicillin filled free.  Not so good on some drugs. On two occassions I or a family member have been given an "off the cuff - whatever" type answer to a technical question.  Their online refill system is not at all user friendly.  If you need something at a particular time you have to call them and talk to a person.  They can ring up your stuff ok but I would not recommend them for any type of discussion on medication details, side effects, alternative options, etc....They give the distinct impression of being too busy to spend time with you! Overall they are OK if you are a knowledgeable shopper but not recommended if you need helpful information.  Shop around for price.  Today they filled one for me when I was in a hurry and when I later had time to check I found it was 16% cheaper at Walmart.

I never shop at walmart because the lines are long and they never have anyone working or willing to help especially at this location. Today was the first day I thought I'd try out the drive thru pharmacy and just overall the experience was awful would give zero stars if able to. When you go in to fill a prescription regardless of what you are getting filled you don't want to be met with unprofessionalism. Walgreens has always been my go to I love them and would recommend driving the extra mile or two just to give them your business.

The only reason I go to this location is because it is the closest to my house, still being 25 minutes away.  I am thinking about driving the extra distance for better service.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text: Wow. I have an elderly father who doesn't understand things at times. He was having a procedure done, and his prescription for the "prep" that you do before it was sent to Majors, but since they never even notified him of it, he didn't know it was there...or that it existed or that he even needed to do it because apparently everyone dropped the ball including his doctors office at Kirklin Clinic AND Majors because they never took the time to call him and tell him he had a script! I live 1hr and 45 mins from him, so I cannot help with these things, otherwise I would've caught this. He drove 70 miles to his appointment in Birmingham, (where I met up with him at his appointment) FOR NOTHING, because of course they couldn't do it, and couldn't get him rescheduled until May! (It's March). Small neighborhood pharmacies like this should give great customer service and be friendly if they have ANY chance of competing with the big guys. In MY opinion, they are very overpriced and have never been friendly at all...when I've used them in the past. I'm moving my father's medications to CVS or WalMart, or anywhere other than Majors. You've lost a long-time customer because you just don't care.

I was using another local pharmacy to me, but after losing my insurance, their prices couldn't compare to Kroger.

text: I use to LOVE Publix. I moved all prescriptions(around 10+) due to it being closer to home & sooo nice. I even ask if they would fill a prescription from a dr.out of town. Sure, no problem. 6 months + go by & they changed pharmacist. Refuse to fill prescription from out of town. Well I stay at pharmacy because I do love Publix & they have great customer service. I have now been there over a year, ever since they opened. They have changed pharmacy employees again. I call to get my Trelegy (COPD Medicine) filled. Meredith answers. I give her all my info. She said "your prescription expired you will need to call & tell doctor" ok i will Monday, they are closed. She said " We are not going to fill your prescription without an updated prescription on file". I told her I didn't ask her to. I then went to say I need my other, she litterIy hung up, slammed phone down.. i call right back & she answers, i said we got disconnected. she snickers., oh yea, I'm not sure.. I told her i have other meds to fill. I come to pick up four of my meds. I stood over 5-10 minutes. They never saw me. An employee was cleaning the plexiglass & ask how are you today mam loudly so they could hear. A young short hair female walks to counter & says "yea, what's up, what do you want?" The other employee stares at other employee then looks back at me. I tell her I just need to pick meds up, & I give her my name, address, she says sign, then checks me out. She never says anything afterwards. I've NEVER been treated so poorly as I have the last few times. I can give exact days so they can hopefully hear phone conversation if recorded. Decatur Point Mallard. They have been great.

name: June Frost
text: 30+ Years of Satisfaction - that is what I've received from Kilgore Express Pharmacy in Gurley, Alabama. I am on first-name basis with most of the staff, especially Alphreda (aka Freda), who is one of the most compassionate and caring people I know. She even has made a wonderful home for some orphan cats that were hanging out around the pharmacy. The cats' home, food and water bowls are on the porch on the walk-up into the pharmacy. Be sure to pat them on the head as you go inside. The pharmacist and the entire staff are very knowledgeable and offer any assistance almost before you know you need it. They stock most medication that a chain-type pharmacy stocks - if they don't have it, they will have it the next day. Another reason I love this place is because unlike a chain-type pharmacy, they carry peripheral things that small-town country people like and need - not a bunch of make-up, groceries, toys, As Seen on TV items, and other stuff that just drains one's bank account. They do, however, have a very good selection of greeting cards, a small selection of local arts and crafts, a fair selection general purpose off-the-shelf  remedies, vitamins, pain relievers, and some surprise goodies. You just have to visit to see for yourself.

We strive to make ALL patients and employees comfortable but we also respect their personal decisions.  I do not feel as though immediately taking comments to the internet instead of addressing your concerns in a personal manner is necessary nor is this the appropriate forum for the airing of grievances. text: Went here as a quick in and out visit that was the opposite of what I received. The receptionist was very unprofessional acted like i was bothering her to do her job. She was very rude had an attitude. No one was in the lobby when I arrived. About 10-15mins I was escorted to a room. Waited almost an hour to be seen. The staff was just talking among each other laughing. The walls are very thin I heard someone say oh I forgot. Then it got quiet and shortly after a nurse practitioner came into the room. This is the most unprofessional place I have ever been in. I would not recommend this place or ever go back.

name: Devon Suns
text:
Pharmacy is actually shockingly fast and nice.

Urgent care side is unprofessional and slow. I left a review on a duplicate of this address I guess, the last time I was there. It took half an hour to find out I couldn't get a covid test without a doctor recommendation so I went somewhere else. Which is not their fault, but they could have just looked at my insurance card when I handed it to them before I filled out all the paperwork and saved me some time and annoyance. One girl was unmasked and the unbothered receptionist kept pulling hers down to talk to me. I got tested somewhere else and was positive so real good that I wore MY mask correctly the entire time. Also one of the nurses was preparing a syringe in the lobby doorway which is the biggest yikes I've ever seen at a medical office.

name: carolyn s
text:
I got there at 10 am, the lobby was full and I didn’t want to sit near anyone (this place sees a lot of covid testing) and they have the option to sit in your car and then call when it’s your turn. They didn’t call the number I provided instead they called my parents because I still use their insurance and their info is attached to mine. Not only was it a huge violation of privacy for me but I waited in my car for two hours before calling back, and then had to wait an additional hour in the lobby before being seen. I was also very upset and crying in the lobby the whole time and two people who came in after me once I sat in the lobby were seen before me. I was finally seen around 1:15.

I had a final exam that day and this made it one of the most stressful days of of my life. The receptionist wasn’t very kind and this mistake (both my own and the receptionist) was hugely violating and upsetting for me.

name: Lauren Badia
text: Gloria was truly amazing! She’s super helpful and nice.

text: Would not recommend!!!! Never again. Waiting on lab results and never get any answers!!! Continuity get the run around
