text: Dr there is great. Explains everything out in black and white...would have given 5 stars if it wasnt for the girl behind the desk. No manners. It was like, me coming to the Dr's office inconvenienced her. Ridiculous.

name: Kimberly Baxter
text: I am sure it is fine for an urgent care.  That being said please read if you are going there for wellness, weight loss or hormone therapy!!  Save yourself A LOT of money, possibility of your system being messed up and also the possibility of being given medications that can cause cancer and go to an Endocrinologist!  I have found out that Dr Campbell is an anesthesiologist, not a hormone and wellness DR!!!.  I went there for help and was told I was severely low in all of my hormones and was put on Armour Thyroid, hormone creams, HGH shots(which was $300 a month by itself) and a whole lot of other medications and supplements.  Thankfully it was only for a few months because my husband took a different job in NASA and we moved away.  I found myself an Endocrinologist here after being off of all my meds for 6 months and got new labs done.  I gave the Endocrinologist my old labs Dr Campbell did and the new Dr said that Dr Campbell didn't even run the correct tests to determine I had hypothyroidism, low HGH or other low hormones!!!!  I do not have hypothyroidism or low sex hormones.  We have ruled out several things and are still in search of what is going on with me, but at least I am not being given incorrect medications that would cause serious harm had I still been taking them under Dr Campell.

name: Hannah Land
text: Kind, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff!

name: Emily Ratcliff
text: Fantastic experience at the clinic. Very attentive, caring, thorough care from the RN and NP. I was very impressed with their attitudes (I came in close to closing on a Friday), their professionalism, and their kindness. I was in severe pain when I arrived and they made sure I received prompt, accurate care.  They also were very kind to include my husband in the conversations, plan. I will definitely return if I ever need care again! Cannot say enough nice things.

name: Jordan Leather
text: Expect to wait over 2 hours in your car for covid testing. Horribly slow process.

name: Samantha Taylor
text: I’m really puzzled by all these 5 star reviews, they almost seem fake to me. This place is horrible. I was there earlier to try to get a simple refill on my insulin prescription. I have been there many times within the past year so I am an established patient. They have written me this prescription before. I explained to them that I was unable to get in touch with my endocrinologist and so I needed a refill on my insulin. I am type 1 diabetic, so if I don’t have insulin, I will die. The woman working up front very rudely told me that because of the type of insurance plan I have, I would need to have a referral to even be seen by them in the first place. I told her I have been seen here many times before without a referral. She shrugged and said “well I don’t know WHO allowed YOU to be seen” . I asked her what I was supposed to do and she said “go to the emergency room” and continued to eat her lunch and ignore me. Never again will I go this place. Horrible and rude staff that obviously do not care about patients and their well-being.

name: Pam Harnden
text: Very nice staff but the physician didn’t appear to know how assess my injury and then offered me a myriad of drugs that seemed totally out of line. Had to take an extra X-ray because the machine “was old and not working” according to the nurse. Didn’t use a lead protection apron until I asked for one and then it didn’t cover my thyroid as it was just a lap pad.  Filthy bathroom with no hand towels. I would not return or recommend this place to anyone!

name: Heather Libhart
text: I have been to this Urgent Care twice when I was unable to see my primary doctor as a walk in. Each time service was quick and effective. This second visit was exceptionally wonderful. The male nurse (which I have not been seen by a male nurse a lot, and I’m sorry I don’t remember his name) had great bedside manners and I didn’t feel uncomfortable. He was quick and personable. The nurse practitioner Mrs. Patterson was absolutely delightful and checked all areas being affected. Very professional and thorough. Prescribed me medications in case antibiotics aggravated a yeast infection, BLESS HER. Everyone has been incredibly friendly. I would recommend this clinic to anyone.

name: Ron Burgundy
text: Fast, $20 BCBS AL copay, pharm inside. Perfect for when you need attention quickly. Erin went above and beyond by doing a follow-up the next day and performed a quick treatment the following day. She's my favorite. ☺️

name: Carla Davis
text:
Second experience four stars: decided to give this walk in clinic another shot cause I didn't have time to go elsewhere and glad I did. This visit was much better. Male nurse was great he seemed knowledgeable and has good bedside manner. The physician was okay she provided fast service and I would return for very basic easy to diagnose emergency issues. I wouldn't use this clinic for major diagnostic problems though but if you need refills or antibiotics for a virus they are quick and competent. Pharmacy were fastand nice too.
First experience was a one star and here is that review: Worst experience ever, this sad excuse for an urgent care facility should be shut down.
As you can see, they do not care about client feedback because there are absolutely no responses to the reviews anywhere online and in person they definitely do not care about people. They do care about sales however as every question I asked about my care was averted to the pharmacist trying to sell their diet plan. The receptionist was rude and belittled me for not going to my regular DR. Who was not in town. Never again.

name: MaidintheCity CleaningServices
text: I will never go to this clinic again! I drove one hour from my job to get seen by this clinic before they closed at 8pm. I arrived at 6:15 with ear pain along with flu symptoms. This clinic closes at 8 pm and I was turned away by the receptionist because they had four people waiting and “all the rooms were full”. Okay, so I asked the receptionist to contact her manager because I needed to be seen. The NP was very rude and said they can’t see me because we want to leave and go home at 8 pm. As time pasted by they continued to call three people back to be seen. But they told me all their rooms were full to capacity. Another patient came in behind me with flu symptoms and she told them her insurance will expire at midnight. They told her and myself to go to Huntsville Main.  While all of this is going there was one person waiting in the lobby. The lady behind me (the one with the flu symptoms) said another clinic will take patients up to 7:45 off Bob Wallace. We both got in our cars, before we drove off the receptionist called the last patient waiting to the back. I’m actually glad I wasn’t seen at your facility, it was a terrible experience with NO sympathy to the customer behind me.

name: LeLe Skinner
text: This is the best place to go for any pharmaceutical needs. They have the friendliest staff of any pharmacy I have ever been to. You can tell they aren't just out for your money! They actually care about you & your health!!  I recommend this place over any of the other pharmacies. If you have never been there give them a try. I promise you'll forever be a customer of theirs.

name: Mint2Bee Bus
text: Dr. Campbell and Brett are amazing as is the rest of their crew.  I have lost 61 pounds in 3 1/2 months and I am still working towards my goal weight.  I have 57 lbs left to go and I am sure I will hit that by mid summer.  I have been losing in a very healthy way and my health has improved drastically.

name: Andrew Scott
text: I don't recommend this clinic to anyone. They over charge for all thuer supplements first off. More importantly they will change things up on you without giving any notice in which they seem to do frequently and then not inform you. You will show up to the clinic and find out there's been a change at the last minute. Also some of the employees there seem to be very rude. If you do choose this clinic watch out for a girl named Hailey. She is one of the rudest employee s there. Terrible experience overall. This clinic gets the negative star for -1 😂

name: Bradley Schrimsher
text: Amazing experience!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. This was my first visit and within five minutes they had called me and 3 other people back to run vitals. This is the fastest urgent care I have been to and highly recommend to anyone in a hurry.

name: Linda Speer
text:
Horrible experience, unprofessional staff- clinics like this are the reason people go to the ER for a sniffle!

After waiting for over an hour on an early Tuesday morning, we were finally taken to the back. The male tech (nurse?) turned my child's arms into a sieve with the number of times he jabbed her arms (he insisted that a blood test was the best was to test for flu), trying to get a vein. Then, when we notified him we needed a vomit tray due to being queasy from all the arm jabbing, he ignored us and we were made to clean our own vomit off the floor. He laughed and asked if I was hungover!!! I was completely shocked at this and I gathered my child and left immediately. I called and reported him to the owner, but only got a "Sorry about that" response.

The clinic never did call to let us know what the blood work showed and I did pay for the visit and test. I called them a couple of days after the visit and they said they couldn't find the results. I wish I could give a negative star rating b/c that is what this clinic deserves.

name: Lucas Roberson
text: Very professional easy transition in and out get what u need and go with reasonable prices and everyone is nice wether on the phone or in person

name: rhonda sisco
text: This has been a total change in my life, from all the supplements to the prescriptions  I feel like a human again. Thank you Dr. Campbell for all your help and the wonderful caring staff. These people truly care about the wellbeing of their patients.

name: No one Important
text: Quickest pharmacy i have ever been to. Pharmacy staff are polite and knowledgeable. Would recommend.

name: Patricia Thomas
text: I had a great staff to address my sickness today. The wait time was expected since it is the flu/cold season. My male nurse Josh was excellent in drawing my blood first drawcame the blood needed.  It usually takes 3-4 times due to rolling veins. I would recommend this Quick Care to everyone because I am hard to please. 😍😍😍

name: Matt England
text: I use Quick Care basically as my primary Dr.  Never had anything but correct diagnoses and aggressive treatment to get me back to work.  Brett in the pharmacy is as knowledgeable as some Dr's in my opinion.  Dr. Campbell and the staff have been awesome to me and my wife.

name: Benny Dupree
text: Best Pharmacy in town!!! Friendly and fast service. Pretty reasonable prices as well.

name: Kevin Reed
text: I've done business with the owner/pharmacist for many years and I have been 100% satisfied everytime I deal with him. I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes to get in and see the doctor or nurse practitioner. This is the only pharmacy/quick care that I deal with since they opened.

name: Alan Shaw
text: The website says patients are admitted up to 5:00pm, but this not true at all. I arrived at 4:30pm sharp, and was turned away. There was only one other person waiting. They didn't even ask why I was coming to visit. Want someone that cares? Do not go to this place.

name: Amber Smartt
text: Great place, wonderful pharmacy staff!

name: Fiery Opal
text: This is a great place.  Friendly and extremely knowledgeable people running it.  They will get the best prices for you as well.

name: Sherri Goodwin
text: Pharmacy staff is awesome; however, I was refused service by the mefical staff. The hours of opration say open till 6:00 pm. I was told we see our last patient at 5:15, but we just added two at 5:30 and since I didn't get here till 5:37, I couldn't be seen. Hate to think it was racial, but no one in the office or anyone waiting was of the same race as me. Sounds like a call to the office mgr on Monday...

name: Paul Burns
text: Pharmacy staff is always friendly and quick.  They are cheaper than other pharmacies when it comes to prescriptions not covered by insurance.

name: Angel Starlin
text: Best pharmacist ever!  Fast friendly sercice and if brett cant compound it and show you how yourself then no one can I promise that!!!

name: Jeremiah Leslie
text: I did not even get to sign my name down before I was spoken to very rudely and humiliated by the receptionist in front of visitors and staff. WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND. It was obvious that this "Urgent Care" clinic does not care for those with URGENT situations.

name: Jen Hann
text: Daughter had to call in sick today because of intense ear pain from a cold that she’s had for almost 2 weeks.  The dr there didn’t even look in her ear.  Said it hurts because she’s a smoker!!  I also went there when I hurt my back and he didn’t even touch it.  He also said it was caused by my smoking.  Also, because I take pain meds, got the speech I was going to end up on a street corner buying heroin!!  Call first to make sure someone else is there.  These fresh out of med school Drs only preach about not smoking and rampant drug use when you’re there for a simple ear infection!!

name: Trent Thomas
text: Easy and professional, I would recommend Quick Care to anyone.  Always clean and new equipment.

name: Christopher Stewart
text: Been a couple times now and received prompt and friendly service.

name: Amber gibbs
text: Always have taken good care of me and my family good pharmacist and good dr

name: Coming in Hot Kenny
text: This is no more than a band-aid station. Went in because I had a rash on my face and was in extreme pain. First things first I was seen by a nurse practishioner not a real DR, which should tell you right off the bat this person can't prescribe real meds if you needed them, only non narcotics. Any way the NURSE (not Dr.) Proceeds to tell me it's a bacterial  infection from a bug bite. (This retard must have got her education at walmart) so she proceeded to give me a steroid shot and antibiotics. Well 3 days later I'm in worse shape than before, so I go to the ER, the DR. walks right up and in 3 seconds says you have shingles and it's in your eye as well and can cause you to go blind if not treated. Moral of the story go see a REAL DR. These idiots almost cost me my vision in my left eye. I mean it was the shingles....anybody who is in the medical field should be able to diagnose something as common as shingles, anybody but these guys.

name: Seth Presley
text:
At a later date a full review will be written as such is deserved. I can tell you the people at this establishment make it 100% the only place I go for pharmaceutical medicines and advice, as well as treatment. I will have to write a longer testimonial siting some ezamples of why you would want to comr5
come to Quick Care Clinic before and Pharmacy instead of the big chains that seem to monopolize your health care. I will do that when I have first taken care of some other business, mainly that I just moved and am looking for steady work. So this is the short version of what I will share at a later date.

You should give your Healthcare business to this astoundingly responsible, empathic, knowledgeable, well managed, clean, convenient and kind establishment. Did I leave out experienced? Decades in the multitudes.

Respectfully, when I say you should give your business to quick care, I believe it almost to be an automatic misnomer due to the English language & grammatical flows. Truthfully the minute you walk through that door you will find that the people inside earn your business, and you will not be giving anything. You have nothing to lose, and but a world of good to gain. I stake my word on this. Not enough can be said here with the time that I have. Until I have a full testimonial written up explaining how they have changed my life for the better, I suggest that you trust in what I say in "brevity"... Cough... *um I'm kind of long winded*... Cough.. I (note: I didn't really cough... But if I were coughing I'd go to the clinic at quick care...) lol

Respectfully, This clinic is not a standard business. They don't treat you like your someone trying to damage their profit margin. It's quite amazing. They treat you like family. Every single employee is vetted by the owner who is there seemingly from open to close. A truly great man who has surrounded himself with employees so capable he could be off sipping margaritas in Rosorita. But he doesn't do that.

These people get their feel good from helping you and me get well. It's truly remarkable to find such a Gem amongst so much cold and igneous ruffage, splayed out into the deep horizon. Now I said brevity earlier.. And because of how good this place is, it's just hard to say less than you've read here. These people care about health and will care about you. I urge you to go here and see for your self.

Standard info : they take most insurances. They have the best Pharmacy team in town and are license profesionals. They have a walk in clinic, and multiple, highly skilled and experienced doctors. GOOD DOCTORS.( I don't think I've ever seen a pharmaceutical rep trying to sway opinions in the place even once. Every other place I've been it's maddening. Big pharma is there smooozing with the decision makers... Buying lunches and giving away expensive travel packages to get them to start prescribing you some new med that's more expensive than the others that do the same thing with less side effects.) No blonde hair rolling briefcase bombshells messing with your treatment walk these halls. They are with a sense of humor that's quite good. Going in feels like visiting friends. Best bedside and counterside manner I've ever seen. highly interested and driven skilled individuals who are not only the practitioners, but also patients. These are doctors that take their own medicine. That is to say; they would perscribe treatment to themselves or their loved ones exactly as they would to you.  I am 199% convinced of their convictions, and that they know what they are talking, doing and recommending to you about health. And when they don't know something.... They don't prioritize and lean on ego, and brush off your questions, and do a hat and dance show. NO! INSTEAD: I have had a conversation like this while in treatment, "I don't know about this area of the suggested treatments.. So let me confer with a specialist who is a friend of mine and I'll be right back. Please wait here five minutes. Would you like some water?".

So in essence I'm saying...

GO HERE!

name: Joseph Ridenhour
text: They got back to me to resolve a coding issue on the bill that involved an annual physical incentive benefit.

name: Tammylea Aldridge
text: Nice friendly caring people ''''

name: Jason Gleaner (Salt Yeeter)
text: Great people.

name: ElamCo Inc.
text: Called to ask if they were busy, placed on hold for 9 minutes, I hung up.

name: C. Anne
text: Fantastic staff, very clean, super efficient.

name: Enyong Emmanuel
text: I work at this pharmacy. It is a nice place to work. Work/life balance excellent, great for starters. Any pharmacy related questions are answered simply and clearly, good client/pharmacy staff relationship. They are a like family.

resp.text: Emmanuel, thank you so much for your review! Our employees and our patients are like a family to us!

name: Carla Davis
text: The attitude of the employees is awesome at this pharmacy and they are ed professional and kind. This is my favorite pharmacy ever.

resp.text: Thank you for your sweet review! We love to serve our patients!

name: Danny Woodard
text: Great patient care!  They went the extra mile to answer all of my questions.  Very happy with the level of care from the pharmacy.

name: Tatum Harless
text: Great products, even better customer service! Would recommend to anyone!

name: Sindy Woodard
text: Wonderful place!

name: matthew denard
text:
Dealing with main stream Pharmacy’s were exhausting! They could never get my
RX right and always struggled to fill it correctly. Years of frustrating interaction caused me to search for a pharmacy with personal excellent service and interaction and that’s exactly what I found ! I couldn’t be happier and will never go anywhere else !!

name: Benjamin Byrd
text: AccuRx genuinely cares about their customers. Whether it is via an in-person visit or through their mobile app, I have always been able to find the help I need. The friendly staff and knowledgable pharmacists were able to answer all the questions I had about my new medication. Give this place a shot, you won't be disappointed!

name: William Byrd
text: Received my prescription in less than two days! Great customer service and easy to refill prescriptions!

name: Kimberly Whatley
text: Nice people

name: R Heffner
text: Widgets acme

name: Jordan Kull
text:
If you call on the phone you will get to 'talk' to the machine. If you "refill" your prescription with the machine don't expect the pharmacist to actually fill the prescription, it mist get lost in limbo.
The in person service is good. But technologically they are in the 90s.

name: Mary Windham
text: These are my folks. They are excellent. Stop in and see why I say that.

name: Lisa Payne
text: I really like this wallgreens store and importantly staff!! Very helpful and personable! The pharmacist is very efficient and that says a lot as a I know this location stays busy. She jumps right into action, even with along line- multitasking all the while answering any important questions etc. her pharmacy tech was very professional as well! I have to fill my medicine every month and it has been hard establishing a great relationship at other pharmacies. In my opinion( not that it matters 😅) I feel this is how a pharmacy/ customer relationship should be. I feel completely comfortable leaving my future scripts here in file also. I left my old drivers license  there a month ago and the tech called me immediately and let me know. I just moved to the area and feel blessed that I found this wallgreens here in Huntsville to handle my medicine. The whole staff does a great job and it’s noticed and appreciated!!

name: Navid Wayne
text: I Enjoy Every time I come to Walgreens pharmacy, they have a friendly smile, and they treat you right and with Respect.. Thanks, David

name: Laura Coates
text:
Love this location but hate that they aren't open 24 hours anymore!? Madison Walgreens is now the closest 24 hour pharmacy near me and even that's too far. :(
Bring back 24 hours please!!!

name: Joyce Garner
text: Can't get answers to what they want.

name: Reginald jamar
text: Great store great associates!

name: David Clark
text: Love the women that work there after your 2ed visit they know you by name they are always smiling happy to help they get your medication ready faster than any other pharmacy I have ever been too I have made it my only pharmacy I have only ever had one problem there & they fixed it with no problem after that I knew it was a great place

name: Tracey Delevie
text: Always nice and friendly and don't mind taken the time to answer any questions ...other pharmacy just don't need to be in our town. Alaco is great.

name: Cindy Lynn Smith
text: This is a great little drug store. The people are friendly and will take the time to help you with what you need . Generally a drug store like this tends to be cheaper than your big box chains, as I used to work at one so I ought to know. Prices are better!

name: Clint Sprayberry
text: Great service,  great staff! Clean and comfortable! ONE word QUALITY!

name: Art Of Valor
text: Friendly staff and great service!

name: Jason Creed
text: Great and friendly service always super helpful

resp.text: Thank You!

name: dana grimes
text: The staff is awesome!!! Drive thru is very convenient!!

name: Calvin Grimes
text: Friendly staff and convenient drive thru

name: Leann Mullins
text: Love this place!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Regina Gamel
text: This is a great man. He is always helping others. I work at staggs in Florence I have seen him numerous times feed homeless people. He even bought Christmas for a single mother for her son.. It's always a pleasure meeting people like this who thinks about others before himself. That's why we should always  buy from a local business. Thank you John for all you do for this community. And us ladies at work.

name: William McMullan
text: Compounded a medication that was not available any where else.

name: Mr. JM Bama
text: Owned & Operated by Wonderful People! I have been using this place for my whole family for years & we will continue to give them our business for many more years to come! Thank You Guys For All Your Support!

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Always have my rx in stock and ready for pickup

name: Janet B
text: Very friendly and helpful staff.  Love this pharmacy.  Walgreens and CVS could take some lessons from NJ Pharmacy.  Excellent customer service.

name: sharron malone
text: Have used North Jefferson Pharmacy for years. The best people work there .

name: Matt Lee
text: The best pharmacy I've ever been to really helpful in every way. Really makes you feel like family. Love the staff.

name: Melissa Dean
text: I drive 30 minutes to get my prescriptions filled and probably pass at least 10-15 other pharmacies in the process, but I wouldn't have it any other way! North Jefferson Pharmacy is exceptional in every way. Their willingness to help, the experience & knowledge of the staff....as well as the fact that they're just good kind-hearted people. Vicki is one of the best Pharmicist that I've ever dealt with! I would follow her to the end of the earth and back, just to get my perscriptions filled! 😉 (And no, I do not know Vickie or any of the staff of this pharmacy on any type of personal level - strictly Pharmacy / Customer)

name: Robin Hamer
text: They are friendly, kind and have some of the cutest tops ive ever seen!    Going today and im looking forwars to seeing thie clothes and them of course.    Lol.

name: Shannon Hill
text: Very caring friendly staff.They make you feel like family.I do believe they genuinely care about their customers

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Amazing customer service my number one pharmacy

name: Jennifer Conway
text: Friendly and prompt service

name: Mindy Tobin
text: Listen to them talk about a patient's personal business here.Shame on you guys

name: Jackie Renderos
text: The pharmacist/owner was INCREDIBLY rude. Doesn't even deserve one star. Impatient and terrible customer service.

name: Z Burt
text:
The Pharmacist, Lisa is PHENOMENAL! She always greets you with a warm smile and friendly attitude and always provides exceptional service. She is always helpful and knowledgeable. She makes your day brighter and honestly makes you feel like you using a small hometown “Mayberry” type pharmacy where everyone is friendly and remembers you, which is quite extraordinary given the fact they are a corporate pharmacy inside a retail chain store. My family and I are very grateful to have found this location and we personally drive out of our way to this pharmacy because Lisa and all the other staff are so helpful and welcoming. Another major plus is they can fill an RX in 10-15 minutes vs. our local pharmacy taking hours/days & sometimes weeks in the past.
Lisa is a great asset for CVS/Target and we hope she will always be there. My family and I have made comment after comment about CVS corporate need to send other employees/staff from the other CVS locations to train under Lisa and her staff. They could all benefit greatly from observing Lisa and how to properly treat customers/patients and fill RX’s in a timely manner. Thank You Lisa!!!!

name: Michelle Green
text: I have recently transferred my prescriptions to them from another retail pharmacy. They go above and beyond taking care of you and getting your medicines in a timely manner. If they haven't had it in stock they have found it for me. I can't thank them enough!

name: William E. Smith
text: Employees are outstanding, very friendly and take time to answer any questions that you have.

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Pretty fast good pharmacy

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Very safe and discreet service

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Great service

name: Doris Morse
text: Great place to pick up meds and shop for other merchandise the employees r always there to help you in anyway and they always answer any questions you may have I've never had to wait for a long time to be waited on

name: doris hunter
text: Very pleases

name: Mike Coleman
text: The perfect place for your pharmaceutical and gift needs.   Helpful, friendly bunch!  They go above and beyond!!

name: Sunshine Knighton
text: Friendly staff.

name: Tony Walker (Uncle Guy)
text: They're nice people all around just like you neighborhood pharmacy should be there great talk to I like seeing them.

name: Brenda Holmes
text: The employees are very friendly, short wait time, pharmacist knowledgeable about medications. Have been using this establishment for years. No problems.

name: Nanci Greene
text: Friendly nice place no wait

name: Buddy Smith
text: Very interesting and friendly Drug store with a great snack bar. Enjoy a good home cooked breakfast of your choice.  Hamburger is a must have.

name: Monica Brown
text: Always Always Great food. Outstanding customer service from front to back. Everyone is always so friendly.

name: Tim Blankenship
text: Very friendly and helpful staff

name: Katie Horton
text:
BCBS picked David Drug for me. You get 2 choices in Columbiana, CVS and Davis Drug. I used CVS and never had problems. They would call for my refills, if needed and the wait for prescriptions was maybe 15-20 mins with a walk in RX.
Every. Single. Time. I bring a RX to wait for at Davis Drug, the wait is always an hour or more!! I understand being busy but if you have that much business, getter employees to work. It’s ridiculous to need medication and having to wait that long. Babies crying because they don’t feel good. I really wish I could use CVS again.

name: Mary Rape
text: Rude employees rude people an very expensive place

name: Sasha Johns
text: Locals serving locals. This is a hometown place that offers so much to not just their community but also visitors. Go get a Davis special at the snack bar.

name: Rebecca Turner
text: The food is amazing! I love their burgers and the food is cooked to order! This is not the place if you are looking for quick! We spend about an hour in there and about 30 minutes of it is waiting on our food. They are a small business so there are only ever two people in the deli but like I said the food is worth it!

name: Susan Hutton
text: Great neighborhood and community pharmacy. Always have what you need in stock. Tons of extras. Alot of things you don't see anywhere else. Very adequately staffed which are friendly and helpful.  Awesome is the best way to describe the EATS and DRINKS from their snack bark.

name: Dorothy Welch-Brasher
text: The ladies at the food counter are so sweet and nice. The food is great and the fresh squeezed lemonade is to die for and I'm not an lemonade drinker.

name: Ray Fisher
text: Friendly people and a knowledgeable and helpful Pharmacy Staff.  They are in general competitive with their pharmacy prices.  Their over the counter stuff is usually a little higher than the big box stores but they do not have the buying power of a Walmart or Sams.  You have to expect a little extra cost for the convenience of a local store near by and at least you do not have the gasoline cost for driving to the big box store.  I have used them primarily for several years.

name: Dave Corn
text: Great drug store, best prices, gifts, sandwiches/soda fountain

name: R Heffner
text: Terrell Owens

name: Jennifer “jeni” Cox
text: Very friendly and great food!

name: Jason Vandiver
text: Great Burger!

name: Janet Hollomon
text: Best drugstore in Columbiana.

name: Courtney Sprinkle (Courtney S.)
text: I work at a different Walgreens location, however I use this location for the majority of my family's prescriptions bc it is closer to our home, however, I am officially switching locations after today, because every single time I come here, the employees are nothing short of rude, short, unhelpful, and they will literally lie to avoid having to do additional things that are included in their job description. Here's 2 examples, one of the medications I take just recently had generics made available, well after having a really bad reaction to one available generic, my store ordered some from a different manufacturer, but this store lied and said that Walgreens doesn't have the ability to order a different manufacturer, so they would rather put a patient's health at risk than order a small supply from a different manufacturer. Also, I have been on a doctor ordered quarantine while I awaited my COVID-19 results, so after a telemedicine appointment, I attempted to call a d see if they could take my card information over the phone, bc my express payment was not completed before the Dr called in my medication today. Now I know we can do this bc I did this for a patient the last day I worked before my quarantine started, and yet again, another pharmacy employee lied and said that they aren't able to do this. It is ridiculous. The only employee I have personally encountered that knows what customer service positions entail is the shift lead, Donna. Every other PHARMACY EMPLOYEE at this location needs to undergo some extensive customer service training, or they need a manager that understands customer service is the most important part of retail work. After I pick up my last 2 medications from this location, I will not be back unless the manager makes some serious changes because it has just gotten worse and worse the past few months, and I'm not going to spend my money at a Walgreens chain if they can't even treat their customers with a basic respect, that I guarantee every single one of them expect when they are on the other side of the counter. Good luck to anyone else who decides to use this pharmacy.

name: FJ B
text: Very good store!

name: Supa CG
text: I live just down the street from this place. I absolutely love shopping here. They always take awesome care of myself and my parents. I don't have a single bad thing to say about this pharmacy. I wish I could give them 100 stars.

name: Staci
text: The staff at Jack’s pharmacy are incredibly nice and very professional. They have always treated me with the utmost respect and care. I would highly recommend using them for all of your prescription needs.

name: Christian Camp
text: I have been a regular customer here for over a year now and with each and every interaction I have had with the Pharmacist and staff I have been more than satisfied. The entire staff is kind, courteous, and extremely knowledgeable. They have always gone out of their way to take care of both my prescription and over-the-counter needs. One important example of their dedication occurred after I had been diagnosed with cancer. Due to my treatments, I became unable to drive and couldn’t pick up my prescriptions. If I had been a customer of any of the other pharmacies in and around my area, this would have been a really big problem. Thankfully, I had become a regular customer of Jack’s pharmacy just prior to starting my treatments and with just one phone call my problem was solved. I was assured that my medications would be hand delivered to me at my home whenever needed and they have never once let me down. Their kind of dedication is rare and I am so grateful to have found Jack’s pharmacy.

name: Ricky Wade
text: Owner pharmacist will not adhere to personal direction on file. Beware.

name: Della Patterson
text: Great experience for family and also for hard to find items. Very nice people working there.

name: Bernadetta Sotres
text: I had to fill a prescription and not one pharmacy had it in stock including mine. They filled it so fast and they was all super nice. I received a hand written note thanking me for my business and a $10 gift card. Well, like the very next month I moved to West Blocton and they are my pharmacy. It's old fashioned customer service at its best!

name: Cynde Henthorne
text: The staff goes above and beyond to help you with all your needs!! Love this place!! They are more than just a pharmacy. They have cute candles, jewelry and other items!!

name: Patty Norwood
text: I love Jack's every one is very nice and helpful

name: Mark Jones
text: Great staff, very helpful! the prices are often better than the big chain stores.

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: Great customer service

name: Dale Savage
text: Quick promo with a courteous staff.

name: Jeff Norwood
text: They have always been some friendly people

name: Leeann Reese
text: Nice and friendly

name: Shelley Martin
text: Very kind and nice people

name: Frederick German II
text: I went to them back in 2013 when I broke two bones in my foot and they were pleasant and kind then a few years later I tried to get my prescription filled with them they told me that they aren’t accepting any new patients I explained to them that I am not a new patient and that I’ve filled with you all before back in 2013 but that wasn’t good enough apparently.  Earlier today they told me the same thing that they weren’t accepting any new patients. I do not recommend them at all unfortunately.

name: Supa CG
text: They always take great care of me

resp.text: Hi Supa, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We're grateful for your support and happy to assist you.

name: Lois Warren
text: At Hometown Pharmacy, you are treated like a valued customer. They are always friendly and available to answer any questions that I might have. There are no long lines to wait in and they give prompt, reliable and efficient service and their delivery service is very beneficial when you are unable to go and pick up your medicine.

resp.text: Thank you so much Ms. Warren, for taking time to leave us a sweet review!

name: Althea Acoff
text: Hometown pharmacy went above and beyond to help me get my prescriptions filled after my doctor abruptly left her practice and I was unable to get a refill. They have always taken amazing care of me and alerted me about my medicines and possible interactions because of my multiple medical conditions. But today I was lost and hopeless and was going to bite a ER bill just to get my meds filled, but they stayed on hold for almost an hour until they reached someone to help me! Thank you thank you thank you!!!

resp.text: Our patients make everything so worthwhile!! Thanks for taking the time to share your experience! Merry Christmas!

name: Billie Lucas
text: I’ve used this pharmacy for years and the lady that answers the phone has always been very rude to me. I let it slip a few times until today when I called about my medication getting fixed. She was so rude with me because I asked is she could please repeat a number to make sure it was taken down right with my voice being off due to surgery. She then began to be ugly with me and hung up the phone in my face. I then called back to speak with Tim and she hung up on me again so I turn around and called back because I really wanted to let Tim know how she was treating his customers. By the way I’m not the only person she’s been rude to. But after the third attempt to talk to him she still refused to let me she said my manager is standing right here beside me and heard me repeat the number back then she went on to repeat the number I said that’s all I wanted from you in the first place and then hung up the phone. So she lied about repeating the number I had two different people listening while I was on speaker phone talking to her. Then she was suppose to inform me when my medicine was taken care of and I never heard a word from them. Needless to say I will no longer use this pharmacy due to the fact that they let the workers treat their customers poorly. I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone else. Sooner or later you’ll see exactly why I made this post.

name: Cathy Wesson
text: A great place the staff is friendly and they are all very professional!

name: JM Barnes
text: This is literally the first terrible rating I have ever given. I don't know where these other good reviews come from unless their employees,friends,or family..  this is the worse pharmacy I have ever seen. The pharmacist talking down to and being rude to elderly customers..what a loser.....

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. If you have time, please contact the store today at (205) 830-8026. We would like to hear what happened so we can resolve this issue. Have a blessed day!

name: Sondra Mullins
text: I just had to say once again how much we love our patients! Thank you so much for being patient as we have served you curbside during the pandemic.  We hope to open soon and have a drive through coming soon for drop off and pick up, for those times you are sick, or just on the run.  We have a new online store so you can order and pick up at the store (I'm sure there will be a small learning curve for us in this endeavor - but we are so excited!) Together, we hope to give you many options for shopping in a safe way.

name: Patricia Gilbert-Lythcott
text: Hometown pharmacy has great service and even greater employees 👍🏾👍🏾 thank you hometown‼️

name: Lacie Tidwell
text: I just switched to this pharmacy and I love it so far the ppl are nice and service is good 😀

resp.text: We miss seeing you at the pharmacy. Hope you come in soon to see what is new!

name: Tim Mullins
text: Love the people here! Patients and workers are awesome!

name: NEPHETERIA HORN
text: Wonderful staff!

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to review us on Google! We appreciate your time and support!

name: Charlotte Demott
text: Love This Place

name: Darrin Crusoe
text: Love this pharmacy

name: Michael Osgood
text: Great service

name: Angela Ward-Loomis
text: This place is great

name: Terry Smith
text:
I cannot imagine a worse pharmacy.  Because we received a smattering of snow last evening,
they chose not to open.  No recording on the phone to make arrangements to meet someone at the store to pick up any prescriptions that may be vital for their patients- no recording to inform their customers when they might open.
Horrible indifference to the customers to keep them in business

name: Shafter Monkey
text: Easy transaction on several occasions. Most recently when rite-aid couldn't input my insurance or tell me a cash price for what I needed ...

name: Lee ann Roman
text: Very Friendly and fast service .

name: Jason Sparks (Chief)
text: Prompt courteous service

name: Melanie Walters
text: The pharmacy is ridiculous. They never have your prescription when they promise. I went in and gave them a three day notice that I was needing a refill. They said that is plenty of time and they will have it. However I went to pick it up and they say they didn't order the medicine. Mike the pharmacist acts like he could careless that he's inconvienencing customers. He never once apologizes nor acknowledges you. And the staffing asking from far behind the counter the medication your picking up allowing everyone else in line to hear. This is rude and lack of confidentiality. Maybe I don't want other customers to know what medications I'm on. This is by far the worse Winn dixie I have ever experienced.

name: Arthur Habermann
text: super mgt team. very clean. excellent shopping experience.

name: Sweet ROSE
text: Money order machine always down 😒😒

name: Jenny B.
text: Comfortable!!

name: Clayton Highsmith
text: We had the chicken salad sandwiches and banana splits.  WOW.  So worth the drive.  I wish I had taken a picture because they were a work of art.  BIG and delicious.  The staff were by far, the nicest people we met all day.   GO, make the effort to find this place

name: Bear Down Chicago Bears
text: We drove from Athens to try this place out and it was worth it! Great customer service, Air conditioning, and visually attractive soda fountain! Will definitely come back!

name: David K
text: They have great sandwiches and a daily soup special. There is a park nearby that we take our grandkids to. For an after the park treat, we take them to get ice cream from the pharmacy deli.

name: Handsome Rob
text: Biggest Ice cream cone I’ve ever seen!

name: Jevon Reinke
text: By far one of the best places to get a fantastically priced sandwich in the whole Shoals area. I'm sure the pharmacy is fantastic but their chicken salad keeps bringing me back. 11/10 will continue to support.

name: Jamison Edwards
text: This is much more than you would expect from your typical pharmacy! Not only do they handle business in a professional and ethical way, the service is always fast and friendly too. They also have a GREAT food service, which includes sandwiches and ice cream! In my opinion, they make the best milkshakes in all of the Shoals!

name: Dale Morgan
text: Had an issue getting a refill as everyone seemed to be out and had issues getting it in but St Florian Pharmacy not only had it but they were very pleasant when I called...very nice first experience with them.  Since I live in St Florian, I am sure I will be transferring all my scripts there.

name: Matt C
text: Very good deli for a small town.  Friendly staff.  Pharmacy meets and exceeds our needs.

name: M & T Pest Control Matt Davis
text: Great place with good service!!

name: Toshihiro Tanaka
text: Blue Bell ice cream

name: Courtney Rea
text: Awesome place

name: Rickest of the ricks
text: No fuss they fill the prescription and do what they are supposed to.

name: LaTonya N.
text: This was and for now still is, my favorite place to shop. Especially when I first moved to Huntsville about 2 years ago, prices were great, I used to have a buggy full of groceries for slightly over $100.00. Now that grocery buget has doubled to about $200.00, idk why. Most of their workers are pretty friendly. Usually it is the new workers who are not. Watch expiration dates tho, other than that great place to shop!🤗

name: Alexander Hartman
text: Very fast, and great staff. But other than that the only real thing I didn't find appealing was that the drugs there are somewhat a bit more costly there, and nobody likes spending money that they shouldn't have to spend. Am I right?

name: E R
text: Staff is awesome and they care about you saving on your meds. Quick turnaround on drop offs.

name: Megan Ezell
text: Great pharmacy! I have been going to them for years and they take very good care of me! On top of really caring about their customers, they are always super fast!

name: Sweetpea Sasha
text: Friendly staff. Pharmacists always willing to answer questions.

name: Tanaja RaShon
text: Great prices but they have TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

name: Trent Martin
text: The staff here are an amazing group of people. They are there for you on any questions that may arise from prescriptions that were prescribed to you or your family.

name: Mark Harrison
text: Great service, consultation, and advice....

name: Brice Jackson
text:
Prices can’t be beat. Product is pretty good. Pharmacy is easy to work with. Time efficient. With meats, you need to check the expiration dates, but it’s good the majority of the time.

I’m a huge fan of the Nature Valley Peanut Butter & Chocolate Granola Cups & Almond Butter Granola Cups! You can find these at other local places! These are an excellent mid morning snack!

name: Jessica McKay
text: I love that this place is right around the corner. I’ve been going for a long time, but yesterday I bought over $300 worth of groceries and my card kept declining due to bank issues. So I had to step to the side and wait for my husband to bring his card up there and help me out. I was so embarrassed and had tears, but the cashiers were SUPER friendly and were polite and calming me down (I really was embarrassed and mad at myself for not realizing the card was locked-simple fix). But that poor cashier had to rescan all of my groceries and smiled the whole time and told me how often that happened. I am thankful for each employee that was helpful to me yesterday and then laughed with me when I realized how much of an easy fix my card issue was.

name: Scarlett Raven
text: I tried using a digital gift card and when I asked for help,a very rude employee (possibly a manager)was very dismissive and told me that I couldn’t use it and then walked away. I took it to another cashier and she was great and had no problem using the card. As lease one of the employees actually wanted to help.

name: Shir Carson
text: Well lite store. Friendly feeling when you walk in. Cashier's speak. Great selection of vegetables, dry goods, and a mixed variety of off brand a name brand goods. I went to the Pharmacy. The visit was really pleasant, easily and not complicated. Took me 30 minutes. In and out. The Pharmacy Tech and Pharmacist were both warm and friendly. Made you feel at ease. Was really concerned. Open to questions too. Will be back!

name: Jackie Dotson
text: A good place to get what you need for the most part.  Good selection of foods, health items, and other necessities.  If you need very specific items or brands you may want to go to another store before stopping at this one.

name: Daniel
text: The person at the very front told two guests that they didn't need masks. There are also too many people walking around without masks on. I need Walmart to step up and do something to keep us all safe

name: Melody Owen
text: It's only ok. Everything is self check out, you can bring your own bags. The workers there are just...ok too.

name: Minnie Kennedy
text: Convenient, clean, but scanning and bagging allllllllll my grocery, I need a check! Oh never mind I'll just go to PUBLIX!

name: Faye B.
text: I shop at this store at least twice a week, and lately [at least for the last two months], the already cramped aisles have been jammed with restocking activity going on during the "busy" times. I know things aren't as coordinated as they would normally be due to the pandemic, but you would think store management would see how this makes navigating the aisles a challenge when you're pushing a shopping cart. The employees are nice about it and will make way when they can, but they're also using those large carts piled with supplies that can't be moved out of the way as easily.

name: Raven Christian
text: Great grocery store, it kinda feels like a strategic placement for people not close to the super center but that's what makes it useful

name: April Ray
text: I had sinus issues and needed a humidifier and the nice lady just happened to have one on the pallet that she was unpacking and she moved so much stuff just to get it for me. They had really really deep cleansing hand soap which I've not been able to find and it was $2.97 and so I got one for every bathroom and my kitchen. It doesn't dry your hands out and I don't remember the name but for the price it's cheaper than regular soft soap antibacterial. The girl at the checkout was a sweetheart she could sympathize with my stuffed up nose in the middle of the night and she didn't realize that she could use one of the humidifiers to help her at night and so she said she was going to go get her one too. She was very gentle with the groceries that I did buy and was very friendly and it was my first visit to this store and I will definitely be going back because I am so close and I've not been here too long on this side of town and did not know that there was a neighborhood market a quarter mile from my apartment. I'm disabled so I do not get out much. They had buggies up so I didn't have to worry about them hitting my car. I was able to find a handicap spot and didn't have to go further down. Everything was marked for the social distancing. It was a pleasure and that's a lot because I am not a Walmart fan when it comes to being in the store I pay for delivery and I'm just pleased with it all.

name: J H
text: Customer service is almost always closed for weeks at a time. You can 99% of the time never get anyone to answer the phone. At night the shopping carts are left outside in the parking area so if you want one you have to go back outside and get one out of the return area. Some workers at customer service the few times it's open get attitudes when you ask for items thats only located at customer service. This is just a few issues ongoing with this location and some of its workers. Dont get me wrong not all of them are bad they are some excellent workers at this location as well its just the bad ones outweigh the good ones.

name: Casee McKay
text: The best grocery store in my be area. Produce is always fresh and brightly colored. Lines are always quick and easily to move thru. Parking is not a nightmare. Staff is helpful and friendly

name: Amy Lee (Foxy!!)
text: The best place to get groceries and essentials in the same place

name: Larry Yount
text: The rotisserie chicken is usually pretty good, but lately it's over cooked and put on the warmers by 10 A.M. and not fit to eat by dinner time. No wonder it's not selling. I've had to throw the last 2 out. Even the dog wouldn't eat them.

name: Darrell Frye
text: Was very crowded but well stocked.

name: Ardy Gee
text: Hate it.  The regular employees are good... That being said... Every person ive seen in anytype of management position walks around with their nose in the air... Ive ask two different ones what isle something was on... One just pointed to a stocker... And the other just flat out ignored me.... And i asked twice... The second time she did an about face and went the other way... And i heard her tell the person on the phone-ear piece that she aint got time for that.

name: Kimberly Lindsey
text: Great prices excellent products

name: Becka Griffin
text: Nice place , but never stocked , which is strange seeing as they always have pallets on every isle

name: Braylen Speight
text: This store is a shabby store. There aren't that many cashiers that can help and they're very nonchalant. It's hardly ever stocked with everyday items.

name: Abril Agnew
text: Pharmacy is great! They’ve been taking care of me for years!

name: Cynthia Davis
text: Lines were long,but good experience

name: Stephanie lewis
text: Purchased a small amount of grocery.  The grapes are fresh and I liked the price of Natures Own bread for $2.50. Pleasant environment with an easy self checkout. All machines were working.

name: Stephanie Davis
text: In and out!! Love the location.

name: Patricia Mincey
text:
Had what I needed great.
And clean.

name: Edwena
text: This location has gotten better with shelving

name: Ãshlëŷ Ŵïsë
text: Much easier than the super Walmart, especially since they don't sell clothing and many other items i tend to splurge on when i don't need to.

name: Mz. T. McKitt
text: Always great to shop here. A few items on my list the store was out of, but basically well stocked & clean.

name: Timothy Crowe
text: This Wal-Mart insists that people with breathing problems be masked. Don't give them your business. Go somewhere else.

name: Tabitha Mccostlin
text:
Every visit has been met with more and more bad attitude staff and unhelpful employees. If you're not headed out the door at 830 they will come find u 5-10 mins before close and tell you you have to leave.

Theres never any bags, nothing is in its right place, produce is rotting and managers are RUDE and snarky to anyone not leaving exactly as they close (literally saw a store associate arguing & yelling with someone who wasn't checking out fast enough). I spent over $200 weekly, have to bag my own groceries as there's rarely a lane with a human open. This was the final straw on my spending any money at this location.

None of the staff is wearing their masks correctly including management, so many issues here that need to be fixed.

name: Dee Haywood
text: They're getting rid of cashiers. ALL self check out!!

name: Geraldine. Washington
text: Never have much of what you need

name: Tim Gillespie
text: A very well stock & clean state

name: Time for Disclosure
text: It is small and didn't have cinnamon bears. Lol

name: Colby Lane
text: Great grocery store, great service.

name: Ship Life
text: Close and handy but many many products not available- shelves empty

name: Krystal Littrell
text: Very clean. Needed to run in for a couple of items for a relative and the store was clean and everything I needed was in stock.

name: Andrea Sanders
text: Neighborhood convenient market with friendly staff!

name: Purrito 38
text: People there are nice, for some reason I friends with all the workers

name: Duane Ward
text: Easy in and out grocery shopping.  Most of the staff is helpful. There have been a few that are not only impatient rude and unhelpful they make me feel like I did something wrong just by shopping there.

name: shelly hankins
text: Very nice friendly and helpful

name: Ferlanzo Jones
text: I like the people who work there and very convenient

name: Jonathan Dobbs
text: The employees are all very friendly and helpful but the only checkout lines that were open were the self-checkout and it was crowded that really sucks

name: Camryn Walker
text: I love shopping for the snacks and hygiene products they have

name: Ginger Minor
text: Haven't been to this particular shopping center very often , but the store has always been very clean and people there  very friendly  !

name: Pickens PC Repair LLC
text: Low quality goods

name: Alex Wright
text: This Walmart neighborhood market is nice to have in Hoover since we didn't have one previously, but nothing really stands out about it. All in all it's a clean, well staffed & well located Walmart neighborhood market.

name: Sheila Harris aka Hollywood
text: It’s convenient

name: K C (LakeLover)
text: I received really great customer service today from Marie at the Customer Service desk. She was very pleasant and helpful, so refreshing!

name: King Charles
text: Great service

name: m davis
text: The associate's will walk right by you and as if you are in their way. Never greet nor acknowledge you and please don't ask a question you have ruined their day. And please get some cashier's. I do not work for Wal-Mart and self checkout should not be my only option. I like human on human experience. I'll keep shopping elsewhere.

name: Jimmy Chambliss
text: No human cashiers. Self checkout wouldn't take cash. They didn't act like they really wanted to help me.

name: Debbe Stewart
text: Its well stocked, so well in fact, all the employees seem to be constantly engaged in stocking the shelves with carts in the isles.

name: Jeremie Simmons
text: Just the same as any other walmart.This store I was impressed.The was very clean ,the shelves were stocked and "zoned" .The people at customer service was as helpful as they usually are..

name: EDWARD D SINGLETON
text: a place were  somebody (nose) somebody else great shopping pretty good service there fresca  is smack a lishis

name: Louise “Weezie” Weldy
text: Very handy we really needed a store on Lorna Road.  Staff always very helpful.

name: Veronica Rhodes
text: They usually have what I am looking  for in stock

name: Tamara Thomson
text: Easy to shop there. Employees are always pleasant and helpful.

name: Fredrick Ikpelue
text: Love our little neighborhood market. Always have what I need.

name: Kayla Hoover
text: Always clean and not very crazy busy. I love that it's local and small. The staff has always been friendly and ready to help with whatever you.

name: Deedra Ochoa
text: I absolutely hate going in this store. Lazy ,rude staff sitting on a stool working register. Only other cashier wouldn't pick up anything ask me to do it ie... box of cat liter, So slow. Another employee and I both came to the isle at same time as I was trying to get in line she was taking stock from register and she wouldn't let me pass. I had to go all the way out and back in. Worst customer service ever, I quit coming in this store and made the mistake of running In. The other in Vestavia is so much better and it is where i will shop. To many complaints to list need better management.

name: Terry Price Ware
text: Great place to score the essentials at great prices without walking 4 miles to do it .

name: Kelsey
text: It's a neighborhood Walmart. The nice thing is you can ship items to this store instead of a supermarket location. Otherwise, no difference from any other Walmart.

name: Nathaniel Abbott
text: A messy store. Tried to pay with a gift card at self checkout. Asked employee (we'll call her K) for help since it wasn't going through. K said someone else had to help us, so she suspended our order and took us to the back of the longest line and left us there to check out again. What? We dropped our stuff and went to the super Walmart and had the self checkout employee check is out with no issue.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Nice staff. Clean store. Good pharmacy

name: Kimberly Saulsberry
text: Love this market. So clean and the meat and produce is very fresh.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text: The store is always clean. Every employee that I have dealt with has been very kind and professional. Due to the small size, it is easy to run in and get what you need. There are very few checkouts serviced by a cashier. If you use the self checkouts, you will be out in a breeze. Don’t let the full parking lot fool you into thinking you will be met by long checkout lines. Most shoppers are just grabbing a few items.

name: DJ RaptorXS
text: Friendly service and convenient hours.  It would be nice if more cashiers were available instead of the self check-out, but that's an unfortunate corporate decision that the local employees can't control.

name: Jared Adams
text: Excellent Food/Items, Great Prices, Wonderful Employees

name: Bargainomics Lady
text: More grocery than full size Walmart, this is a great stop whenever I'm on that side of town.

name: Brian Bonds
text: Their deli section has surprisingly good baby back ribs! They also have better than average rotisserie chicken and pork loin, hot. The selection in there grocery store is about average and their pricing is about average. But their produce does seem to be fresher than most.

name: Chris M
text: Bathrooms are clean and most of their self checkouts work. Nothing is ever in stock and if you ask most employees there for help, prepare for them to look like you just asked them to help you move furniture.

name: Manlif Barnes
text: Generally we have a good experience there. We have used every service offered there. Online Pick up is convenient since we live so near. They stock a large variety of items for a neighborhood store. We shop there a lot!

name: Jeannell Ashley
text: I'm giving it a star!! Shouldn't even get a star!! I was in there and NOT ONE OPEN REGULAR CASH REGISTER!! ALL Scan & Go were operating. It's after 8 in the morning you can run a regular cash register. I HATE Scan & Go!! To me, this shows laziness of your workers not running at least ONE regular cash register!!

name: Portia Perrucci
text:
An update from my original review. I am now giving this store a 1 star because  of employees. I guess the nice employees that were helpful and kind are gone. I was in your store today 10/28/20 between 8:30-8:45am. I needed help scanning a pack of chicken because the bar code was split and and wouldn’t scan. I asked the worker managing the fast check out for help and she already gave me an attitude. She said she was the only one there and that I should have taken my things to a cashier because I had too many things. I thought the self check out lines with the long conveyor belts were for that reason and frankly I can check out myself a lot faster and can sort my groceries better. This is a worker who was rude to me before especially during the beginning of the pandemic. At that time I decided I wasn’t going to shop here anymore because she was so rude. Months have gone by and I decided to give it another try.  Sometimes she’s a greeter and when I come in to shop she never greets me doesn’t even look my way. That’s fine I don’t care. But today with her rude attitude i just felt like it needed to be addressed because it makes me not want to shop here again. She fixed the problem for me  but not without complaining. Mostly complaining because she was manning the express check out alone. But no one was  checking out at the time I asked for help. She was wearing  an animal print mask and has medium length hair, older woman. I tried to see her name tag but it was flipped over and her hair was covering it. Sorry for the rant. I usually keep to myself but that was just unacceptable today. I buy A LOT from your store and you may have just lost a customer all together. Also one other woman is rude to me. She’s also older with straight hair and blunt bangs. And smokes. I onlly know because I see her take her breaks by the soda machines and she’s smoking. They have the same attitude. Never kind or friendly, at least when I’m there. If a worker has that affect on a person where it makes them not want to shop in your store, then something’s not right. Sorry.

*****original review******i shop here quite a good bit and the staff is always so friendly. There is one tall, young lady who helps people at self check out who is so friendly and social. I always appreciate her. The produce department is not the greatest though, wilted greens, moldy strawberries, not fully stocked. I cook (privately for a small community) for a living and I always buy fresh, but this store isn’t the best place to get any produce. Thankfully there's a Fred's across the street. Not worth the hasel anymoee. Replacing Cashier's with non working self checkouts. This is a convenient location but I could have driven to target or sprouts for this.

You literally spend more time waiting in line than you do shopping. So far the self checkouts have had a negative impact on this location.

text:
This is perhaps the worst Wal-Mart I've ever been to. It's very close to my house so I went for convenience, however I'm finally done and will never be returning.

I have been double charged many times, had my change shorted, cashiers forgetting to give me my cash back before moving to the next person, customer service taking upwards of 10 minutes just to handle one customer, and the list goes on and on. The inventory is in the most awkward places imaginable, you can't go in here without seeing confused people scanning all the aisles for the simplest item that happens to be far from its logical location.

Trust me when I tell you, take the extra few minutes and go to the Wal-Mart on Montgomery Highway, it is far and beyond better than this lame excuse for a store.

name: BamaLen G.
text:
Ok....This one really chapped my behind!!  It was a late night grocery run.  I was tired, and I'm disabled.  I normally shop at other stores closer to home.  But, WalMart has a huge selection!  So, I figured I'd give them a chance.  It only took one....  "One and DONE," as they say.
I purchased a number of diet coke 2 liers, as they were on sale.  And, when I got home...the 2 liters ended up all over my driveway...rolling toward the street!  Why??  Because the person who bagged my items, apparently didn't double bag many of them!  And, GET THIS...some of the double bagged 2 liters...ALSO ended up on the driveway!  So....I grabbed some of those SAME KINDS OF BAGS...from Kroger...and rebagged them!  The SINGLE Kroger bags were much stronger than the DOUBLE Walmart bags!!  That tells me one thing...Walmart executives are IDIOTS!!!!  They purchase CHEAP bags that fall apart...to save money! Right?  But in order to keep groceries from tearing apart...their check-out people have to use THREE TIMES AS MANY!!!  Where did these idiots get their educations???  They OBVIOUSLY have ZERO COMMON SENSE!!!  As a 27 year banking executive...it blows my mind, at the shere incompetence of these people!!
Anyway...I'm finished venting.
All I know is, I will NOT...be giving anymore of my money to walmart.  They'll just waste it on other STUPID ideas that wastes dollars.

name: Chris Needham
text: The cameras are intense and insulting . You get people working for free ringing up their own groceries on self checkout and you put cameras on them like they're thieves.  Who is the thief ? We're the ones working for free ...

name: Mike Slicer
text: I literally can say that this is the worst grocery store I have ever visited and that's not me exaggerating. I live maybe half a mile from this place and I find myself going to other stores just to avoid this poorly run establishment. Where to start? Well, the customer service is a JOKE. I think most of their employees view this place as somewhere where they can cut up, joke around, slack off,and get a paycheck. Most of them should be sent to Publix for a day or two so they can learn how employees should treat customers and maybe how to have a little civilization and manners. You don't get the "hello sir or mam how can I help you today?" like you would get at a Publix. At this location you get a "what you need?". Also, call me crazy, but I'm not big on stockers and workers walking around with pants drooping so low that their underwear is exposed, but that's common here. Other then that, the store isn't very neat and tidy. Its usually messy with misplaced items all over. The store usually doesn't come off as clean either. All I know is that I go to other Walmart Neighborhood Markets and they are night and day compared to this one and you have to ask why..In my opinion this store is a prime example as to what happens when management doesn't do their jobs and tolerates kind of a no pride attitude from their staff. Horrible store. Also, watch out for an employee named Lynn. She works in customer service and literally treats people like they're inmates and she's a corrections officer. THE rudest employee I've ever come across anywhere. How she has a job is beyond me.

text: Everytime i go there the website says it open but when i get there they are closed. I had to send my daughter there today to get another cast cover and the website said you close at 3 and she went at 2 and y'all closed. If you going to close early you need to update the website please.

name: Carl Bono
text:
I used to go to the big national pharmacies because it *seemed* so convenient.  That is until I got prescribed something that those stores don't regularly stock.  So, I checked out Snider's.  I was immediately impressed with their level of service and with the fact that I didn't get the "We'll have it ready in 45-60 minutes" deal... they had my prescription ready in less than 10 minutes (may have been less than 5).  Not only that, but they actually seemed happy to be doing their job and pleased to have my business.  I've since switched to using Snider's for all of my family's prescriptions.

PRICES:  I was a little worried about a local place being more expensive because surely they don't have the same buying power of the big guys.  However, to my pleasant surprise, the prices/co-pays from Snider's are in-line with the national chains and even beat the chains on some prescriptions I've gotten.

In short... I highly recommend using Snider's.  They provide top notch service with a great personal touch that you can only get from a locally owned establishment.  Give them a try, I bet you'll be as impressed as I am!

name: Shea
text: I know several others who won't go anywhere else. While visiting my home town a friend suggested Sniders to get my rx filled. It's a special compound so I can't just go anywhere.  I am so impressed at the professionalism, knowledge, courtesy and how quick Brett got my medication made.  The warm "family" feeling you get from a local business like this made it feel the same as it did 20 something years ago when I lived here before Chelsea "grew up."   I'm thankful that some still hold these values that make people feel like family, not just a customer.  That keeps people coming back.  When in town I will go no where else but Sniders.   So from normal scripts to special compounds, Sniders is the only place in Chelsea to go!!

name: Shea Bailey
text: Hands down best pharmacy in Chelsea! Everyone is always welcoming and helpful, and the pharmacists always take time to explain and answer questions. I never feel rushed when I come here. resp.text:
Mrs. Greene, we are sincerely sorry you had a negative experience with us. The insurance card you provided us was not an insurance card, it was a prescription discount program (as it states on the actual card itself). The discount program would not pay for that particular medication at our pharmacy. Normally it takes 5-10 minutes for us to fill a prescription. It did take us slightly longer with yours as we were working diligently to solve the aforementioned issue for you. Again, I apologize for your wait and hope that you will give us the opportunity to exceed your expectations in the future. We will always do everything within our ability to make sure our patients are taken care of.

B.J. Jones
- Pharmacist/Owner

text: I have been a patient here for about 4 years. Just recently my 5 year old son had to get put on ADHD medicine. School has been in for less than a month, and we are still trying to figure out what medicine works good for him. Just recently he was put on one that he is making him worse than he was without it. Lots of side effects. I have been trying to get in touch with the doctor since Monday. The phone nurse Linda was rude to me stating she got both of my messages and can't help me. I have also left a message for the nurse Allison and faxed her my son's questionare with a note to call me. All of this happened Monday and Tuesday.  Tomorrow is Friday and  I still have not received any help on my child's medicine. I'm now considering going to his pediatrician for his medicine. He doesn't have an appointment for 2 weeks and can't wait that long.

resp.text: Hi Sandy, please feel free to contact our office manager at 3347027222 ext 209 and we are sorry for any inconvenience this has caused you.

name: Alexandra Stegall
text:
I am a retired veteran that was admitted to this hospital twice during my Service as an active duty soldier at Fort Rucker, AL. I was experiencing PTSD and extreme distress during my service and was admitted to this hospital’s behavioral health unit twice within a year. Here’s my story:

The first time I was admitted, it was voluntary...
I was going through a lot on base, where I lived. My chain of command in the military allowed me to admit myself for a short period of time. They wanted me to get myself together and have me go back to continuing my service.

The neglect for patients here was disgusting to say the least. The staff allowed my chain of command to enter the unit without my password. They were the last people I wanted to see. I was sure that this was illegal and requested to speak to a supervisor, who told me it was my mistake for not turning them away. Being a soldier, I knew she did not understand that I could not do that and she clearly did not care about the law that her staff was breaking. This was not the only kind of neglect I witnessed/experienced. The geriatrics room was so sad. The older patients are sat down in chairs all day and night, in front of a tv. One of the older men was taken into a private room with a female tech. When they came out, he had a bloody mark on his forehead. Some of us patients noticed but felt that nobody would do anything about it. Another older gentleman in the geriatrics room died while I was there. Nobody knew the cause but he was wrapped up in a sheet and placed into a giant gray bin and wheeled away in front of all of the other patients!

During this first stay at this hospital, there was a day where a group of student nurses were visiting to observe the staff and patients. They were observing a therapy group where the therapist was breaking HIPAA laws and verbally exposing each patient’s diagnosis in front of all of the other patients, as well as the student nurses.

The second time I was admitted, I was court ordered. My command knew I was in distress and did not know what to do with me. I was sent to this hospital a second time and knew that it would not be a long stay. I was met by two giant men, telling me I have been court ordered to the psychiatric unit. I knew that something wasn’t right and that the court order was not justified. This time, they admitted me to the third-floor. There were beds available on the second floor but had decided that I would be better off on the third floor. Anyone who has been to this unit, knows that the third floor is for patients with severe mental health issues... this time, there was a poster on the wall with all of the patient rights (that wasn’t there before)... I read all of my rates and noticed that it said that I could request a patient advocate and a lawyer. When I approached the glass window at the desk, I requested Mary Anne, A wonderful recreational therapist that I remembered from my first stay- as well as a lawyer!... I was met with a nasty attitude and told to sit down because I was court ordered. At this point, I was panicking and angry so I threw a fit in order to get the attention of whoever was above this woman telling me to take a seat. When I got the supervisors attention, I requested that lawyer and therapist. The lawyer asked me if I had been “Baker Acted” but I had no idea what that meant. He pulled up my information on a computer and informed me that I had not been “baker acted” and could leave anytime I wanted. I was out of there within a few hours!

What a horrifying experience this was. The neglect and abuse here is disgusting and I would never EVER recommend anyone admit themselves to this hospital!

text:
in the last week
I went to McDowell with anxiety and depression that escalated into a passive death wish. McDowell actually laughed when I explained my thoughts and feelings. After a ten minute appointment in which she never made eye contact with me she dismissed me with no change in meds. (I shouldn't have expected more. My appointments with her were consistently 10 minutes each after 2+ hours of waiting.) Now, a year later, her office continues to harass me for a fee I refuse to pay because of her negligence and the totally unacceptable lack of care I received. I've never met a psychiatrist so utterly unconcerned with their patients' well being.

text: This shop has actually everything I need when I can’t get something in need right away.  I’m actually surprised of some reviews on here. Crystals are expensive anyways so if you are getting them cheaper than what they originally sale for than they are probably not real, especially rare crystals. I would definitely recommend this shop to anyone looking for great quality products but if you are looking for something cheap then you definitely need to research other options! Everything in this shop are actually underpriced from what I know. Thanks for a great experience! I will be a regular customer!

resp.text:
We deeply regret you feel this way. Our crystals are all ethically acquired and purchased directly from the mines that do not utilize slave and child labor.
There is no Reiki class per se. There is a Reiki introduction workshop to inform in depth of the history of Reiki. The actual Reiki teaching is done on an individual one on one basis, and currently we have 3 students who come in weekly for their separate studies.
We earnestly hope you find what you need.
Be Blessed.

text: Very friendly and they take "the difference card", something my company uses to partially self-fund insurance.  There does seem to be trouble communicating properly. Multiple times I have called in refills on two or prescriptions and get there and they only had filled one.  Two months ago, they apparently filled a script but owed me some pills.  They wrote it on the bottle (that I didn't see right away) but failed to tell me when I picked it up.  All-in-all, I do like this business.  I try and support local pharmacies, so I will keep using them.  I don't consider a three star review to be bad.  I guess both me and the staff have a bit of improvement we can do.

I was recommended by 2 pharmacies to call Bendall’s. They had my medicine in in less than 24 hours and had no problem running the coupon given to me by my doctor! All of their staff was helpful and polite!
Also, they have things like free coffee/water (even though there was basically no wait time) and also carried some snacks for very cheap prices which my daughter loved!

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to help you. Please come by again. TIm Douthit.

text: We purchased Sunmark mucus relief cough Children's compare to children's MUCINEX cough today at 12:33PM. When I poured the medicine into the dosage cup it came in up to the 5mL line I knew it looked like way more than 5 mL. So I drawled the medicine from the dosage cup up in several other droppers to see and it was actually 10mL instead of 5mL. The dosage cup that came with the medicine was way off and I could have overdosed my child if I didn't catch this. I called the number on the back of the box to let them know the dosage cup is way off to prevent other children from being overdosed and they said this has actually had a recall since back in January and they were supposed to be removed off the shelf. But Bendall's did not remove this off the shelf! It was still on the shelf and being purchased almost a year after it's been recalled!!
